results.description:
Hey, Brick Oven Bakers!

Please volunteer to help build the core of the new Old Stone House community oven, fireplace, and hearth from start to finish, and learn the secrets of brick oven construction from professional oven mason Pat Manley.

This Meetup is now FREE. Space is limited because only 8 people can work on the oven efficiently at once. So if you RSVP "yes" and then can't make it, please change your RSVP to "no" so someone else can get a spot.


No prior masonry experience needed.

We're building the core of the oven from Wednesday, April 27, through Monday, May 2.

Please volunteer for as many (or as few) days as you can make it, on any combination of days. The more you help, the more you'll learn!

Every day you'll get to:


- Participate in building the core of the oven and hearth 
- Learn about materials, masonry techniques, and oven engineering
- Ask lots of questions and take photos of the process 
- Learn from Pat's over twenty years of oven-building experience 
- Hang out with Pat over beer in the evenings

Different stages of the process will occur on different days, including: groundwork, the base slab, framing the door and arch, laying the door and arch, oven insulation, and facing. We'll also be laying the fireplace and hearth. You'll get to work on different parts of the process depending on which days you attend.

You should plan to wear closed-toe shoes -- wear boots if possible -- and bring work gloves and a bottle of water. We'll provide snacks! This is an all-day event, so you should plan to bring lunch, or you can get lunch from one of the great local shops and restaurants around the park.

About the Mason

Pat has over twenty years of experience building brick ovens for restaurants, bakeries, vineyards, and backyards all over the country, and has taught dozens of oven-building workshops to beginners and professionals. And every year Pat leads Masons on a Mission to build masonry stoves in Guatemala.


Whether you want to build your own backyard oven, or work in a bakery, or just want to learn a new skill, this is a great learning opportunity!

If you have questions about the project, write to Jace at [masked].


See you soon!
results.name: Volunteer Community Oven Building with Pat the mason - Friday

results.description:
Hello Fam!

This week we have the pleasure of having Paul Bianco of ffVC come and share his journey.

Paul joined ff Venture Capital in early 2013 and is currently a Director at the firm. In this role, Paul is member of the Acceleration & Diligence Teams. As a member of ffVC’s Acceleration Team, Paul works alongside portfolio companies, assisting them with developing financial models, budgeting, planning, financial analysis, and other financial and operational matters. Paul also leads the financial piece of ffVC’s Due Diligence process.

Prior to ffVC, Paul has worked in consulting & asset management. Paul Graduated from the State University of New York at Albany with a BS in Accounting and is Certified Public Accountant in the State of New York.

We'll get a chance to hear about his journey, with Q&A and community shout outs afterwards! Also join us for good coffee and excellent conversation.


Until then, stay cool and classy... See you this Friday!

Future events:

results.description:
On Wednesday May 4th the Africa Open Data Community(AODC) will host a one-day event in Cape Town, South Africa, at the edge of the regional Open Government Partnership Summit hosted by the Government of South Africa. As committed community members and experts in this field we hope you will join us in helping develop and shape this one-day event as a continued effort from AODC to expand awareness of the benefits of open data for Africa and increase participation and new partnerships across multiple sectors and disciplines. Please see the current working draft of the agenda here: http://bit.ly/SA_AODC_1Pager The target themes for this event are how open data can help achieve the SDGs and ensuring the private sector knows the value and leadership potential in open data for Africa. As ever we welcome any comments, criticisms, or concerns and look forward to adding new names and faces to the community as presenters and participants.

As discussed at the last monthly call this advisory call will occur each Friday 3:30pm SAST until the conference. These are open calls, feel free to invite others to participate. Notes will be taken and shared at http://bit.ly/AODC_CapeTownMay4_Feedback
results.name: Planning Open Data for Sustainable Development in Cape Town: May 4

Get ready to ROCK your golf season!  Join our first 18-hole meetup of the season Friday April 29.  Only $55 includes 18 holes of golf plus cart (discount rate even for nonresidents and guests, regularly $89 for outings).

We'll start with lunch at noon in the Red Knot (order on your own off their regular menu, fast and easy).  Pat will share tips to ROCK your golf season with a 90-day Success System.


Our tee times start at 2pm sharp, Pat will create the pairings, you may request 1 out of your foursome (so we all get to meet new people!) 

As you may know, Galloping Hill, Union County's premier course. Open to all, even non-residents for this event. Only 20 spaces, starting at 2PM. FYI they have a nice clubhouse, bar and restaurant with indoor and outdoor patio seating. Located inside the brand new Clubhouse at Galloping Hill Golf Course, Red Knot offers Gastro Pub fare with an upscale flair. Conveniently located right off exit 138 on the Garden State Parkway, Red Knot is open to the public seven days a week. With floor to ceiling windows, Red Knot captures the fantastic view of the course’s rolling landscape.


We must give the final count and by EOD Tuesday, April 26th. You will be responsible for your tee time fee if you don't show up. Please text or call me at 973-[masked] with questions. You mail email me outside of this meetup group at [masked].  (Sometimes messages get lost in meetup's system, sorry)

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
We will have an introductory talk and then a discussion about the philosophy of one of the foremost thinkers of the 20th Century, Martin Heidegger. Through an investigation into the seminal themes of his text, Being and Time, we will look at Heidegger’s descriptions of ourselves as “Dasein,” (Being There”) in terms of his analyses of “possibility,” “facticity,” “authenticity,” “dread,”, “fallenness,” and “Being-Toward-Death.” Seminar will initially concentrate on two introductory concerns: the early influences upon Heidegger’s thinking (Nietzsche, Kierkegaard, Holderlin) and Husserl’s method of pure phenomenology.

After this event at 7 pm, we will have a discussion Superintelligence vs. Superconsciousness

Nick Bostrom defines superintelligence as "an intellect that is much smarter than the best human brains in practically every field, including scientific creativity, general wisdom and social skills." Advanced AI would be able to reprogram and improve itself – a feature called "recursive self-improvement". It would then be even better at improving itself, and could continue doing so in a rapidly increasing cycle, leading to a super-intelligence. This scenario is known as an intelligence explosion. Such an intelligence would not have the limitations of human intellect, and may be able to invent or discover almost anything. Will it be possible to construct a seed AI or otherwise to engineer initial conditions so as to make an intelligence explosion survivable? How could one achieve a controlled detonation?

A human-like reasoner that could think millions of times faster than current humans would have a dominant advantage in most reasoning tasks, particularly ones that require haste or long strings of actions. However, it's definitely not clear if super-intelligence will come with super-consciousness, because at some point they might split and develop itself in their own way?

As usual, free wine, cheese and plenty of intellectual pleasure
results.name: Martin Heidegger's Magical Philosophy

group.name: The NYC Continental Philosophy Reading Meetup Group

results.description:
Please join us on Friday evening, April 29th, at The Olivia (315 West 33rd Street, 7th floor), for a TEDxNewYork Salon on the  subject 

"10 Ways to Have a Better Conversation"

with Ron Gross, , featuring  a TED talk (video) by Celeste Headlee,  followed by facilitated conversation.


Doors open at 5:00 pm, the screening begins at 5:30 pm, the  meeting adjourns at 6:30.

RSVP by 4/26 noon, to [masked] .  Seating is limited.


For nearly six years, this  unique salon has gathered thinkers, doers and change-agents in the spirit of sharing ideas worth spreading. 


About the Facilitator

Ron Gross - Ron is the founder/director of Conversations New York, which promotes free conversations throughout the city through its website:  <a>www.conversationsnewyork.com.  </a>

He  co-chairs the University Seminar on Innovation at Columbia University.  His books include Peak Learning, Socrates’ Way, The New Professionals, Individualism, and Independent Scholarship. In 2013 Ron was inducted into the Hall of Fame for Lifelong Learning of the International Adult and Continuing Education Association. Formerly with the Ford Foundation, he has led lifelong learning initiatives in Europe, the Far East, Israel, Canada, Thailand, Bangladesh, and Mexico.
results.name: TEDxNY Salon on "10 Ways to Have a Better Conversation" with Ron Gross

Ron Gross - Ron is the founder/director of Conversations New York, which promotes free conversations throughout the city through its website:  <a>www.conversationsnewyork.com.  </a>

He  co-chairs the University Seminar on Innovation at Columbia University.  His books include Peak Learning, Socrates’ Way, The New Professionals, Individualism, and Independent Scholarship. In 2013 Ron was inducted into the Hall of Fame for Lifelong Learning of the International Adult and Continuing Education Association. Formerly with the Ford Foundation, he has led lifelong learning initiatives in Europe, the Far East, Israel, Canada, Thailand, Bangladesh, and Mexico.

results.description:
Join us as Arteum Goncharov (co-founder & CEO) gives a talk on MarsPolar via LiveStream from Russia. MarsPolar is a private crowd-sourced initiative, which aims to research and plan the establishment of a human colony on Mars.

Come watch this LiveStream with us at NYIT, ask your questions to Arteum and network with everyone afterwards. 

This #SpaceTalk can also be freely viewed on LiveStream.com:

• https://livestream.com/accounts/42333/marspolar-spacetalk-1

MarsPolar is an extremely fast growing international group of space enthusiasts, scientists, engineers, designers and dreamers, who plan to work to push the boundaries of space exploration. We are working to establish connections with researchers, scientists, space agencies and private space companies. Then we intend to dedicate specialized teams to try and work on specific problems, that help us reach closer to the dream of establishing a settlement on Mars.

Agenda 

1. Introduction
2. History and description of MarsPolar project
3. Goals and Current objectives
4. Research directions: Landing site. Situation of Radiation during spaceflight and on the planet. Solar particle event and Galactic Cosmic Rays protection options. Magnetic field of Mars and local magnetization of landing site. Plant growth.

5. Answering questions

Learn more about MarsPolar on their website at:

• http://marspolar.space/

Thank you you Columbia Space Initiative for the event space:

• http://columbiaspace.org/

Each dollar you pay towards events may be counted towards you becoming an official NewSpace NYC Co-Op Member. Although this event is only $1, donation may be made here on our Meetup or at the event. 

Students are free for this event with a valid ID. Please just RSVP or message.

* NOTE If you already paid for the previous MarsPolar event that got rescheduled you're good to go, just RSVP.

results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
RSVP here - signups on this meetup page will not be counted 


Space will be limited. 


Join latinoTech and the Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers (SHPE) at WorkVille (on April 29th-30th) to hack service and operation solutions for The LSA Family Health Service, a critical East Harlem community-based organization.

Little Sisters of the Assumption Family Health Service has operated in El Barrio / East Harlem since 1958. But their roots go back to 1891, when the first Little Sisters of the Assumption (LSA) arrived here from Paris to nurse the “sick poor” in their own homes with respect and dignity. Those first LSA visiting nurses saw themselves as catalysts for change in the lives of vulnerable families. They believed in what we now call social justice and empowerment, with health and well being forming a cornerstone of strength, just as they still believe today. 

Today, as a secular nonprofit agency, they proudly honor their mission, roots and their founders’ choice to value and respect diversity and the differences between us. LSA Family Health Service provides advocacy, food pantry, early childhood intervention, youth, parenting, environmental health and education services.

On April 29th and 30th latinoTech joins the Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers to present a new hackathon, centered on identifying operational and service solutions to advance the mission of the LSA Family Health Service. The event will take place at WorkVille, a uniquely fresh NYC co-working space,

---

RSVP here -signups on this meetup page will not be counted 

--- 

Agenda

Friday:

6:00 pm – 10:00 pm Kickoff, challenges and teamwork

Saturday:

9:30 am – Team problem solving

12:00 pm – Lunch

4:30 pm Presentations and judging

5:30 pm – Winners announced


Why should I attend?

This latinoTech hack is an event for programmers, product developers, graphic designers, interface designers, project managers, academics and community leaders to collaborate intensively on developing a software and service solution(s) that advances the organization’s mission. The two day event will be fun, challenging and present an opportunity for latinoTech members and partners to learn, share and network with Latina/o tech professionals.

The event will cost $6.00 and select sponsorship opportunities will be available. Please come to support the community.

---

RSVP here -signups on this meetup page will not be counted
Space will be limited. 


---

Interested in volunteering?


If hackathons are your thing, we need you. We will have some light and fun volunteer opportunities for you to contribute to. Please sign up here.

---

#latinoTech

Thanks to Workville for the venue.

Thanks to AppNexus, Digital Ocean, and Tumblr for your continued support.

------------------------------ 

Follow us to stay in the loop with all things #latinoTech

Twitter // Instagram// Facebook // Tumblr// LinkedIn // Newsletter

results.description:
If you're interested in getting on a stage in a low pressure environment to try some improv, this event is for you! I have reserved space at the basement stage of the Triple Crown Ale House. We will likely to do some warmups, 2-person scenes, and then do some short sets with other more veteran improvisers. Participate as much or as little as you would like. Or simply come and watch! 

All who attend will get to do 2-person scenes and a bigger jam set at the end!  This is the most low pressure fun performance opportunity out there - perfect for all!  If you're think you're ready, you're ready!  All scenes will be inspired by a suggestion of a random word from the audience.  


I've also invited improvisers from the NYC improv community to attend as well.  So you may get to play with some veteran improvisers as well.

----

Arrive at 5:45pm if you want to do some improv warmups.  The jam will start right at 6pm sharp!

----

Please, no outside food or water of any kind, including water bottles.  The Triple Crown offers food and drink discounts for those with this improv show.  They offer 10% off food, and $4 select draft beers.

venue.name: Rubin Museum of Art - K2 Lounge / Cafe Serai

results.description:
We will have several meetup groups and a reserved section near the DJ Booth inside the lounge area.

200+ Expected

NO cover and free admission to the museum

2 for 1 drinks from 6 to 7PM

Try to Altar Everything Exhibition


March 11 – August 1

For nearly half a century Genesis Breyer P-Orridge has been questioning the meaning and substance of identity through artistic endeavors, willful reincarnation, and physical shapeshifting. Try to Altar Everything, a selection of paintings, sculptures, and installations, will explore the ways that Hindu mythology and Nepal’s Kathmandu Valley have influenced the artist and h/er work.
results.name: Wine and Culture at the Rubin

Join us this weekend for our Social Fridays @ Hudson Terrace. 

The list for free entry will be open from 6pm-10pm. Later that night we will go to Skyroom rooftop for the after party (walking distance) . Admission is free before midnight.

Hudson Terrace is one of the most popular venues here in New York! 

Mention Rory to the door person for free admission.

Dress code is business casual.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

There is a 2 hour open bar (free drinks) from 6-8pm

Feel free to invite your friends, colleagues, and classmates.

It's going to be a fun Friday!

Do contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers

results.description:
Click the link below to RSVP to this event:


http://www.bigmaven.com/experience/ny-adventure-club-reserved-section-rubin-museums-k2-friday-nights/

Join New York Adventure Club as we visit the Rubin Museum’s K2 Friday Nights series, a celebrated Naked Soul & Jazz music series, which includes cocktails, music, free museum tours, films, and more!

We’ll have a reserved section in Café Serai, which offers a special pan-Asian tapas menu to accompany the evening’s DJ and programs. Happy Hour runs from 6:00–7:00 p.m. with a 2-for-1 special on all beer, wine, and well drinks.

results.description:
Ashok Jain Gallery is pleased to announce, Wordless Dimension, a solo exhibition of artworks by Janusz Obst at 58 Hester Street. Opening on Wednesday, April 27, the exhibition is the presentation of bas-reliefs.

“I believe in staying true to myself throughout the creative process of wordless expression, regardless of past influences and current trends.”
- Janusz Obst

Janusz Obst is a classically trained artist from Zamosc, Poland, where he was born in 1946. As a young marine, he travelled the world, having spent much of his young adult life in Europe, China, Africa, and India. It was in India where he was captivated by sculpture, and for the last three decades he has focused his work on bas-relief.

Bas-reliefs, traditionally having been painted, give Janusz the opportunity to resurrect his love for this classic art form and marry his passion for sculpture and painting. This methodology allows him to freely build three-dimensional space and to broaden the narrative possibilities within each piece. His art permeates the interaction between the history of civilization, individual fate, current social and community-based issues, and his unfaltering interest in the interpersonal relationships within the context of the modern world.
Janusz moved to the United States in 1991, and he currently lives in New York City.

The opening reception for Wordless Dimension will be on Friday, April 29, 2016.
results.name: Janusz Obst's Wordless Dimension

This is a German Movie Night presented by Goethe Institut. Many people simply go to see the movie, so don't expect as much socializing/meeting new people as on our monthly meetups. Sometimes a small group heads on out to have drinks afterwards though.

It is a public event, there is no specific area for our group.

The language of the movie is GERMAN, but it will have ENGLISH SUBTITLES. 

The movie starts at 06:30pm, please arrive early as oftentimes the place fills up and it's strictly first come first serve. If you arrive late, you may not get a seat.

Whisky mit Wodka (2008 - 104min.) - directed by Andreas Dresen

When actor Otto Killberg misses a shooting day because of a hangover, he gets an understudy, leading to on-set rivalry and intrigue in this tragicomic film about filmmaking.

More info on the film on Wikipedia (in German only).

Is there a Cover charge?

No, the event is free.

Do I have to speak German to attend?

No. Just keep in mind that this movie is shown in German, with English subtitles.

How do I get there by subway?

4/5/6 & N/Q/R: Union Square - 2 Blocks away

L: 3rd Avenue or Union Square - 2 Blocks away

1/2/3 & A/C/E & F/M: Transfer to L at 14th Street

To contact Goethe Institut directly about this event, you can call them at[masked] or send an e-mail to [masked] 

Please enjoy the event, and as always, please update your RSVP if your plans change, it is highly appreciated and helps more than you may think.


Thomas

results.description:
On April 29th at 6:30pm, Launch NJ will be hosting our Entrepreneur Tank event alongside the Drew University Business School Shark Tank event!

The night will be a great networking and learning experience as we will have three entrepreneurs from the community pitching their startups. After the pitches we will conclude the night with an after party in Mead Hall at Drew University!

The event will function similarly to Shark Tank, but instead of entrepreneurs pitching their startups for funding, they will be pitching their startups to get valuable feedback on their business and pitch. We put entrepreneurs in front of a panel of experts from many different disciplines (CEO, CFO, Marketing, Legal, Investing, Tech, etc…), give them 10 minutes to pitch their startup, we then have 20 minutes of feedback from the panel in regards to their pitch and business, and then 5 minutes of Q&A with the audience. The added value with the event is that we will also have an audience in attendance watching the process, and we hope that this will create an event where the community can learn alongside the entrepreneurs as they develop their pitches and startups.

Here are the list of startups pitching on the night of:

Launchable Labs - http://www.launchablelabs.com/

Picketfencer - http://www.picketfencer.com/

Vocate Academy - http://www.vocateacademy.com/

Hope to see everyone out that evening!


Schedule:

6:30pm - 7:00pm Open networking and food

7:00pm - 8:45pm Startup pitches and feedback

8:45pm - 9:30pm After party in Mead Hall

Directions:

The event will be held at Brothers College at Drew University. The address for Drew is 36 Madison Avenue, Madison NJ. Attendees should park in Tilghman Parking lot, and walk across campus to the Brothers College building. From 6:30 to 7:00pm the event will be held in the lobby of the building, and once the pitches start we will transition to the building’s lecture rooms. A campus map can be found below:
results.name: Launch NJ Entrepreneur Tank!

Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

¡Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
We will power up the Major Welch, take in the sunset & socialize briefly at Perkins Tower, then descend on the AT.

We will meet in the main parking lot. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun.

This is not a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. While it is only four miles, there is significant elevation gain on the Major Welch.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together. The amount of time we spend at Perkins will depend upon the weather. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.

results.description:
As part of Jazz Appreciation Month & our Birthday Tribute to great Jazz musicians, La Maison d'Art Gallery will present the 3rd Annual Tribute to DUKE ELLINGTON.

Elise Wood Quartet once again to pay homage to a legendary great Jazz musician - the one and only Duke Ellington! featuring;

Ian McDonalds, Piano
Harvie S, Bass
Elise Wood, flute & alto flute
Tony Hewitt, vocals
& Special guests

Suggested Donation: $15
Complimentary Wine bar and appetizers
Limited seating - join us promptly

Where else to celebrate his birthday than Harlem, where his music became so famous in the 20's. He defined that generation and gave it a sound. Duke just happened to be there at the right time of the Harlem Renaissance and was the best at what he did. The Harlem Renaissance was led by intellectuals of every field and Duke was one of them.

Selecting from his repertoire -that is internationally heralded as one of the greatest in Jazz - the Quartet will play only his compositions. Each musician - a bandleader in his own right - will be featured in the one hour concert.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/3rd-annual-duke-ellington-birthday-tribute-elise-wood-quartet-tickets-24943635084
results.name: 3rd Annual Birthday Tribute to Duke Ellington by Elise Wood Quartet

results.description:
Join the Time's Up organization on their monthly critical mass ride! Critical Mass is a spontaneous celebration of what our streets could look like. This fun group ride encourages new cyclists and creates safer streets and new green infrastructure. Strap some music to your bike and make sure to bring the appropriate lights and bells!


Date: Friday, 4/29/2016 
Time: 7:00 PM 
Meeting Place: Union Square North


(the story behind critical mass...)

In New York City during the 1990's, bicycling was extremely dangerous. The number one complaint of cyclists was always safety. Group bicycle rides, like the critical mass, were one of the few places where cyclists could ride together and be safe. Besides their safe and fun dynamic, the group rides steadily attracted new riders which in turn built up the confidence in the riders to become everyday commuters.

In early 2000, the New York City critical mass started gaining huge popularity due to it's celebratory spirit and safe community environment. Bikers of all types would meet the last Friday of every month, as they do in over two hundred cities around the globe, for the monthly critical mass rides. The critical mass ride in New York City has always been a place where new riders could feel safe while building a strong community voice for non polluting transportation.

Eventually, after much persistence and global media embarrassment, the bicycle community got their way and New York City hired a new and bike friendly D.O.T commissioner who had vision. Today, our new greener, safer and bike friendly city is now enjoyed by all. In fact, the very spot in Times Square where each month thousands of cyclists raised their bikes over their heads is now an auto free zone.

Thank you New York City critical mass for this positive sustainable change!

For more information check out http://times-up.org/rides/critical-mass/
results.name: Monthly Critical Mass Ride

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually.

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player.

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

results.description:
Join the party on April 29 at the Midtown Loft and Terrace from 7 - 10 pm as we celebrate Peru’s pride, joy and spirit: Pisco!

Just like any proud mother, Peru wants to show off its favorite offspring by creating an event just for you! The third annual 7 Piscos: 14 Cocktails – Ceviche and Pisco Party will take place on April 29 from 7-10 pm and will allow you to personally experience delicious ways to utilize Pisco, apart from the traditional Pisco Sour and Chilcano. You will have complete access to 14 mouth-watering summer cocktails from seven different Pisco brands. This makes a total of fourteen innovative drinks made by very creative mixologists that blend Peruvian flavors such as our yellow spicy pepper and tropical fruit like mango, into the perfect refreshing combination. The summer is coming up and we want you to choose which cocktail will be in season. A DJ will help us set the mood while we show off how versatile, easy to blend and tasty it is to use Pisco instead of other liquors while you enjoy the party. 

Served by 2 restaurants, Coco Roco and Runa, the menu will feature two different kinds of ceviches. The first one, “clasico,” made with fresh fish and lemon while the second one, called “mixto,” includes shrimp, artichoke and a variety of fish. These dishes are Peruvian classics and luckily we have chosen two restaurants that truly master the dish. Apart from ceviche, we will also be serving fresh salads, one with Peruvian avocados and the other with quinoa. Our typical “Aji de Gallina,” which is shredded chicken in a yellow pepper sauce, will also be served along with Shrimp “Quinoto,” which will surely leave you satisfied. To sweeten the deal, Peruvian truffles and alfajores are for dessert. 

Tickets cost $78.00 each and include as many Pisco cocktails as you can drink (hopefully you will have the opportunity to try all 14) as well as complementary appetizers (as mentioned before) that have been meticulously prepared. Your ticket pre-purchase enters you into a draw for some exciting raffle prizes including bottles of Pisco, a trip to Lima, Peru for two and other prizes.

Our Pisco is produced from eight kinds of grape grown in Pisco, Peru. Those eight varieties are evenly divided into Non-Aromatic (Quebranta, Negra Criolla, Mollar, Uvina) and Aromatic (Italia, Toronelo, Moscatel, Albilla). 
Then, each grape can be processed using three styles: Puro (uses only one grape), Acholado (blends different types of grapes), and Mosto Verde (in which the fermentation process is halted).

We look forward to seeing you at #7Piscos on April 29, 2016 at the Midtown Loft and Terrace located on 267 5th Ave.
Supported by the Trade Commission of Peru in New York

Tickets:  http://www.naturallyperu.nyc/new-events/2016/4/29/7-piscos-14-cocktails-1
results.name: Peruvian night party: 7 Piscos 14 Cocktails

About Irma Caceres “StarSpirit Woman”

Irma StarSpirit Woman is a Medicine Woman honoring the ways of the curanderas (medicine healers) & her Mayan Ancestors, her medicine elders, She is a shamanic and Reiki practioner, Certified Crystal Healer, Dreamworker, an Ordained Minister in the Order of Melchizedek, Co-Founder of the New York Shamanic Healing Circle, and core member of the NY Shamanic Circle for 18 years.

StarSpirit Woman uses sound healing, fire readings, crystals, and works with the “poderios”, the elemental forces we need to keep an open channel of communication. Her style is accompanied by prayer work and traditional indigenous ceremonies to heal her community with heart. Irma StarSpirit Woman currently lives in Queens, NY Contact her at [masked] or visit: shamanicfirereiki.com

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

A harrowing adventure was begun that night when Hermel's young daughter was kidnapped during a terrible storm and taken away into the Red Hills by creatures of the night.  Without a second's thought the old gang leaped to action in hot pursuit, taking them into the unknown... down the crooked highway they trod through the stormy night, past the the ancient Scorpion Cave, past the Seven Dead Lake where one died, and another turned aside to pursue his own quest, and Hermel's daughter was rescued from the magical Kobolds.  Finally they came to the mysterious McFearson Farmstead,on the far side of the Red Hills.  They could have turned back.  But there were still three other children to be rescued.  Down the well shaft they descended into the maze of dungeons and caverns, battling the mysterious forces found therein... until finally they came to the haunted cavern-town of Whitewode...

Elthos RPG is an experimental RPG utilizing light-weight mechanics for fast story-oriented play.  We have a couple of open seats for new Players.  The previous Game Test Stories will give you some idea of the nature of the Elthos World, and what kind of adventures one might expect in it.  You're welcome to join in the fun while seats remain open.  To inquire just send me an email and I'll respond asap!

:) Mark
results.why: Its fun!  Especially if you like light weight systems with an emphasis on story, but plenty of tactical elements to make the whole thing a great game.
results.name: Elthos RPG (Experimental) - Yellow Clay Village Campaign

results.description:
Nick Bostrom defines superintelligence as "an intellect that is much smarter than the best human brains in practically every field, including scientific creativity, general wisdom and social skills." Advanced AI would be able to reprogram and improve itself – a feature called "recursive self-improvement". It would then be even better at improving itself, and could continue doing so in a rapidly increasing cycle, leading to a super-intelligence. This scenario is known as an intelligence explosion. Such an intelligence would not have the limitations of human intellect, and may be able to invent or discover almost anything. Will it be possible to construct a seed AI or otherwise to engineer initial conditions so as to make an intelligence explosion survivable? How could one achieve a controlled detonation?

A human-like reasoner that could think millions of times faster than current humans would have a dominant advantage in most reasoning tasks, particularly ones that require haste or long strings of actions. However, it's definitely not clear if super-intelligence will come with super-consciousness, because at some point they might split and develop itself in their own way?

Before this event at 4:30 we will have an introduction and then a deep discussion about the philosophy of one of the foremost thinkers of the 20th Century, Martin Heidegger. Through an investigation into the seminal themes of his text, Being and Time, we will look at Heidegger’s descriptions of ourselves as “Dasein,” (Being There”) in terms of his analyses of “possibility,” “facticity,” “authenticity,” “dread,”, “fallenness,” and “Being-Toward-Death.” Seminar will initially concentrate on two introductory concerns: 1) the early influences upon Heidegger’s thinking (Nietzsche, Kierkegaard, Holderlin) and  2) Husserl’s method of pure phenomenology

As usual, free wine, cheese and plenty of intellectual pleasure
results.name: Superintelligence vs. Superconsciousness: host prof. Bowen

results.description:
Dev Patel and Jeremy Irons in person for Q&A, Fri Apr 29 at 7:15pm! Purchase tickets IN ADVANCE, as it will sell out soon. Let's have a bit to eat after at Red Bamboo (140 w 4th str).

Based on the untold story of one of the greatest minds of his generation, THE MAN WHO KNEW INFINITY charts the incredible life of Srinivasa Ramanujan (Slumdog Millionaire’s Dev Patel), whose genius takes him from the slums of India to Cambridge University. Spurred on by his mentor (Academy Award winner Jeremy Irons), Ramanujan overcomes racism and the rigidity of academia to revolutionize mathematics with his startlingly original theorems, in a fascinating look at how an unlikely, cross-cultural friendship changed the world. Official selection: Toronto International Film Festival

108 Minutes
India/UK

Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
So some good news Dangerfield's Comedy Club the Longest running Comedy club in the world, started by Rodney Dangerfield himself 45 years ago has been generous to extend free tickets to our meetup group. This should be a fun meetup. This is not an Amateur or Gimmick Comedy show, Dangerfields features best of the best comedians who have performed in leading clubs, motion pictures and tv shows such as Tonight Show with Jay leno, Jimmy Fallon, Letterman, Seth meyers, Conan and Comedy Central. HBO's most successful comedy TV specials were taped at this club.

Im very excited to have the meetup here, We are getting tickets that are $40.00 each free for this group, its a 2 drink minimum as in any other club but if you get a drink at the bar before the show it counts toward the drink minimum which is very rare for a comedy club and theres a full food menu. If you want to just stop by have a drink and meet your fellow meetup members and not stay for the show you can do that too youll still get a ticket if you wanna use it for another time.

Hope to see you there. This weeks is hosted by Q (Quinten Heggs), Lineup includes DC Benny, Richie Byrne, Dante Nero, Al D. and Jeff Hernandez.

Ive personally never been to this club, but the Organizer will have a meetup sign, we all sit together, and meet each other so look for the meetup sign and the organizer will give you the Free Tickets.

Show Starts at 8:30, so come at 7:45 to meet your fellow meetup members! Enjoy!
results.name: Dangerfields Meetup Free Tickets!

Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of
hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by

results.description:
“…Religion must not be made into a barrier, separating human being’s spirits from God-given abilities in the knowledge of the truths of the world…”–Sheikh Muhammad ‘Abduh. 

Does religion promote progress? Is reason compatible with faith? Please join us for a reading and discussion of Sheikh Muhammad ‘Abduh’s brilliant text on the role of reason and progress in Islam. If God gave us intellect, how then, ‘Abduh asks, can reason be denied its right? 

Islam calls us to use our minds to take action while our emotions and feelings aid our intellect. All our faculties working in tandem are to be used consciously to the highest possible standard. The true meaning of worship in Islam is to live the whole of our practical lives with the loftiest values, fully using our talents for the good of humanity. In Islam, worship is not limited to devotional practices, like praying and fasting. Worship and faith mean orienting every aspect of our lives towards God. 

What does a life oriented to God look like? It is a life in which we set high standards for ourselves in all areas; a life in which we use our God-given talents to elevate ourselves and our communities to the best of our abilities. It is a life in which we approach God through the totality of the faculties he gave us; a life in which our worship of God, in this broad sense of the word, constitutes the very meaning of our existence. It is, all around, a life of excellence. 

Sheikh Muhammad ‘Abduh [masked]) was an Egyptian religious scholar and reformer. He believed in reason and opposed a rigid, ritualistic or dogmatic approach to Islam. He held high religious posts, including that of Mufti of Egypt. His goal was to reform Islam and put it in harmony with modernity by returning to primitive purity. He is considered the founder of the modernist school in Islam. 

Please feel free to bring healthy snacks to share.

We ask attendees to contribute $5 each for the rental of the location.
results.name: The Pursuit of Knowledge, Excellence and Progress in Islam

results.description:
Salo, or the 120 Days of Sodom is an intensely challenging film, an endurance test which some will find provocative and rewarding, but which many are likely to find repulsive and repugnant. Viewers should be warned: this is not an easy film to watch by any stretch of the imagination. The entire film is a series of increasingly violent and humiliating exercises in sadism, which become increasingly graphic as the film progresses; the final "Circle of Death" is excruciating to view. Yet it is not simply the explicitness of the decadence and cruelty on display that makes Salo the uniquely disturbing experience that it is. Indeed, other films are more graphic in this area. But these other films tend to present these experiences in an ironic, campy or otherwise contextual manner that lessens their impact. Salo takes a purposely distancing view, a "hands off" approach that is much more harrowing and that relentlessly drives home its intended atmosphere of hopelessness and impotence. Its creator, Pier Paolo Pasolini is intent on getting across his message that there are depths of humanity that are intensely vile and repulsive and that to ignore the existence of this can only lead to its re-emergence and domination. He is also making implicit statements about how this depravity is a feature of both Fascism and capitalism. Pasolini purposely makes Salo a disturbing and disgusting experience to drive home his points; whether a viewer feels that sitting through two hours of sadism in order to absorb this point is worthwhile or not will influence his reaction to the work. Objectively, however, it can be said that Pasolini's intentionally static direction is impressive, as is his ability to create tension despite this static quality, and that Torino Delli Colli's cinematography and the physical production are stunning.


The final work of notorious Italian director Pier Paolo Pasolini, this film updates the Marquis de Sade's most extreme novel to fascist Italy in the final days of WW II. Dispensing with the novel's meditations on sexual liberation and the search for truth, Pasolini presents four decadents who kidnap dozens of young men and women and subject them to the most hideous forms of torture and perversion in an isolated villa. Rape, murder, and a coprophagic banquet are only the beginning of the atrocities on display. Photographed by Tonino Delli Colli, the film also features a lavish score by Ennio Morricone.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VLdO-qkY1pQ

results.description:
Let meet up and see Green Room. It has been getting great reviews:

http://www.metacritic.com/movie/green-room

Down on their luck punk rockers The Ain’t Rights are finishing up a long and unsuccessful tour, and are about to call it quits when they get an unexpected booking at an isolated, run-down club deep in the backwoods of Oregon. What seems merely to be a third-rate gig escalates into something much more sinister when they witness an act of violence backstage that they weren’t meant to see. Now trapped backstage, they must face off against the club’s depraved owner, Darcy Banker (Patrick Stewart), a man who will do anything to protect the secrets of his nefarious enterprise. But while Darcy and his henchmen think the band will be easy to get rid of, The Ain’t Rights prove themselves much more cunning and capable than anyone expected, turning the tables on their unsuspecting captors and setting the stage for the ultimate life-or-death showdown.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4DF-7rHKsu4


You can buy tickets here. We are seeing the 8:10 PM show.

Lets enjoy this change of weather by meeting up in a place with lots of outdoor seating.  

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $12 dollars per player per game; pay through Paypal.

One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates at the goal for 6 minutes, timed with an electronic scoreboard. NO breaks. Regulation size goals with nets. professional  futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes, games are competitive, but friendly. Sorry, no beginners. 

Zero tolerance to fouls . “Futsal is a technical game, not physical”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. 

Refunds: only for 24 hour cancelation. must send a meetup message with the paypal Transaction ID: 17 numbers. 

The Name of the school Beacon HS 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
We're happy to announce the venue of our next mixer on Friday April 29 at Z-Bar!

Z-Bar is tucked away neatly near the intersection of Crescent and Hoyt Ave South on the southern edge of the Triborough Bridge entrance. (Basically a block north, roughly, of Astoria World Manor, for you Ugly Betty and/or Winter Pride fans.)

Take the N to Astoria Blvd, or walk up Crescent from all points south, and you'll find them just a few steps west of the subway station on Hoyt S, just over from the Dunkin' Donuts. 

They've been there a little while, but it's a very neighborhood place, and they want to be our neighbors! We'll be joining them on their already-planned LGBT night, and (read in your best Stefon voice) this. bar. has. everything!

Tons of board games, video games, 22 beers to choose from, cheap and tasty bar eats, both a living room and a family room, and can we hear it for a huge back patio? 

Meet up with some new LGBT folks who maybe haven't heard of Out Astoria yet, and discover a new great summer hangout spot.

Add these drink specials to the mix, and we're so there:

$6 shot + can of Miller High Life


$2 jello shots


$5 mai-tais 

Head on up!!!

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xat1/v/t1.0-9/13061939_1128689267209993_2586354415495402909_n.jpg?oh=80ac61c84c89823301ff1eece701c5c4&oe=57A9C147

New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 


If you've never been to Friday Night Blues NYC before, it's a great idea to check out our policies on Blues etiquette and on harassment before coming.


****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:15pm-8:29pm - Class Check-in 
8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson (Stretch) w/ Adriana and Nicole
8:30pm-9:30pm - Extended Topics (Really The Blues) w/ special guest instructor Stephen York from Boston!
9:30pm-10:00pm - DJ Stephen
10:00pm-11:00pm - LIVE MUSIC!! w/ SaRon Crenshaw
11:00pm-11:30pm - DJ Stephen
11:30pm-12:30am - SaRon Crenshaw
12:30am-1:30am - DJ Stephen

****************************************************************************

ABOUT OUR MUSICIAN:

SaRon Crenshaw learned to play guitar at the age of ten. Often found in the band at the Village’s own Terra Blues, Saron’s love is the Blues and he has been inspired by some of the greatest singers and players of all time: B.B. King, Albert King, Albert Collins, Stevie Ray Vaughan and Buddy Guy, to name a few. SaRon plays a Gibson “Lucille” model guitar signed by B.B.King himself. He is a powerful entertainer and is never afraid to take his performance straight into the audience.


NEXT MONTH'S LIVE BAND: May 27th will feature one our dancer favorites, The Fried Bananas! Stay tuned for more details!

****************************************************************************


EXTENDED TOPICS:


Series This Month: Really The Blues
Really, what is the blues? Join the national stars John and Shoshi Krieger-Joven for a month exploring the essence of the blues, and how to embody the blues aesthetic in your dancing.


This Week: Travelin' Blues 
Really, what is the blues? Join the national stars John and Shoshi Krieger-Joven for a month exploring the essence of the blues, and how to embody the blues aesthetic in your dancing.

Read more about our classes at: http://www.fridaynightblues.nyc/learning

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues NYC is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 50 to 150 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $16 (sorry, cash only). Purchase both at the same time and pay only $24 for the night!

--- If you use an FNB punch card, you will be asked for an additional $4 to help cover the cost of the band. ---


****************************************************************************

Volunteers get in for FREE!
Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

Friday Night Blues NYC is on Yelp! If you enjoy our event, please consider leaving us a review.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?


We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

venue.name: La Fama - Salsa Social

results.description:
Let's dance, let's practice, and let's meet and greet at La Fama; New York City's all new Salsa Dance Party in the heart of Manhattan's Time Square. 


We are here every Friday night from 9:30pm to 3am. If you're tired of being in a night club setting that plays more Reggaeton and Bachata then actual Salsa, then this event is for you.  We are located very conveniently in the Center of Manhattan.  Every Train/Bus stops here.  There is also no night club/bar/lounge hassle to deal with. 


A beautiful dance floor and great sound system with out the pesky hassle of a night club.  Dress as you like and feel free to bring your own drinks. 

Also, For those who like a beginner introductory Salsa class and those who want to dance after the class. The Free beginner class at 9:30pm, after admission is also on. 

Admission: $10 to get in (which includes a free Salsa Lesson). The Introductory class for beginners is given at no extra charge by the instructor. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 3:00am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The Free class (after admission) at La Fama begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic step every Friday. If you like to take a formal Salsa dancing class that goes beyond the basics A new 12 weeks cycle will begin on February 18th. For details, join the facebook group and/or join the Class meetup group. Links below:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/453057848231239/

http://www.meetup.com/Progressive-Salsa-Classes/events/228266520/
results.name: Salsa Dancing Party in NYC

group.name: Salsa Dance Party in Times Square Manhattan

results.description:
By now you've heard of the passing of the iconic singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and actor, one of my favorite performers of all time, PRINCE. We've lost yet another brilliant artist but I can Guarantee You that he wouldn't want us to mope around saddened by his passing, but instead celebrate his life, and that's just what the f*@k we're gonna do!! We'll be Partying Like It's 1999 at Stone Creek in their private room watching the 1984 cult classic, Purple Rain, which won an Academy Award that year for the Best Original Song Score. 

Let's get funky - I expect everyone to wear something purple, the funkier the better. Own anything Prince related? Bring it with you for show-n'tell. I'm working on getting the bar to offer us a special Purple Prince drink too. More details on that to follow. We're also co-hosting this with our funky friends from NYC GRINDHOUSE.

RIP and Long Live PRINCE!!

www.StoneCreekNYC.com

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AuXK8ZbTmLk
results.name: PURPLE RAIN! Come celebrate the life of iconic music legend PRINCE with us!!

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's  newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at  [masked]

Dueling Pianos originated in the fabled bars of New Orleans in the 1930s, and spread West across the nation. This exciting, high-energy, all-request entertainment experience has even taken over the Las Vegas strip – and now, Dueling Pianos has found a home in New York City. Imagine the top piano players on the East Coast playing a non-stop, rock-and-roll party where you pick the playlist!

From Billy Joel to Bon Jovi to Britney Spears to Biz Markie, no tune is off-limits. Equal parts concert, comedy and cabaret, you’ll laugh along, dance along and sing along!  Join a group of NYSN members and friends as we spend the night socializing while enjoying the show!

How it works:  You can meet the group there or join us for a group dinner before the show (posted separately).  We will have a special section set aside to sit by the band enjoy the show. There is a 2 drink minimum  and they will put you on separate checks.

Can I come alone?  Yes 98% of those attending will come on their own. You can also invite friends.  NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be your host.

Cost: $20.00 PRE-PAY ONLY EVENT (NO TICKETS SOLD AT THE DOOR) PURCHASE TICKETS HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/dueling-pianos-musical-sing-a-long-and-comedy-cabaret-tickets-24219393859

How long does it last?  about 90 minutes.

Dress code?  most come from work so business casual.
results.name: Dueling Pianos Musical Sing A Long and Comedy Cabaret

results.description:
Weekly Karaoke Fridays at Action Burger and $30 open bar night.  Bring your friends and bring your singing voice.  There will be random Anime on one television and Karaoke for the Xbox on another television (Karaoke revolution, American idol and more).  Below are the drinks available for the open bar.  

Open bar isn't required for meetup.  But a $10 minimum food or drink is required for each RSVP member. 

There will also be card games and board games available for members.  Some of the games:  Cards against humanity, Superfight, Monopoly, Scrabble, pie in face, chess, hungry hippo, uno, spades and more. 

Get a free shot for every two songs you sing.  


$30 open bar from 11pm-2am includes:


Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).

Food menu at Action Burger:

https://www.facebook.com/Action.Burger/photos/a.589240747858792.1073741833.256556391127231/810328379083360/?type=3&theater

results.description:
***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.
results.how_to_find_us: Bubble Directions: Hofstra soccer bubble! Use Hofstra Blvd from Hempstead Tpke....from security booth, turn right after 2nd stop sign towards the athletic fields.  Drive all the way down until u c d dome on your right!!

results.description:
Friends,

Come and join us at this Friday, April 29 @ Skyroom rooftop. We always have a great time at this venue.

Skyroom is conveniently located near Times Square, and many subway stations. 

This is a multi- Meetup group event, so you will get the opportunity to meet other members from my Meetup groups.

Do get there early so that I will be able to introduce you to the other invitees. Coming early also prevents you from the long lines.

Gents free before midnight. Ladies free before 1am.

Skyroom is definitely one of the top 5 rooftops in the city, and the Friday night party there is a lot of fun! Feel free to invite your friends to this event. 

Please note that the venue has a retractable roof so event will happen rain or shine.


Looking forward in meeting many of you!

Cheers,

Meetup Organizer

Rory

[masked]

results.description:
Please join us for Spring Birding in Central Park with evolutionary biologist Spencer Galen on Saturday, April 30 at 7 AM. It's spring migration season and Galen will take us on a guided bird walk through Central Park where we will get to see and hear the harmonious mating calls of our extant dinosaur friends. 

This event is FREE! However, in order to make the bird walk enjoyable for everyone, we are limiting the size of the group. If you are interested in attending, please send an email to [masked] to make a reservation.

Once your reservation is confirmed, please meet bright and early at 7 AM at the intersection of 77th street and Central Park West (on the Central Park side) across the street from the American Museum of Natural History. Please call (917)[masked] if you have trouble finding us. This is a BYOB (Bring Your Own Binoculars) event!

​Spencer Galen is a Ph.D. candidate in the Richard Gilder Graduate School at the American Museum of Natural History. He received his B.S. from the University of Delaware and an M.S. from the University of New Mexico where he studied the evolution of birds in the Peruvian Andes. Galen has spent time studying birds throughout North and South America, including Costa Rica, Ecuador, Peru, and most recently Cuba. He is originally from New Jersey where he found a passion for studying birds as a child while observing the amazing spring migration that takes place across the eastern United States every year.

​NB: Our photographer will be taking photos of this event for our website. If you attend this event and do not wish to have your photo posted to our website, PLEASE let us know in your reservation and we will accommodate.

Please note, in the event of inclement weather (heavy rain), this event will be canceled.
results.name: Spring Migration in Central Park

group.name: The Metropolitan Society of Natural Historians

results.description:
The courts at Crotona have finally been unlocked and are ready for our arrival!!!

I can't wait to see you all out there! :)

---- FAQ ---- 


What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
