results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

results.description:
Hey, Brick Oven Bakers!

Please volunteer to help build the core of the new Old Stone House community oven, fireplace, and hearth from start to finish, and learn the secrets of brick oven construction from professional oven mason Pat Manley.

This Meetup is now FREE. Space is limited because only 8 people can work on the oven efficiently at once. So if you RSVP "yes" and then can't make it, please change your RSVP to "no" so someone else can get a spot.


No prior masonry experience needed.

We're building the core of the oven from Wednesday, April 27, through Monday, May 2.

Please volunteer for as many (or as few) days as you can make it, on any combination of days. The more you help, the more you'll learn!

Every day you'll get to:


- Participate in building the core of the oven and hearth 
- Learn about materials, masonry techniques, and oven engineering
- Ask lots of questions and take photos of the process 
- Learn from Pat's over twenty years of oven-building experience 
- Hang out with Pat over beer in the evenings

Different stages of the process will occur on different days, including: groundwork, the base slab, framing the door and arch, laying the door and arch, oven insulation, and facing. We'll also be laying the fireplace and hearth. You'll get to work on different parts of the process depending on which days you attend.

You should plan to wear closed-toe shoes -- wear boots if possible -- and bring work gloves and a bottle of water. We'll provide snacks! This is an all-day event, so you should plan to bring lunch, or you can get lunch from one of the great local shops and restaurants around the park.

About the Mason

Pat has over twenty years of experience building brick ovens for restaurants, bakeries, vineyards, and backyards all over the country, and has taught dozens of oven-building workshops to beginners and professionals. And every year Pat leads Masons on a Mission to build masonry stoves in Guatemala.


Whether you want to build your own backyard oven, or work in a bakery, or just want to learn a new skill, this is a great learning opportunity!

If you have questions about the project, write to Jace at [masked].


See you soon!
results.name: Volunteer Community Oven Building with Pat the mason - Saturday

results.description:
*****************

Please plan to arrive 10 minutes early so we can leave on time. When we get to St. John, we can get coffee and something to eat at the great Hungarian Pastry Shop across the street.


If you are wearing clipless shoes, bring cleat covers or be ready to take off your shoes before entering the cathedral.

I have updated the route slightly. Here is the link:  https://goo.gl/maps/ACY4nNFpTMw.

*****************

Every year, the day before the 5-Boro bike tour, the Cathedral of St John has a blessing of the bicycles. Let's go join the fun and afterward take a ride around Manhattan.
This ride is 36 miles total, mainly of paved bike paths, with some road, so be prepared to ride with traffic. Here is a link to the route: https://goo.gl/maps/yt9BBhBAM6C2.
We will need to leave promptly in order to get to church on time. Bring, water, snacks, helmet, spare tube.
results.name: Blessing of the Bicycles at St John

results.description:
Harlem Brownstone Brunch Ride!


Saturday, April 30th

Meeting 8:15am @ 

Prospect Pk. Entrance (Grand Amy Plz)

2nd meeting 8:45 on Manhattan side of Bklyn Bridge

Distance: 30 miles roundtrip and all flat.

Pace: 12mph steady.

Fee: $10-Guidance, support and organizing

This is the 18th annual Blessing of the Bikes, Saturday of the 5Boro Bike Tour.

This early morning biking journey takes us up the west side bike path. It's a scenic view along the Hudson River to 125th Street. We will pass the historic Cotton Club on our way to our first destination, The Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine.


A brief 15 min. service blessing the bikes (optional); this service starts sharply at 9:30am. For more details refer to the link below.


After the service, we do a Harlem Brownstone Tour to build more of an appetite before brunch at Blujeen. The restaurant is located on Frederick Douglass Blvd btw 116 & 115. The menu is American/Southern, link below for menu selections.


Blessing of the Bikes link:


http://www.theblessingofthebikes.com

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Qi Gong is a part of traditional Chinese medicine that views and treats the body, mind and the environment as a whole. Qi Gong practices include slow body movements, meditation, and special breathing techniques. Qi Gong students can experience deep relaxation, concentration and a peaceful, clear mind. In addition, Qi Gong practices help to clear energy blockages and improve blood circulation in the body. In this class, students will learn Qi Gong exercises to increase flexibility, improve balance, reduce stress, increase concentration, and rejuvenate the mind, body, spirit and more!

The cost for attending eight Saturday classes is $65 for Non-Greenburgh residents, and $54 for Greenburgh residents.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it).
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.) Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances. We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation: We'll play rain or shine. We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

Late cancellations and no-shows will get you removed from future events.

results.description:
This workshop is for the yoga teacher and creative professional looking to integrate a yogic approach into their professional life with practical skills for vocal production and public speaking from a body oriented perspective. 

This three hour intensive will begin with a brief asana practice, led by Embodied Potential founder, Whitney Tucker. The asana will be directly followed by a vocal practice, led by Energizeyourvoice.net founder, Minna Taylor - integrating breath, body, and vibration - with the singular goal of developing dynamic, effortless resonance.

Register HERE

The final portion of the workshop will be public speaking focused. There will be an emphasis on play, developing impulsive responsiveness, practical techniques for effective public speaking, and individual evaluation with personalized feedback. You will leave with a new appreciation for how your asana informs your communication and a deeper understanding of how your voice functions in your body. You will feel empowered to communicate with confidence in any public speaking scenario.

Register HERE

Your trainers:

Minna Taylor is a communication coach and actress living in New York City. She has a dedicated Ashtanga Yoga practice which has deeply informed her investigation of voice and body. She traveled to Mysore, India to explore the traditional approach to Ashtanga and how that could inform her Western approach to voice work. She studied drama and NYU Tisch with The Atlantic Theater Company and earned her masters degree in theater from Brooklyn College, with a concentration in speech and vocal prodcution. Minna works with creative and social entrepreneurs, startups, and non-profits to enhance presentation and brand storytelling. She guides educators into more effective classroom engagement. She works with all levels of professionals from interns to C-Suite executives, holding strong to the belief that we all have the power to discover our full voice and unlock our full potential.

Whitney Rippelmeyer-Tucker founded Embodied Potential Inc. in 2014. Through this newest endeavor, Ms. Tucker creates partnerships with people as a life coach (Affiliate Coach-Accomplishment Coaching), a Pilates (Kane School-expert teacher[masked])/Yoga instructor (Katonah Method) and through personal training practices (NASM CPT). She is also a labor doula (DONA) and placenta encapsulator. After having a successful career as an artistic collaborator and performer (David Dorfman Dance, Wire Monkey Dance, Nita Little, Tiffany Mills Company), she co-founded the eco-friendly fitness + wellness space named Studio 26 in 2010 and was owner until 2014. Additional past experiences include being a full-time public school teacher, teaching in university and professional settings (NYU, Hunter College, University of Colorado, Columbia College (Chicago), Washington University, and the Colorado Ballet Summer Intensive). She has performed multiple cadaver dissections with Gil Hedley, publishing of articles in peer journals on training techniques and movement as a healing modality, and presented at Congress on Research in Dance (2004) on her work with prostituted women. As a volunteer, Ms. Tucker focused on reproductive justice with The Doula Project [masked]).

results.description:
Let's continue the Spring hiking season with somewhat challenging loop in Harriman and Bear Mountain Parks.


The Hike:


We'll do an 8-10 mile loop, following sections of Timp-Torn and Ramapo-Dunerberg trails, while walking along remnants of the Dunderberg Spiral Railway. You can expect some steep (but not too long) climbs early in the hike and several moderate up and downs throughout the hike. The trail surface will vary from level wooded, to steep and rocky, with some section of light rock scrambles and loose rock/gravel trail. 

About 2.5 hours into the hike, we'll take a lunch break, so please bring something to snack on. The entire hike with all breaks, at a decent pace, should not take more than 5-6 hours.


Gear:

Proper footwear is essential - a pair of comfortable, broken-in shoes, with good traction. Please no flip-flops, clogs, skate shoes and similar footwear on this hike. 

Bring enough water for the entire day. There is no potable water source anywhere along this hike, so come with your bottles/hydration packs filed up and ready to go.

You will need a small backpack to carry your food, water, and extra clothing. As I mentioned before, on some portions of this hike you may need to use your hands to climb up rocks, so you need your hands to be free.

The weather in the early spring can be unpredictable, and with a bit of a wind chill at the top of the hills along the way, a sunny day can turn into a cold one - so be ready and dress in layers. Bring an extra layer, a hat,  and rain/wind jacket that can fit into your backpack. A pair of gloves can be helpful on a cold, windy day.

As on any given hike - it is always a good idea to have your own map of the area you are hiking. You can purchase NY/NJ conference's Harriman-Bear Mountain  trail map set and bring map  #119 with you, or at least print this map as a backup:

(http://nysparks.com/parks/attachments/BearMountainTrailMap.pdf)

Sunblock and insect repellents are good to have handy.

We should be done with this hike long before it gets dark, but it's always a good idea to pack a headlamp/flashlight - for unforeseen circumstances.


Getting there: 

We will carpool, and share the cost of gas/tolls. 

Please use the comment field to offer/ask for a ride. 

Driving Directions 

From NYC, take the Palisades Interstate Parkway to its northern terminus at the Bear Mountain Bridge and then continue South on U.S. 9W for about 4 miles to the parking lot on your right. Or just enter the GPS coordinates into your GPS unit and let it lead you to the parking lot.

GPS Coordinates: [masked], [masked]


DISCLAIMER

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.Full text of our liability waiver can be found on the following page:

http://www.meetup.com/Adventure-Outlet/pages/Risks_and_Waiver_of_Liability/

Давайте продолжим путешествие по Appalachian Trail. 

Мы начнем с исторического Indian Hills, места плавки руды в 19 в. Продолжим по Appalachian.

У Вас есть возможность пройти всю дистанцию 10+ миль или прогуляться по Indian Hills 3  мили.

Маршрут для нас новый.

Недалеко от NYC

Let's hike Appalachian Trail's Sterling Forest section.

Distance: 10+ miles/ or 3 miles

Difficulty: Moderate

You need:

- hiking boots

-long pants

-water

Map: Sterling Forest Trails #100

 Parking GPS ( Meeting point)[masked], [masked]


78 Continental Rd.

Warwick, NY 10990

Driving Directions

Take I-287 to Exit 57 and continue on Skyline Drive to its western end at Greenwood Lake Turnpike (County Route 511) in Ringwood. Turn right and proceed for 8.2 miles to an intersection with Lakeside Road. Turn right and follow Lakeside Road (still designated County Route 511) for 2.5 miles to the Greenwood Lake Marina, just south of the New Jersey-New York boundary. Turn left and park on the left side of the dirt access road, on the west side of Lakeside Road. If you have one car, follow directions for Bus transport to hike start below. If you have two cars, park one car here and continue north on Lakeside Road (designated Route 210 in New York) for 3.5 miles. In the Village of Greenwood Lake, turn left onto Windermere Avenue (still N.Y. Route 210), then, in 0.5 mile, bear left onto N.Y. Route 17A. Continue for 1.9 miles to the top of the hill, and park in a designated parking area for the Appalachian Trail, on the left as you reach the top of the hill. You can also park on Continental Road, just beyond on the left, and walk a short distance back to the trail.

------------------

Parking # 2

Sterling Forest State Park

17–99 Hall Dr

Tuxedo Park, NY  10975

United States

Driving Directions

Take N.Y. Route 17 North through Sloatsburg and Tuxedo, and continue on Route 17 past the intersection with NY 17A into Southfields. About 1.3 miles beyond the intersection with NY 17A, turn left onto Orange Turnpike (County Route 19). In 0.6 mile, turn left onto Hall Drive and park in a parking area on the left side of the road at a curve.

Hudson Montessori’s 7th Annual Social Studies Fair will take place on Saturday, April 30, 2016. The fair showcases our children’s academic journey with this year’s theme, The Olympics. 

The central attraction, the Exhibit Hall, is the fruition of a year-long study that was integrated into many aspects of the school’s curriculum. What makes “The Olympics” a unique topic is that the children have not only looked at the Olympics as a series of sporting events, but have delved into its history, present and future. They have studied what it takes to become an Olympic athlete and what it takes to become a host country. 

All of this culminates in the exhibits where they have applied their knowledge and skill to develop their displays. The event also includes a carnival for more than 500 people to be held in Zeppelin Hall, the large event space adjacent to the school, which promises fun for all ages. We will feature food from local Jersey City vendors, and activities that include bounce houses, craft tables, face painting, photo booths, and a mix of sport stations that celebrate the 2016 Summer Olympics.
Date: Saturday, April 30, 2016
Time: Opening Ceremony at 9:00 AM
Exhibition and Carnival from 9:30 AM to 1:00 PM
Venue: Classrooms (Exhibits) and Zeppelin Hall (Carnival)

results.description:
We'll try to stay together as a group, but we can't wait too long for slower hikers. Everyone should have and know how to read a map.  

If you take the train, plan to arrive at GC 15-20 mins early. A lot of people miss the train due to subway deleys and stuff.

Contact Andre with any questions. 

--------------


About the Hike: 


From parking lot, we will scramble up on the Breakneck Ridge trail (white trail; very steep - basically 45 mins on the stair-master) with great views of the Hudson River & Storm King Mountain. Then we'll hike to Sunset Point and continue north to the South Beacon Fire Tower (open to the public) then return to the parking lot over sugarloaf.


• Terrain: Steep scrambling and several hills

• Elevation Gain/Distance: 3k+ feet; 9-12 miles round trip

• Hiking Pace: Intermediate, ~2 mph once we are done with scrambling 


Driving Directions: Meet at the larger parking lot about 0.2mi north of the tunnel. Google map links to the Parking lot. That's[masked], [masked] in case the link doesn't work. Just go to Google maps and enter the coordinates.

Plan to arrive at 9:00. We'll start hiking when the train arrives at 9:10am.

Public Transportation Meeting Location & Return Time:
Take the 7:43am train from Grand Central to the Breakneck Ridge stop, arriving at 9:09am. The finish time depends on the group's pace. At the end of the day, you can take the train at the Breakneck Ridge stop (4:13 PM ) or at Cold Spring station (a 2.5-mile walk/ hike with trains running hourly). Some willing drivers might be able to shuttle you to the Cold Spring station.

Car Drivers and Riders:
People who are coming by car and are willing to give rides, please write in your RSVP from where and when you are leaving. 

Day Hiking Gear:
 Bring warm layers - the hill tops will probably be chilly

2 liters of water


Lunch, snacks and extra food

Headlamp (just in case)

Sunscreen, sunglasses


NYNJTC East Hudson Trails

Weather: 
I'll cancel for a high chance (70%) of rain


Check the forecast for Cold Spring, New York.<a href="http://www.weather.com/weather/today/Cold+Spring+NY+10516?par=igoogle&site=www.google.com&promo=currrentconditions&cm_ven=igoogle&cm_cat=www.google.com&cm_pla=forecastpage&cm_ite=CityPage"></a>


After the Hike:
Upload your pictures and review the hike!
results.name: Breakneck-Beacon Fire Tower: 10 Miles, Public Transit

results.description:
Let's burn some calories and see some nice views before we dig into Mac N Cheese!

You don't need to be going to the HV Mac n Cheese fest in order to attend this event, just know some of us will be headed over there directly after the hike.

Schunemunk Mountain hike

9:15am meet to start hike right at 9:30am.  If you are later, you will have to catch up.

Trailhead- 339 Otterkill Road, Cornwall NY (http://goo.gl/maps/CPpYS)

Please don't be late we start on time .

Bring plenty of water and food / snack as needed

---------------------

5.4 miles 2.5 hours

1,200 gain

The first Mile of this hike is hard with an elevation gain of 1,100 ft (Like Mt. Beacon). After that it is not to bad, just a few steep sections.

Starting at the trailhead on Otterkill Road just past the train trestle bridge, we will follow the white trail until it intersects with Red and head to the right.  We will then turn left onto Orange for a half mile ridge walk.  We will turn onto the White Sweet Clover trail to cross to the Yellow Jessup trail.  Heading down in elevation, eventually we hit the Red Otterkill trail and turn left to head back to the parking lot.


We'll have pay close attention to the trail markers and not get too distracted by more stunning views towards the east: Storm King, Mt Beacon and the Hudson River.

The total distance is approximately 5.4 miles and an elevation gain of 1200+ feet.


------------------------

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

Please bring plenty of water, food, and/or lunch for this visually stunning, 7+ hour mini-saunter. Return to Manhattan by PATH ($2.75 fare).

results.description:
Buy tickets here: http://protohack.org/events/protohack-new-york-city/

Hey Everyone - we are excited to collaborate with ProtoHack and want to share their awesome event with you. Please note that is a full-day prototyping hackathon (with a learning session) focused on helping non-technical entrepreneurs bring their ideas to life while having lots of fun, learning getting feedback from successful entrepreneurs and major players in the field and winning big prizes. It is a paid event (link to purchase tickets is at the top - they do have early bird pricing so buy soon, if you are planning to go).

You can also check out their meetup group here: 
http://www.meetup.com/protohack-newyorkcity/events/228842470/

and learn more about ProtoHack on protohack.org.

*******



Here is more detail about the event from ProtoHack's meetup page:

Want to be an entrepreneur? Don't know how to code? No problem! This is a hackathon aimed at noncoders (though coders are welcome, of course). Team up with awesome people--or lone wolf it--to come up with a concept, a business model, a wireframe/prototype, and pitch to a panel of judges.

The winners get thousands of dollars worth of sweet prizes to help them start their businesses. And while we aren't in the business of handing out participation trophies, we're still going to hook up everyone who attends with some tools to help you get better at prototyping. Yup, we'll give you exclusive access to over $500 worth of tools and goodies just for registering! Like extended trials to the best prototyping tools in the biz, for example.

Your ticket also gets you two delicious meals, snacks, and a free drink or two at an afterparty. In New York City, I'm pretty sure this legally constitutes theft. But we won't tell if you don't!
results.name: ProtoHack: the Code-Free Hackathon

group.name: RuTech - Russian Speaking Tech Startup Community (NYC)

results.description:
http://protohack.org/events/protohack-new-york-city/

ProtoHack exists to show non-coders that they can create something amazing from nothing. We empower and enable the non-technical community with the tools, knowledge and connections that will help bring their idea to life and visually communicate it through prototyping.


ProtoHack requires no coding. Instead you’ll be using prototyping tools, drag and drop editors, mockups, wireframes and anything else you think of to visually demo your idea on stage. Competitors will work in teams (up to 4) or solo. You have 9 hours to prototype your idea and then you’ll present on stage.

ProtoHack will be a 12 hour experience where you will build a prototype that communicates an idea visually. During ProtoHack you’ll learn how to use the best prototyping tools in the industry, network with like-minded people with various backgrounds, become a better product person, and get exclusive access to over $500 worth of tools and goodies for registering!

For more information, visit: 

http://protohack.org/events/protohack-new-york-city/

results.description:
This walk is hosted by Westchester Community College's Personal Counseling, the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI), GLOW, and the Department of Student Involvement.

The purpose of this walk is to raise awareness about mental health issues, fight the stigma, support those who have lost someone to suicide and/or have attempted suicide, support those with mental illnesses, and raise money for suicide prevention and research. Any donations made "will help fund research, create educational programs, advocate for public policy, and support survivors of suicide loss."

Details about this event:
Check-in Begins: 10:00 am
Walk Start Time: 11:00 am
Walk End Time: 3:00pm
Walk Location: Westchester Community College - Student Center Lawn (Parking is available in Parking Lot 8)

Online registration ends the Friday before the walk (so, the 29th), but you may register in person at the walk.

I've created a team page for anyone who is interested in joining the team or donating.
Link to the team page: http://afsp.donordrive.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=donorDrive.team&teamID=108539

If you won't be able to walk, but would like to donate money you may donate to my personal page here: http://afsp.donordrive.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=donorDrive.participant&participantID=981633

I set a team fundraising goal of $1000. If you're unable to raise any money or donate, that is okay. Walking with us to show your support means a lot.

Please join me on this walk and donate money if you can. This is a health issue that I hold close to my heart. Hope to see you there. If you have any questions you may message me via meetup. Otherwise, RSVP and Join the team! :)

After the walk on the 30th we will go to an early dinner in the area.
results.how_to_find_us:
On April 24th I will send a message with my phone number and a Groupme request. I will be at the walk at 9:30am wearing a shirt I've designed with our team name.

Feel free to design your own shirts and signs as well!

Toddler Yoga Program : Early walkers/Ages 1.5- 3 years*
When : Saturdays, 9:30 - 10:00am {5 Class Program}
Dates : March 26 - April 30
Cost : $22 drop-in

Your active little one will participate in a yoga play group full of itsy-bitsy poses, movement games, songs, story-telling and breathing, along with lots of laughter and joy! Toddlers are ready to move and play and the class will give them a chance to learn about their bodies, stimulate their senses and have fun exploring creative poses with repetition in songs and games. The class will focus on letting each child have their own experience while allowing them to be playful and silly. During class, children will continue to develop their curiosity, stimulate their imagination, build a positive sense of self, engage in positive social interactions, and develop their body and breathing awareness. We will end every class with a short n' sweet relaxation to leave children with an inner sense of peace and calm that both children and parents can enjoy! Taught by Andrea Grassotti.

*Requirements & Details :

• Children have to be fully walking in order to participate since certain poses and games will require basic coordination and balancing.
• Selection of classes are based on parents' discretion of the child's age range and what would be best fit their needs.
• Parents/caregivers are welcome and encouraged to participate, but not required to, so as long as they remain at studio during class.
• Please refrain from any eating during class (water allowed).
• Child and parent/caregiver should wear comfortable clothing you can each move in easily.
• Studio props (mats, blocks, etc) will provided, unless you prefer to bring your own. Foam floor tiles will be used for comfort and safety.
• 150 Bay Street has a stroller accessible entrance and an elevator. Stroller parking is available at the studio for your convenience.
• Class size limited to 15 children.

Click here for more details and to Register!

results.description:
Bike to the 7th annual Holi Hai celebration held at the United Nations' Dag Hammerskjold Plaza! Holi Hai is an ancient Hindu religious festival observed in India and Nepal that celebrates the coming of spring and the joy of friendship. Also known as the Festival of Colors this event is a free-for-all carnival of colors, where participants play, chase, toss and sprinkle a variety of vividly colored powders on each other (powders are safe, non-toxic, and FDA approved). Anyone and everyone is fair game, friend or stranger, rich or poor, man or woman, children and elders. Holi has further social significance as a day to forgive one's past mistakes, to end conflicts with others and repair damaged relationships, and to just celebrate and let go. As a result expect loud music, lots of food, noise, and fun!

Date: Saturday, April 30, 2016

Time: 9:30 AM
Meeting place: Corner of Canal and Forsyth Street near the Manhattan Bridge.

Register for for FREE at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nyc-holi-hai-2016-tickets-21441584356/. Admission is free but you will need to have a ticket for entry.

This will be a short ride ~ 5 miles along the East River Greenway (no cars) with the last 10 blocks on a bike lane up 1st Ave. 

There will be artists, musicians, and performers on stage as well as a variety of delicious Indian foods, snacks, and delicacies!

Additional information

* This event is open to participants of all ages.

* Powders will be available for purchase at the event (approx. $5 per cup) and are non-toxic and FDA approved.

* Bring glasses or sunglasses if your eyes are sensitive (to protect from powder).

* White or light-colored clothing is recommended so that the full impact of the colors is easily seen. Although the colored powder washes out of most clothing, it is a good idea to choose clothes you don’t mind getting messy. Note that the colors will wash off your skin and hair.

* Holi colors have different meanings! Red is for love/marriage, green is for new beginnings/the harvest, blue is for calmness/power, and yellow is for holiness.

https://youtu.be/t8p7PlqI__c
results.name: Ride to Holi Hai (the Festival of Colors)

930am at Clove Lakes Park. Meet by the basketball courts by Clove and Victory. 

Workouts are for all fitness levels whether you’re just starting out and this is your very first workout or if you’ve been pushing hard for years. You will sweat, you will work, you... will HATE IT, but YOU’LL LOVE IT!

The workout is approximately one hour long with breaks. Each participant should bring water and a towel. Optional accessories for the workout include a yoga mat and light dumbbells if you have them. We will have some extra equipment on hand but please bring what you have.

It’s a total body workout beginning with cardio, then moving into lower body strength training, then upper body strength training then lastly ending with a core workout all while moving to the beat of some kick ass music!!

So please, come on out and get your sweat on! And spread the word!

PAGE SHARES ARE VERY MUCH APPRECIATED TO HELP SPREAD THE WORD!

results.description:
PLEASE BRING BOTH A BLUE T-SHIRT & A WHITE T-SHIRT.                                                                                                                                 Started by a group of soccer fanatics who love to play the Beautiful Game and wanted to create a meetup for individuals of all levels. 

Our Mission: Play safe, get your workout on & HAVE FUN!!

The Lowdown: 

1. Play safe,  excessive aggression will NOT be tolerated (the precinct is across the street...LOL!!). 

2. Cleats are permitted, and Sneakers or Turf Shoes are acceptable as well. We play for an hour with a break in the middle. If no volunteered goal keeper, players will rotate the position. We play with corner kicks and throw-ins. Also, everyone should bring a Blue T-Shirt AND a White T-Shirt.

3. Pitch Location: Between Baxter & Mulberry St. with additional entrance on Worth & Bayard St. 

4. Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street. 

5. HAVE FUN!

See you Downtown! 

Terms and Conditions of the participating in our group:

PLEASE READ THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE CAREFULLY. 
BY USING THIS WEBSITE, YOU AGREE TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS. 

JOINING AND SIGNING UP FOR DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 

I certify that I am 18 years of age or older and that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore I, individually, hereby release and discharge, DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizers and Co-organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER programs or activities. 

DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizer and its Co-Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

The Downtown Pickup Soccer Team

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Back by popular demand, we are going to walk up to the Twin Lights Lighthouse from Sandy Hook.  We will be leaving at 10:00 sharp, from parking lot B, which is the first public parking lot on the the right once you pass thru the front gate. HINT:  look for the orange car at the entrance to the parking lot.  There is no charge for entering Sandy Hook this time of the year.  

We will walk on the multi-purpose trail, over the Highlands Bridge then use our strong leg muscles to get us up the steep hill to the Lighthouse. It is a fairly steep but short hill.  Once up at the top, you will be rewarded by fantastic views of Sandy Hook, NYC , Sea Bright and the Atlantic Ocean.  Hopefully the Lighthouse will be open and for those who dare, can climb up to the top of the Lighthouse.

After we've had our fill of the scenery, we will head back to our cars and head over to Off The Hook for a bite to eat.

The whole walk is around 3 miles.  And as much as we love our furry friends, let them sleep in on a Saturday and leave them at home. Rain will cancel this walk and those who signed up will be notified.  Although Fritz tells me it will not rain......
results.name: Twin Lights Lighthouse from Sandy Hook

results.description:
Here is a typical agenda of Art of Speaking Toastmasters Club's meeting.


• The Sgt at Arms calls for meeting to begin

• President of the club welcomes members and guests.  Invites the Toastmaster of the day to facilitate the meeting

• Toastmaster of the Day (TMOD) introduces other duty holders.


• TMOD invites speakers who have scheduled to speak that day. Members take turns to complete their projects under the Competent Communication manual or from one of the advanced manuals. Members & Guests offer feedback to the speakers. They also fill out ballots to select best speaker.


• After the prepared speeches segment is complete, Impromptu speeches (Table Topics) segment begins. All Guests are invited to participate. The goal is to think on your feet and speak for 1 to 2 minutes. Guests & Members fill out ballots to select best Table Topics contestant.


• Short Break to enable socializing & networking.


• Meeting reconvenes. General Evaluator takes charge of the meeting. Invites Evaluators to present their feedback on the prepared speeches. Guests & Members fill out ballots to select best evaluator.


• General Evaluators returns the control of the meeting back to the President of the club.


• President gives away awards to the best speaker, best Table Topics contestant and best Evaluator.


• Meeting comes to an end approximately between 12.15 pm and 12.30 pm.

results.name: Art of Speaking Toastmasters Club Meeting

results.description:
$25 pre-reg, $35 at the door - Click here to register.

The Bioenergy Workout is a fun and informative 3-hour practical workshop, in which students perform a series of diverse bioenergetic (chi, prana) exercises.

Mastering our personal energies is key to maintaining equilibrium, becoming more self-aware, identifying and overcoming emotional imbalances, maintaining psychic self-defense, unlocking our potential, and developing our parapsychism.

During the Workout, an instructor will lead a series of foundational exercises, gradually layering on more complex ones as the class progresses. Students learn to move, absorb, and donate energies, and apply techniques to develop their sensitivity and perceptions, including a clairvoyance exercise.

The techniques practiced help students learn to revitalize their own energetic field, protect themselves energetically, identify external energetic influences, and increase their self-awareness about their energetic condition.

The course goes to the very core of developing one’s parapsychism and awareness of multidimensional reality. This workshop is an ideal first step for those wanting to understand in practical terms what Bioenergies are all about.

This course is a great complement to the IAC’s award-winning Consciousness Development Program.

This course has no pre-requisites.
results.name: Come to a 3-hour Bioenergy Workshop

The second series of Catskill 35'er will bag us Vly (3,529') and Bearpen (3,600') mountains (and possibly North Bearpen and Roundtop mountains depending on the pace of the group). 

The planned route (distance, elevation gain) can be reviewed at:
http://www.ramblr.com/web/mymap/trip/47098/199444/ 

The shuttle plan will be worked out based on the number of registrants. 

The leader will rent a 5-passenger vehicle. Reserve your seat by April 24. Seats are strictly first come; first served basis. All the trip-associated costs will be shared. 

Registration will be closed with either when the 19 hikers signed up for the event or on 4/26 (whichever comes first). 

When registering for the event, email the leader with the responses to the following questions: 

1) Do you need a ride? If so, where do you live? Specify the nearest train station and line. 

2) Are you driving? If so, will you be able to offer a ride to other non-drivers? Where would be the convenient location for you to pick up and drop off the non-drivers? How many people, besides you, can you fit in your car?

results.description:
Lower Washington Heights has landmarked buildings, an historic district, the oldest house in Manhattan, interesting street art and much more. Let's meet up and see where Malcolm X was killed, where Washington had his headquarters for five weeks and where several jazz greats lived. We'll walk on paths that go back to the Dutch era and talk about how the neighborhood has changed and is changing. If you like, we can visit the Morris - Jumel Mansion after about an hour's walk. The mansion relies on contributions and expects a donation of $10 to visit. Let me know when you RSVP if you plan on touring the mansion.

The meetup is free to attend and is limited to 20 people.


The photos show some of the sights we'll see on our walk.

results.description:
The South County Trailway is a zippy mostly paved trail heading north from Yonkers through the Hudson River Valley communities of Hastings-on-Hudson, Dobbs Ferry, Ardsley, Irvington, Greenburgh, and Elmsford.    

The trail follows the former Putnam Division line ("Old Put") of the New York Central Railroad and links two other rail-trails on the same line: the Old Putnam Trail in the south and the North County Trailway in Mount Pleasant.


The official endpoint of the South County Trailway, and the start of the 22-mile North County Trailway, is where the corridor crosses Old Saw Mill River Road.   Possible stops at Washington Irving's home, Van Cortland Manor ... Check with Trip Leader for details.   

The trail is safe, scenic and largely shaded by trees.


Distance:  28 miles RT (approximate)         

Stop for drinks after ride.   

Trip leaves from north end of #1 train at 242 St/Broadway and Van Cortland Park (near Yonkers).   

Trip Leaders: Bill Schreiber and Sandy Galitzer 

You can leave Bill a message by clicking on his name above Event Host in Right Side Bar.  Then click Message and it will take you to e-mail.

Riders who are not members of Miramar Ski Club must print and sign a liability waiver and give to the leaders before participating.

Whole Foods (Union Square) -- upstairs cafe. Show up a bit early to say hi, chat, and drop off any thing you don’t want to run with: jackets, bags, phones, etc. Somebody will always stay to watch the stuff.

Run – 10:00 am

Run 1 mile, 3 miles, 5 miles, or whatever you want. We'll head to the West Side Highway together. No pressure and no limits. Totally informal. Lots of different paces for lots of different people. Even walking speed is encouraged!

Brunch – 10:45 am

results.description:
Thrive in the Park is a place to meet friends, have fun and get fit.

Our *donation based workouts are designed by fitness experts and are for everyone, at any level of fitness. 

WORKOUT DETAILS:


The work out consists of body weight exercises (ex. pushup, sit ups, squats, lunges, jumps), team competitions, partner exercises, and cardio (jumping jacks, jogging, sprints, jump rope).

We do not count reps, but rather have a "do as many as you can in 1 minute" style of encouragement.

If you have any questions, please send us a message and we'll get back to you within 24 hours.

WHAT TO BRING:


A water bottle, your determination and your *donation*. All donations are invested back into Thrive in the Park

TESTIMONIALS:

Achelle - "#ThriveInThePark is the workout I look forward to all week! Not only do I get an incredible full body workout, but it's a fun and encouraging group to be apart of!"

Maria - "#ThriveInThePark is what I look forward to every week, there is nothing cooler than working out, laughing, and bonding with great people who care for their health. Rain or shine we thrive."

Andie - "#ThriveInThePark I never thought I would enjoy waking up early on a Saturday, but now I look forward to it, fun workouts with friends that keep you motivated to push yourself!"

Dani - "#ThriveInThePark I Love everything about it! Such a positive way to bring community together for some weekend activity. The guys/girls that lead the workout and stretches bring such great energy to the group, we basically laugh the whole time - until the lunges and burpees come along, no one laughs at those."

Devon - "#ThriveInThePark provides a necessary jolt of inspiration and aspiration to anyone looking to improve their life."

Ben - "#ThriveInThePark is all about community and giving back, I couldn't think about a better way to spend my Saturday mornings."

Marco - #ThriveInThePark is great because it connects mind body and soul! We learn new techniques, we motivate each other and meet interesting people from all over the world!"

HISTORY:

Thrive in the Park started in the spring of 2014. We believe in giving back to the community and in creating ripples of kindness, strength and gratitude. It is our hope that you too, will go into the world and create these ripples. 

We can't wait to see you!

LINKS:

http://www.ThriveInThePark.com 

Sponsored by: http://www.soRipe.com

results.description:
In-Game:


Since the invasion of Naesil by the Aetherian horde, the Franciscan Empire has maintained a number of refugee camps to house citizens fleeing occupied territory. Recently there have been complaints from a camp outside East Barrow, concerning an outspoken worshiper of Tyrus, the god of darkness, who has been trying to convert his fellow refugees. This man has not technically broken any laws, but given the sinister reputation of Tyrus's following, the Frankish military is concerned. The Franks have quietly asked that a group of freelancers travel to this camp posing as refugees, meet this priest of Tyrus, and determine whether he has any hidden agenda. They are willing to pay for any information gathered.

A refugee camp makes for an uneasy place, where once-separate walks of life are abruptly forced together. They all seek a refuge from war, but some bring the war with them...

Event Info:


This is a Level 30 Cap Event. For this event, players can choose whether their character is working with the Frankish military, or if that doesn't suit their backstory, they can be one of the refugees already in the camp.

IMPORTANT: If at all possible, please pay by Pay-pal! (we are [masked]) It's a lot easier for us to account for everything. Events are $15 per player, but for first-time players it's free. Helping to run the event on monster crew is of course free as well.

Usual bit here everyone, try and be in kit and ready by 10am. We will meet outside of the bathrooms at the Seaman Ave-Isham St entrance to Inwood Hill Park. For new players the easiest way to get to the meet up location is to take the A train to the 207th street stop, exit the station at Isham street and it's a 2 minute walk up the hill from there.

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015


WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 


[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's a great way to start your Saturday!

FREE Circuit Training Saturdays! A 50-minute non-stop intense workout. You will sweat off the weight, you will burn calories, you will gain muscle. All levels welcome. We vow to never give up on you. For we will do everything in our power to help you reach your goal. We operate in a judgement free zone to facilitate your comfort. We promise you will progress.

This Class consist of running, walking, floor exercise, abdominal  workouts, squats, jumprope, and much more. You always have the option to perform the modified version of any drill! This allows beginners or anyone with a minor injury to comfortable fit right in. Build your strength and endurance to perform the unmodified versions of the drill when you see FIT (pun intended :)!! All while moving to be beat of the music. Bring your family, bring your friends.

results.description:
Description: Join the Morris county Ski Club on a moderate 7 mile hike in Ringwood State Park on Saturday April 30, 2016. The hike will climb to the summit of Mount Defiance with panoramic views and pass several scenic ponds and include a trip to Skylands Manor and the NJ Botanical Gardens.  There is some climbing although the climbing is not very difficult.  The hike should take about 4 ½ to 5 hours to complete including a lunch stop at the shore of Gataun pond and some time to explore the Botanical Gardens.  We will meet at 10:15 AM at Shepherd Lake (see directions below).  After the hike we will go to Prime 15 Steak House & Grill for food and drink.

Important Notes for the hike:

1.  Hiking boots are preferable to sneakers as the trails may be a bit muddy.

2.  Bring a daypack to carry extra clothing, sufficient water and your lunch.

3.  You may want to bring a camera for the views

4.  Restroom facilities are located inside at Shepard Lake and at the Botanical Gardens.

Directions to the hike location from Morristown:

·  Route 287 North to exit 55A

·  Turn Right onto 511 North (Ringwood Avenue)

·  Stay on Route 511 for 7.5 miles.  (Ringwood Ave eventually becomes Greenwood Lake Turnpike)

·  Turn Right onto Sloatsburg Road

·  After 2.1 miles turn Right onto Morris Avenue

·  After 1.3 miles turn Left onto Shepherd Lake Road.  There will be a large statue of an eagle in front of you.

·  Go 0.8 miles (watch speed bumps) to Shepherd Lake and park in the upper lot. 

The lower lot is used for boat launching.

Email:  [masked].  Advanced sign up by e-mail is not required is appreciated. 


If the weather is questionable an e-mail will be sent through the Yahoo Group Site regarding the status of the hike.  There will also be a notification on the Meet-up Site.
results.name: Hike Ringwood State Forest

results.description:
Are you interested in your code having a larger impact than your personal projects or your job? Have you been interested in participating in open source, but never knew how to start? This workshop is going to be focused on getting everyone who attends to make their first contributions to open source Ruby projects. All levels of Ruby experience are welcome!

Prerequisites

• Bring a laptop and charger (if you don't have one, you can pair with someone)
• Install Ruby 2+
• Install PostgreSQL (or we do it here if you run into issues)
• Create a GitHub account (if you don't already have one)
• Download GitHub Desktop, and go through the Tutorial under the Help menu (unless you are already comfortable with Git)

Mentors

If you are experienced in Ruby and open source contribution and would be interested in mentoring, please get in touch: [masked].

Other info

Space, snacks, and drinks are being graciously provided by thoughtbot.

We are anticipating high demand for this event, so are charging a nominal fee to ensure those who RSVP actually intend to be there. All proceeds will go towards Meetup group fees. Please only RSVP if you can stay for the whole time.

Let us know in the comments if you have any questions. If you can't make it, don't worry, we plan to do more in the future. Looking forward to seeing you then!
results.name: First-Time Open Source Contributor Workshop [Ruby-Focused­­]

results.description:
RSVP'S ARE CLOSED AS OF WEDNESDAY APRIL 27 10 P.M.

PLEASE READ THE DESCRIPTION OF THIS EVENT CAREFULLY. I TAKE THE RSVP PROCESS SERIOUSLY AND I EXPECT THAT YOU SHOULD TOO.

Meeting details will be provided by e-mail Thursday night before the event to all who RSVP.

Join me and AMC Club members who do not have to RSVP, UNLESS you do not get last minute e-mails from Yahoo, on this fun, fast paced 5 mile exploration of all of Roosevelt Island. Although it would be nice to see some cherry trees in bloom- I don’t control whether this happens in case you were wondering- the Festival is secondary. This is one interesting but weird little island-which will be undergoing very significant changes in the very near future. We will visit the Franklin Delano Roosevelt Four Freedoms Memorial Park, we’ll see some old ruins, the “Octagon” (which has an amazing spiral staircase) and is now an upscale residential building but was once a “lunatic” asylum and many other sites. The pace will be fast and we will stop very briefly a number of times to talk about what we see. There are always surprises along the way. The waterfront views are really great. We will meet BEFORE 10:30 A.M. We will finish around 1:30 P.M. WE LEAVE PROMPTLY. NO FOOD STOPS.

(By now, I bet you have stopped reading the description of this event. Don’t stop. Keep going)

Please consider joining the Appalachian Mountain Club (AMC) http://www.amc-ny.org/ The Club offers many hikes, walks and events and is also active in conservation efforts and trail maintenance. Only a few of the many hikes and walks that are offered by AMC leaders are posted on Meetup.

 Since this event will be posted as a last minute hike to AMC Club members, there is NO need for AMC club members to RSVP for this-unless you don’t get last minute e-mails from Yahoo. (Contact me a few days before the hike if you are a dues paying AMC Club member and don’t get these e-mails and I’ll tell you how). Let’s leave 10 spaces for AMC Meetup members. Needless to say, please take the RSVP process seriously and be considerate. If you have been a NO SHOW on any previous AMC Meetup event that I have led or are an abuser of the RSVP process–see your Attendance History- please do not sign up for this event because I am just going to delete your RSVP. Let someone else go who will actually show up. SOME PRIORITY WILL BE GIVEN TO THOSE WHO HAVE PREVIOUSLY ATTENDED OTHER AMC MEETUP EVENTS THAT I HAVE LED.

I ONLY KEEP A WAIT LIST FOR A SHORT TIME.

 I am going to ask that people not post any comments or questions prior to the event. You have more than enough information to do this once you get the meeting details. No offense, but I don’t need to know-and probably neither does anyone else- what you are doing that day if you can’t make it or what you think the weather will be. AFTER the event, post as many comments and photos as you like.

If the weather forecast is really bad, See the Accuweather website like I do, I will post a notice on the day of the hike by 8:00 A.M. If there is no notice, we go. We will start and finish right near public transportation.
results.name: Roosevelt Island Expedition and Cherry Blossom Festival

group.name: Appalachian Mountain Club New York-North Jersey

results.description:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/modern-breakthrough-workshop-for-women-tickets-24268451592

LADIES, IT'S YOUR TIME TO BE FABULOUS! 

Immerse yourself in a room with amazing women who are all there to experience an overload of unconditional self love.

It's your time to shine! Don't miss this life changing day! 

CLICK HERE TO REGISTER: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/modern-breakthrough-workshop-for-women-tickets-24268451592


Have you ever heard the expression that you need to put 10,000 hours into something in order to experience success?  Is there a short cut?  

Yes, there is!

The Modern Breakthrough mission is to create real shifts in over 500,000 women to experience techniques that will help you live a life you are excited and passionate about, and the results don't take 10,000 hours. You get the transformation in just six hours! 

We know that is a bold statement, but the proof is in the pudding. 

The short cut lies in the quality of the ideas, techniques and processes that we guide you through which will take you in the exact direction you need to experience a drastic shift in your perception, overall life and how you feel about yourselves.  

These ideas and practices that you will experience are time tested and proven. 


Topics that you will experience breakthroughs in: 
- Self Love 
- Relationships 
- Communication
- Decision Making
- Creativity
- Manifesting Your Reality

Join thousands of women who are dedicated to living a life that brings them joy and fulfillment! We look forward to sharing in this experience with you. 

With love & abundance, 

Ayelet & Elena 


CLICK HERE TO REGISTER: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/modern-breakthrough-workshop-for-women-tickets-24268451592


ABOUT THE FACILITATORS: 

Aylelet Shimron

Having spoken for audiences around the world, Ayelet has been inspiring people for nearly a decade serving as a Life Coach, Speaker Trainer, and Author of the books "Goddess Guide to Get the Guy" and "Modern Breakthrough: a Guide For Women Who Want to Reinvent Their Lives."

Life Done Your Way, her company's mantra, has become a lifestyle for people. Whether your goal is to become a powerful public speaker, increase sales in your career, or transform your personal life by learning to control your thoughts and emotions, Ayelet teaches key techniques on how to accomplish just that. She uses an ancient 5,000 year old Vedic techniques to help clients overcome fear, anxiety, and self doubt. As a result, people leave feeling empowered, confident and ready to leave their footprint on the planet. 

www.AyeletShimron.com 

https://www.facebook.com/ayelet.shimron

Elena Zelenina

Elena helps people expand and discover new depth to their own being. These discoveries will help you design an exciting life that you are thrilled to live and correct some things that you do not think are working for you now.
Elena is an artist, a teacher and an author. She has a lot of things to share with you in a way that will make learning new concepts easy. Elena's has over 30 years of teaching experience from three different countries; USA, Russia and India. A lot of people call her sessions "breakthrough sessions" because of the positive impact it's had on their lives.

Elena's mission strives to expand your creativity and connection to life through a transformative art experience so you can accomplish your personal goals, experience breakthroughs and maybe even become an artist!

http://www.elenazelenina.com 

https://www.facebook.com/ElenaZeleninamentor

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Outdoors
ADMISSION: TBA

DESCRIPTION:

• The dam, in Westchester County, has an unusual spillway, part artificial and part natural, which forms a waterfall on the north side of the structure. New Croton Dam has a public park and trail head at its base and a road along its crest. Road use is limited to pedestrians and emergency vehicles.

• Known by locals simply as "Teatown", the organization works to conserve biodiversity, teach ecology and promote nature-friendly living. Located in the heart of the Lower Hudson Valley's Hudson Highlands bioregion, Teatown Lake Reservation's mission is to conserve open space, educate citizens about the environment, and involve the public in order to sustain the diversity of wildlife, plants and habitats for future generations.

• Untermyer Park (also known as Untermyer Gardens, previously part of an estate known as Greystone) is a historic park of 43 acres, situated in Yonkers, Westchester County, New York, just north of New York City. Untermyer Park is on a hillside above the Hudson River and features a rock garden, a "Grecian garden" (actually a Persian Paradise garden), a small Grecian-style amphitheater, a classical pavilion, pergola, statuary, and a view of the river.

ATTRACTIONS:

• Water Fall @ New Croton Dam

• DAM @ New Croton Dam

http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-4nTYaCdxUJg/VAKXtCIJOCI/AAAAAAAAIUk/NzzNwQysGHI/s1600/DL7A9596.JPG

• River @ New Croton Dam

• Lakes @ New Croton Dam

• Long Boardwalk @ Tea Town Reservation

• Garden @ untermyer park

Temple @ untermyer park

DIFFICULTY: Super Easy 
DISTANCES: 4.5 Miles
DURATION: 3 Hours

PLEASE BRING BOTH A BLUE T-SHIRT & A WHITE T-SHIRT.                                                                                                                                                                                 Started by a group of soccer fanatics who love to play the Beautiful Game and wanted to create a meetup for individuals of all levels. 

Our Mission: Play safe, get your workout on & HAVE FUN!!

The Lowdown: 

1. Play safe,  games are 7v7 including goalie, NO slide tackles, excessive aggression will NOT be tolerated (the precinct is across the street...LOL!!).  

2. Cleats are permitted, and Sneakers or Turf Shoes are acceptable as well. We play for an hour with a break in the middle. If no volunteered goal keeper, players will rotate the position. We play with corner kicks and throw-ins. Also, everyone should bring a Blue T-Shirt AND a White T-Shirt.

3. Pitch Location: Between Baxter & Mulberry St.with additional entrance on Worth & Bayard St. 

4. Nearest train stations: Brooklyn Bridge (4, 5 & 6), Canal Street (A, B, C, Q, R, N & 6), Chambers Street (J and Z). Citibike station is available right next to the field on Worth Street. 

5. HAVE FUN!

See you Downtown! 

Terms and Conditions of the participating in our group:

PLEASE READ THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE CAREFULLY. 
BY USING THIS WEBSITE, YOU AGREE TO THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS. 

JOINING AND SIGNING UP FOR DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 

I certify that I am 18 years of age or older and that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore I, individually, hereby release and discharge, DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizers and Co-organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER programs or activities. 

DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER Organizer and its Co-Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to DOWNTOWN PICKUP SOCCER use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

The Downtown Pickup Soccer Team

group.name: MANHATTAN SOCCER - COED SOCCER IN NYC

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

results.description:
The theme of the festival this year is Bluegrass music, but there are 3 stages and there is Irish music, various Folk music, a crafts fair, and food vendors. You can bring your own food if you’d like. Parking is free but you have to look for it. This is also Rutgers Day and AG Field Day so they have free buses between the various campuses if you want to venture out to the other venues on the program. There is a big open sided tent that has folding chairs but I bring my own and place it by the main stage right-hand corner facing the stage, near the back of the tent. I could be under the tent or just outside it. I will have a Meetup sign on the back of my chair and will be there at 11 am. At times I will be walking around to check out the other stages, crafts, and food. I won’t always be sitting in the chair but will check the meetup comments or private message me your cell number during the day if anyone wants to find me. In the meantime, place your chair near mine and we’ll find each other. This is an outdoor festival and is rain or shine so prepare for the weather. Sun screen could be a good idea. Festival runs from 11 AM to 6 PM, but depending on the entertainment I could leave a little earlier than that. April 30, 2016: Bluegrass Showcase!
Join us for our 42nd festival event on Saturday, April 30th, 2016, to enjoy our Bluegrass Showcase. There will be live music and dance performances, an astounding array of crafts and food vendors as well as children's activities and heritage demonstrations. The New Jersey Folk Festival is a large-scale, multi-faceted family and educational event that attracts approximately 15,000 to 18,000 people annually. Always held the last Saturday of April on the expansive grounds fronting the Eagleton Institute Woodlawn, at the 191 Ryders Lane, on the corner of George Street and Ryders Lane. The festival runs all day – 10am to 6pm – rain or shine, and is open to the public free of charge.
http://www.njfolkfest.org/
Phone: 848.445.INFO (4636)
results.name: New Jersey Folk Festival

results.description:
NYC HOLI HAI 2016 

Invite your friends on our facebook event page: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/476140212578691/

Register here:

www.nycholi2016.eventbrite.com

Join us for the 7th edition of New York's own and exclusive Festival of Colors - NYC Holi Hai 2016!


Every year with the onset of spring, we bring to you the fest that celebrates colors, music, culture, dance, food, and much more!

Watch the highlights of Holi Hai 2015: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t8p7PlqI__c

Volunteer with us : Fill this volunteer form to join Holi Hai's dedicated team!

 *COLORS FROM OUTSIDE WILL NOT BE PERMITTED* 

FAQs

What is Holi?

Holi is a traditional Indian festival that is celebrated with vibrant colors. With its international appeal, the festival has crossed borders and is celebrated in different parts of the world. In Manhattan, we invite everyone irrespective of their religion and background to take part in the festivities and enjoy the culture, music and colors.

What do people do at Holi?

Holi is celebrated by using colored powder. People get themselves and others colored all over and have a good time with the music, dance and festivities. At NYC Holi Hai, we create an energetic ambience with groovy music and lively dance performances on stage.

What should I wear?

The colors allowed at the fest are non-staining and get washed easily. However, wear something you don't mind throwing away later. Tip: colors look best on white!

Is this for everyone?

Yes! We welcome everyone irrespective of nationality, religion or background. It is a festival where you embrace people from all over and immerse yourself in a sea of color.

Where do we get colored powder? Do I have to bring my own?

No, you cannot bring colors. We will have color stalls to buy from at the event. We use non-toxic and FDA approved colors. Unfortunately, we cannot gaurantee that yours are as safe as ours. 

What about ages groups, is this event children-friendly?

Yes, our event is for all age groups, from kids to adults. We create an environment where everyone can have fun and enjoy the food, music and dance.

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

All ages are welcome to the event. This is a family friendly event and you are more than welcome to get kids along. You don't have to register separately for kids. 

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Your registration also enters you into the Raffle contest. You will be required to show a valid ID which matches the information on your ticket in case you are one of the winners in the Raffle contests.

Both printed and tickets on mobile phones will be accepted as valid.

How do I get to the festival venue? 

Dag Hammarskjold Plaza can best be accessed by walking from the 51st street subway stop of the 6 Train, the Lexington Av/53rd Street stop on the E and M Trains, or from Grand Central Station for those arriving by MetroNorth.

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

There is no dedicated parking facility. Street parking may be available in the vicinity of the park plaza which is located at the intersection of 1st Ave and 2nd Ave on 47th St.

What can/can't I bring to the event?

You cannot bring colors from outside. Environmnent friendly and safe colors will be available for sale at the venue.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Email us at [masked]

Is my registration/ticket transferrable?

No. Your registration also enters you into the Raffle contest. You will be required to show a valid ID which matches the information on your ticket in case you are one of the winners in the Raffle contests.

I have registered and have a ticket for myself. Can I bring kids along with me without a FREE ticket?

Yes. You can bring kids with you without getting a separate ticket for them. Your free ticket is your entry to the raffle contest.

What do I need to do if I win one of the Raffle prizes?

You should be 18+ and have a valid government ID that matches the information on your event ticket to claim your prize.
