Inline skate lesson for Beginner to intermediate skaters.
My friends and fellow skaters!

Welcome to the 2016 Skating Season!!!

Skate School by Central Park Skate Patrol is welcoming you to the first skating class of the season!

Cost of this class is: $25 per individual class, $45 for 2 classes or $60 for package of 3 classes; discount packages should be paid in full; fees are collected before class begins, however we suggest that you to pay in advance, using Pay Pal option.

Please note that you must have complete set of protection gear and helmet to participate in class. Currently there is no rental, so you need to purchase all items.

We meet Just inside the West 72nd Street Entrance to Central Park at 11:00AM, The class leaves for the lesson area by 11:10AM.  We will then walk to the practice area so we are geared up ready to skate by 11:30AM.

Reminder – wrist guards, helmets, knee and elbow pads are required to participate in class. These items have to be purchased in advance. Please check all of your gear before coming to class to see if it fits properly. Make sure the wheels, buckles, straps, snaps, laces and everything else is in good working order.

Please note that if it is raining or the lesson surface is wet, we will NOT have the class. Cancelation of class will be posted in advance.
If you have any other questions, please post them on this page or text/call me at [masked]

results.description:
We will see the beautiful Cherry Trees Blossoming, walk the Roosevelt Island East River shorefront, Plus if you want, do an optional overhead tram ride across the East River.

WE MEET AT 11:AM at the "F" train Roosevelt Island station entrance.   We will start to walk at 11:15 towards the Cherry Tree walkways.

There will be many of us on this walk so feel free to leave the group and explore by yourselves if you like. We will not take attendance or try to keep the group together so you can explore on you own. It is very easy to find your way back to the subway station if you decide to leave the group.

The walk will continue along the shorefront paths of Roosevelt Island and then through the Monument Park at the southern end of the island.

The sight of the cherry trees blossoming is gorgeous and the East side of Manhattan's buildings and skyline is spectacular. The air is much cleaner than between the buildings of the city and the walk is relaxing. After we visit Monument Park we will walk all the way to the North end of the Island to the lighthouse park area. We will walk back to the "F" train and Tram ride stations and end the walk there

. We estimate the length to be about four miles altogether. Probably about two hours + or -, more if you go on the tram. You can leave at any time if you have time constraint

As a bonus, there is the optional overhead Tram Ride over the East River into Manhattan as a gorgeous skyscraper scenic ride across the river. It only costs one subway fare on your Metrocard and ends at  second  avenue and  59th street. The tram ride is optional and we will not go as a group, you can chose to go or not on your own. The #6 subway stop is a few blocks away and that line offers a transfer to the "E" train so you can get back to Queens if that is where you started from. Alternatively you can turn around and take the tram back to the island. The choice is yours.

  Hope to CYA there!

We would like to ask you for a donation of one dollar to help offset the cost meet up charges us to use their web site.
results.how_to_find_us: We will be just outside the train station.There is only one station and only one entrance so you won't get lost!
results.name: Roosevelt Island Cherry Blossom Festival + Riverwalk + Tram Ride To Manhattan

results.description:
Amol Tallahassee will lead the discussion into 'epsilon expansion' for the calculations of the critical exponents.


Critical phenomena are a fascinating class of phenomena which occur near the second order phase transition points in condensed matter systems. At these critical points, system forgets about the microscopic details, it becomes scale invariant and the dynamics is governed by the long wavelength degrees of freedom, which explains the universal behavior of diﬀerent microscopic systems (such as: proteins, water, magnets) at the critical points, characterized by the critical exponents. In addition, detailed analyses of these concepts have helped us clarify old issues related to renormalization in Quantum Field Theory and these critical exponent could surprisingly be calculated using Feynman Diagrams (an epsilon expansion).


Reference:

1] http://www-math.unice.fr/~patras/CargeseConference/ACQFT09_JZinnJustin.pdf


2] http://www.scholarpedia.org/article/Critical_Phenomena:_field_theoretical_approach


3] http://staff.washington.edu/bdjwww/1973WilsonKogut.pdf   I've found the introductory discussion (pages78-83) extremely useful.

4] An Introduction of Quantum Field Theory, Peskin and Schroeder (Chapter 12 & 13)

Note:

The NY Quantum Theory Meetup group is most thankful to ThoughtWorks for gracefully allowing us to use their premises. Meetup participants are requested to be respectful and considerate of those premises and all other people therein. Thanks.

We'll have coffee and bagels.

*************************************

NOTICE - Please support our donation drive to pay for our group's yearly Meetup fees. Donation info and instructions... http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/messages/boards/thread/49619820

*************************************

Let me share the area I call home with you via a walking food crawl tour of Bay Ridge's varied foods, culture, and peoples. Enjoy the tree line streets and water front under the Verrazanno Bridge with lower Manhattan in view. Welcome to my 'hood - BAY RIDGE!


Strutting down the pavement, the remnants of that classic disco beat by the Bee Gees stuck in your head, you’re walking down the same street as John Travolta (aka Tony Manero) in the opening scene of Saturday Night Fever (1977). 35 years later, you can still recognize the neighbourhood: teenagers chat on stoops, Italian deli owners greet passersby, and mothers call from windows for their children to return home for dinner.

Nestled in the heart of Brooklyn, at the foot of the sprawling Verrazano Bridge, lies an oasis amidst the clutter and chaos of New York City that just falls off the bottom of the map of most travel guides: Bay Ridge. Brimming with hometown pride, it’s a small neighbourhood within the fourth largest city in the world. Most people from Bay Ridge are born there and live there until the day they die - commuting to Manhattan for work but always returning to the block they call home. Ask people here where they’re from and they don’t say Brooklyn, they say Bay Ridge.


Destinations and Attractions:

#1 -LESKE'S BAKERY - 7612 Fifth Avenue, (718)[masked] (R train - 77 Street Station)

We will begin our day with a sweet light breakfast at LESKE'S BAKERY. After over half a century in Bay Ridge, Leske's has firmly established itself in the culinary fabric of the neighborhood. It's a bakery in the truest sense of the word; everything is baked at their Fifth Avenue facility, leaving just enough room for a long glass case to display all the goodies. Seating inside? Fuggedaboutit. Luckily, many of their treats are meant to be consumed sans knife and fork, like their legendary Black and Whites ($2.50), oodles of cookies and maple bacon-covered doughnuts ($1.75). But for the ultimate hostess gift or to snag brownie points with visiting family, be sure to snag one of their Kringlers ($11), pretzel-shaped pastries filled with fruits like apricot and raspberry. Then there are the incredible Pecan Rings ($14.75), frosted and topped with nuts and cheese, if you wish. There's almost no end to the parade of delicious baked goods they offering, from their traditional Scandinavian rye bread, Irish soda bread, almond croissants, cheese cake, black out cake, danish, breads and rolls.

http://www.leskesbakery.com/

#2- BROOKLYN BEET COMPANY -[masked]rd Avenue, (347)[masked]


BROOKLYN BEET COMPANY If you don't like communal seating, you may not get on board with the third in the fleet of Korzo restaurants. If you like delicious burgers, however, this is a must-see on your tour of Bay Ridge. Billed as a "Farm to (Communal) Table," the railroad-style eatery is one place you can nab the Korzo Burger: a beef patty topped with applewood-smoked bacon, Allgauer Emmentaller cheese, an organic ale mustard and dill pickle...wrapped in langos bread and then deep fried. If you'd like to keep your arteries open for a few more trips around the sun, consider the restaurant's lighter fare, like Steamed PEI Mussels ($16) in a fragrant shallot, cilantro, jalapeno, pork belly and mushroom broth or the Organic Quinoa Trout Salad ($17), stuffed with arugula, blackened corn, summer squash, trout and a poached farm egg.

http://www.korzorestaurant.com/bbc-brunch/

#3- KARAM -[masked]th Avenue, (718)[masked]


KARAM "You know a place is good when it's the size of a shoe closet, has looked the same for 20 years, and is always packed to the gills with middle eastern men." That's how Allison Robicelli describes this lively schawarma spot, where they're roasting seasoned meats right in the window and displaying all sorts of other Middle Eastern treats in glasses cases inside. You'll find quite a few of these no frills spots to grab an inexpensive plate of falafel in the neighborhood, but the playful staff and generous portions here make this a local favorite. They're not going to win any design awards, but it's what's inside the pita the counts. Like thinly shaved marinated lamb ($5), spicy beef and lamb sausages ($7.50) and babaghanouj ($5) topped with tahini. Don't miss out on a segment of baklava ($1.50) or a Maamoul cookie ($1.75) filled with dates, walnuts and pistachios.

http://karam-brooklyn.com/

#4- THE KETTLE BLACK -[masked]rd Ave Brooklyn, NY 11209


A Bay Ridge favorite restaurant and bar since 2004 with it's self proclaimed Best Wing's in Brooklyn! I must admit they are darn good!


http://kettleblackbar.com/

#5- ALC ITALIAN GROCERY -[masked]rd Ave. | Bay Ridge, Brooklyn

In 2012 Louis founded A.L.C. as a nod to the historic salumerias that seemed to be all but disappearing. Louis wanted a return to the ‘mom and pop’ shops he grew up with and thought there would be no better place for this than the neighborhood where he was born and raised, and currently resided. He found this to be the perfect opportunity to bring the same entrepreneurial spirit and love of family and food that his father and grandfather had to a new generation of Italian Americans. ALC is a neighborhood market that represents heritage, family, and great food.

http://www.alcitaliangrocery.com/

#6- DELISIO CONFECTIONS -[masked]th Street off 3rd, (718)[masked]


DELISIO CONFECTIONS It would probably surprise many people to know that a former Charles Schwab stockbroker is turning out some of the tastiest, most luscious chocolates in South Brooklyn, but that's exactly what's happening at this small confections shop run by Anthony Deliso. Open since 2012, the shop specializes in beautiful and delicious truffles, bonbons, chocolate bars, brittles, caramels and literally dozens of other sweets. Delisio makes everything in-house from scratch—much of it on a daily basis—ensuring the freshest ingredients and not a stale bit of chocolate in sight.

http://www.delisoconfections.com/

#7- PANEANTICO CAFE & BAKERY -[masked]rd Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11209


Paneantico Bakery and Café has been serving great food and heavenly bakery and pastry items since it was established in the year 2000. The name was inspired from the two Italian words “Pane” & “Antico”, which means old-fashioned bread.

We serve family inspired recipes from Italy, bringing to life childhood favorites both savory and sweet. Open seven days a week, Paneantico offers a wide selection of pastries and desserts, breads, coffee, breakfast, lunch and dinner options. This includes our delicious salads, sandwiches made on our freshly made “in house” artisanal breads and homemade Italian hot meals made with the highest quality ingredients.

http://paneantico.com/

#8- CAMPANIA COAL FIRED OVEN PIZZA -[masked]th Ave Brooklyn, NY 11209

results.description:
THE THREE POISONS – GREED

"For greed, all nature is too little."

"Greed’s worst point is its ingratitude."

Seneca

This week we will look at the third of the The Three Poisons – Greed.

Over the last few weeks we’ve discussed why the Three Poisons of delusion, hatred and greed affect our lives so strongly and keep turning the cycles of dissatisfaction. One reason they do comes from a misperception we have of being separate and isolated from everything else. And, it’s true that our perceptions seem to “prove” that separation is true.  But, in moments of clear awareness, we also have glimpses of being an integral part of a kind of universal everything. Those glimpses seem reason enough to investigate our misconception about absolute separateness and expand our view toward knowing more open and expansive awareness.

And, we can apply this investigation toward a better understanding of our relationship to greed and wanting and desire. If the body needs nourishment, our hunger lets us know to look for food.  But when we get overwhelmed or consumed by the desire, it can be a short trip from satisfying basic needs to incessant seeking anything and everything we believe will let the isolated and separate “me” feel safe and happy.

Trying to look at our relationship with greed is tricky because it has many flavors from powerful to subtle. It’s easy to miss how it operates in us since we tend to only pay attention to what we want, not that we are wanting. We also often know what needs to happen to satisfy our “separate self,” but we miss the fact that we created those expectations in the first place. I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.


Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: Wheel of Life - Greed and Generosity

results.description:
It's spring and that means we sketch the amazing Conservatory Gardens! It's one of my favorite spots and we sketch there every year. Come sit under the wisteria arbor and tour the three formal gardens: English, French, and Italian. We'll meet at the entrance on 5th Ave and walk in together.

Any problems on the day of the event, I can be reached at [masked]. 


Looking forward to sketching with you!


----------

In case of rain, I will let people know early in the morning if it is canceled, and then reschedule for another day.

----------

What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!

• We sketch for a bit, usually 45 minutes or so, and then get back together and share our drawings, and then sketch again, etc. There's usually time for 3 or 4 sketches.

• Please bring your own supplies - anything you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos to share on the site later. Take a bunch!

• Please take care to make sure we do not leave any trash behind. Please also leave the dogs at home; they tend to knock over the artwork. Thanks. 

• This Meetup is FREE and everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

----------

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to regular attendee.

Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.

results.description:
Join us for April's Book Club at Van Gogh's Ear Cafe!


This month's book is: The Nest by Cynthia D'Aprix Sweeney


*Note that the book isn't released until March 22nd. It is currently available for pre-order on Amazon.com

Book Summary: A warm, funny and acutely perceptive debut novel about four adult siblings and the fate of the shared inheritance that has shaped their choices and their lives.

Every family has its problems. But even among the most troubled, the Plumb family stands out as spectacularly dysfunctional. Years of simmering tensions finally reach a breaking point on an unseasonably cold afternoon in New York City as Melody, Beatrice, and Jack Plumb gather to confront their charismatic and reckless older brother, Leo, freshly released from rehab. Months earlier, an inebriated Leo got behind the wheel of a car with a nineteen-year-old waitress as his passenger. The ensuing accident has endangered the Plumbs' joint trust fund, “The Nest,” which they are months away from finally receiving. Meant by their deceased father to be a modest mid-life supplement, the Plumb siblings have watched The Nest’s value soar along with the stock market and have been counting on the money to solve a number of self-inflicted problems.

Melody, a wife and mother in an upscale suburb, has an unwieldy mortgage and looming college tuition for her twin teenage daughters. Jack, an antiques dealer, has secretly borrowed against the beach cottage he shares with his husband, Walker, to keep his store open. And Bea, a once-promising short-story writer, just can’t seem to finish her overdue novel. Can Leo rescue his siblings and, by extension, the people they love? Or will everyone need to reimagine the futures they’ve envisioned? Brought together as never before, Leo, Melody, Jack, and Beatrice must grapple with old resentments, present-day truths, and the significant emotional and financial toll of the accident, as well as finally acknowledge the choices they have made in their own lives.

This is a story about the power of family, the possibilities of friendship, the ways we depend upon one another and the ways we let one another down. In this tender, entertaining, and deftly written debut, Cynthia D'Aprix Sweeney brings a remarkable cast of characters to life to illuminate what money does to relationships, what happens to our ambitions over the course of time, and the fraught yet unbreakable ties we share with those we love.

I look forward to seeing you all at this month's book club event!
results.name: April Book Club Brunch

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT. 

I have scheduled a similar walk on Sunday, May 1st.  However, this walk on Saturday, April 30th is starting at an earlier time.

IF YOU DON'T LIKE STOPPING IN A NUMBER OF ARTIST STUDIOS, THEN THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU. BECAUSE THE GREENPOINT ARTISTS ARE SPREAD OUT OVER A LARGE AREA, WE'LL BE WALKING ABOUT 3 1/2 AT A MODERATE PACE. YOU ALSO WILL HAVE PLENTY OF TIME TO SOCIALIZE WITH OTHERS.

According to the MTA website, the "L" subway train will be running normally on Saturday, April 30th.

http://travel.mtanyct.info/serviceadvisory/NoScheduledAdvisory.aspx?faultstringerror%20#20007--Trip%20not%20possible

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo.

Description: Greenpoint Open Artists Studios (GOS) has nearly 300 participating artists. These artists are opening their doors to the public and sharing their work. The artists don't charge admission to their art studios. We'll stop in some of these art studios and get a rare, intimate view of the artists' working environment. We can also talk to the artists about what they do. This art walk features painting, photography, ceramics, mixed-media, sculpture, and printmaking. 

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (before lunch) at 11:30 AM. Bring your lunch or buy lunch on Bedford Avenue (which has many stores to buy lunch) before the start of the walk.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the entrance to The Bean Coffee Shop at 101 Bedford Avenue, which is located at Bedford Avenue and North 11th Street. Before the walk, a restroom is available in The Bean Coffee Shop. There will also be places to stop for a restroom during the walk.

Transportation: Take the "L" subway train to Bedford Avenue and North 7th Street in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The Bedford Avenue subway station is 4 blocks away from The Bean Coffee Shop. Walk north on Bedford Avenue from North 7th Street to North 11th Street.

Finishing Time/Place: This art walk will finish at about 4:15 PM on Bedford Avenue, so we won't be too far from the  "L" subway train on Bedford Avenue. 

Only heavy rain or rain with windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is heavy rain or rain with windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning (before 8:30 AM). If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If it is raining, I will just bring an umbrella. (We will be spending half the time inside these artist studios anyway. Plus, this event is held only once a year, so there is no rain date to reschedule it.)

Below is public art by Howard Kalish.

Below is an illustration by Greg Kletsel.

Along the way, we'll be walking through the Greenpoint Historic District with Victorian townhouses and the Eberhard Faber Pencil Company Historic District, which houses many art studios.

Below is a painting by Jim D'Amato.

Below is a sculpture by Jordan Griska.

Below is a painting by Matthew Schwab.
results.name: Greenpoint Artist Studio Walk (Apr 30)

Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Okay, World Food Lovers, here is your opportunity to savor authentic, unique, and flavorful traditional Indonesian dishes often not found in New York restaurants! It’s the Fourth Annual Indonesian Food Bazaar and it promises to be a delicious afternoon. (The proceeds go to needy children in Indonesia, certainly a worthy cause.)

Although the posted hours are from 12pm to 5pm, we strongly suggest that you arrive before noon. Experience has taught us that these events populate quickly and the best dishes often sell out near the beginning of the festivities.

Typically, tickets are sold for $1 at the door and in the past the cost per item hovered around $5, so we advise buying a bunch of tickets when you arrive to avoid multiple trips waiting for the cashier.

To maximize your experience and take advantage of the fact that you’re a member of the World Food Lovers Dining Out Group, we propose that everyone purchase a dish (or two, or more!) and share with all of us. That way, we all have the opportunity to taste a rainbow of delicacies!

So many of us feel that our meetups max out so quickly that they don’t have a chance to participate. Not this time! Obviously, there’s no cap on the number of WFLDOG members who can attend, so there’s no excuse to stay home!

Need more inducement? Check out Dave Cook's Eating in Translation post covering last year's bazaar and his tantalizing slideshow of the event.


Join us on Saturday, April 30! We’re looking forward to seeing you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Closest subway is the Forest Hills/71st Avenue station on the E,F,M, and R trains, but check the MTA's website for any details about weekend logistical nightmares.
results.name: Fourth Annual Indonesian Food Bazaar

group.name: The World Food Lover's Dining Out Group

results.description:
Like a rush hour R train, International Tabletop Day on April 30th is slowly rumbling our way!  Join billions (would you believe tens of thousands?) of people around the world as we nerd-out collectively with light, fun board and card games.  This will be a unique edition of our monthly meetup--a special all day/night celebration of dice, cardboard and unique shared experiences with good people! 

Win a copy of "Skull!" With your $3 donation, get a ticket and potential to win a spanking new, hot out of an Amazon box, copy of Skull. Check it out!

“What a beautifully simple game. What it really boils down to… is looking into the eyes of the people you’re playing with, wavering your hand over their stack and making eye contact as if to say, ‘Is that a Skull or is that a Rose?’” 


https://vimeo.com/89623381

Our Tabletop Day meetup will feature a large bearded man (let's call him Bill) with a bag full of games for good boys and girls to play.  All you'll need is a fun, competitive spirit and a $3 donation for the Impact Network (learn more here).  Regulars and myself will happily and patiently explain these games to anyone who joins. If games are underway when you arrive, get a drink, grab a chair and sidle up to a group in progress. A new game will no doubt be starting soon. 

“But” you say “you guys play games I've never heard of. They must be long and complex.”  Not at all! Admittedly we don't play party games but we do play mostly light, family-friendly modern games.  If you've ever been turned off by an endless Monopoly game or the utter randomness of Uno, you'll like what game designers have been up to lately.  Certainly no disrespect to those trailblazing games but modern games have taken their ideas and distilled them into potent, streamlined experiences that play in a relatively short time with easy rules. In particular, our meetup plays games that encourage socializing, fragile partnerships and everyone’s favorite, lying!

“But Bill” you might say, “Noon? Really?” I know, it's super early for a Saturday but we'll be there for at least seven hours so show up whenever your bedroom stops spinning and you can comfortably handle  the thought of beer.  

As day turns to night Diana will arrive to take over, ushering in an evening of more drinks and even more games! Be sure to check out her posting.

The more the merrier so check out the Facebook post and pressure your friends into coming!

Now, I do want to mention one thing that is important, though this has never been an issue.  My games are my babies.  So, like any good parent, I'm highly protective of them--especially my favorites (don't tell them I have favorites).  Please treat the games well. Don't bend the cards and be mindful of drinks and food. Also, we've created a culture of gracious winners and losers so remember the games are all in good fun.  Lastly, rules are harder to explain then you might think so be patient with the anyone trying.

And for those experienced gamers, the emphasis at this event will be on gateway and family weight games for a beginner-friendly experience. That said, feel free to bring your copy of The Cones of Dunshire--just don't push it on less experienced gamers.


Suggested Price of Admission

For $3, the Impact Network can educate a student in Zambia for a month.  With that in mind, I'm going to suggest everyone who comes chip in $3.  What do you get for your money?  Me, my sparkling smile and a pile of games to play with for hours.  And with any luck, they'll be spinning vinyl records.  So come, have a beer, meet good people, listen to some funky music and play great games for a good good cause.  I challenge you to find a better deal for three bucks!
results.how_to_find_us: At the tables in the back.  516 314-0228
results.name: Board Gameday--International Tabletop Day

LEVEL 3

There rocks so no Kevlar or fiberglass boats!

For those who don't want to paddle with the crowd on the day before their Famous Race. We will be going out the day after the race for a quieter run.

Pleasant Valley to Poughkeepsie, NY

8 mile Run
moderate
moving flat water
No Rentals must have your own!

Finish line in Greenvale Park, Rt. 376, Poughkeepsie. 8am-3pm. Free for spectators.

The creek flows in a north–south direction on the eastern side of the Hudson River. The creek's source is Thompson Pond near Pine Plains, and it heads southeastward towards its mouth in the Hudson River near New Hamburg. Along the way, it goes through fluctuations in width and follows an erratic path; in Wappingers Falls, it forms Wappinger Lake, a man-made reservoir. The initial .25 mi (0.40 km) of the creek runs through rocky, steep, wooded terrain. However as it approaches the Hudson it enters the river's tidal range, and has sandbars, mudflats and marshes. The creek is also home to numerous species, and is an important spawning area for anadromous fish, which thrive in the creek between April and June. Largemouth bass, bluegill, pumpkinseed, red-breasted sunfish, and brown bullhead, however, are resident species. Also, the creek is annually stocked with various species of trout for the purpose of recreational fishing.

results.description:
The weekend is almost here!! This week we are going to move and groove to the song "Dil Bole Haddippa" at our Naach Xpress Class in JC.  To increase the stakes, we are doing a remix version of the song. So get ready to dance and get your intense cardio workout at the same time!

What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it! 


Here is a class snip-it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70UcFvuNy1g

For further details and pricing for the class, please visit our website

www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!

results.description:
TableTop Day was founded in 2012 as a way to promote and celebrate gaming hobbies, and it’s quickly grown into an international party. It was founded by Geek and Sundry (Felicia Day's company that brings you Wil Wheaton on "Tabletop").  For the 4th Annual Event, we will meet up at Cobblestone's for a longer game play day!  

There will be games you may never have heard of ... Splendor, Saboteur, Survive - Escape From Atlantis, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Suburbia and many many more!! But, not to worry! People who bring the games will teach you how to play.  If you have a game you want to play, bring it along! 

Please note ... each attendee is required to purchase at least $15 of food or drinks.


If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  And again, if you want to bring one of your own games, that's cool too!  As a matter of fact, it's encouraged!  ;-)

results.description:
Shoot, Learn & Win A Printer! 


Shooting corporate/commercial photography in NYC has taught Larry Leone how to set up production quality lighting in some of the most cramped and poorly lit spaces and how to do it quickly. These are the same techniques he uses on beauty and glamour portraits. In this hands onworkshop we’ll learn how to light and shoot models in couture fashion and avant-garde styling. Using inexpensive equipment, we’ll capture production quality images in the “kill it and bill it” style prevalent in the New York market. We’ll use studio strobes and speedlites(maybe even mix the two). In this workshop, we’ll also discuss using a meter and metering on the fly. With Larry’s straightforward, light-hearted teaching style, this promises to be an enjoyable and informative event.

Here is your chance to get some great images for your portfolio. We’ll be working with a professional wardrobe stylist, a professional makeup artist as well as beautiful models.

WAIT THERE’S MORE!!!

One lucky attendee will win a brand new Canon Pixma  PRO-100 Professional Inkjet printer.  (a $399.00 retail value)

ACT FAST – Space is limited.

Registration and Deposit required for RSVP

Register Here:  http://imlarry.me/Reg430
Pay $20 deposit via Paypal to [masked] or click here.
results.name: Avant-Garde & Couture

results.description:
This is our very first Argentine Tango MeetUp Workshop.  Please invite your friends to join our MeetUp.  No Partner is required.  We rotate dancing with different partners.  No experience is necessary, just a desire to learn.  

Argentine tango is perhaps the most beautiful partner dance.  It's extremely popular in NYC, in the country, and around the world.  .

We plan on having a small group, 10-16 to provide individual attention.           The cost is $15, cash only, for the whole 2 hour workshop.  

With sufficient interest in this Argentine Tango MeetUp, this may become a regular weekly or biweekly event. It's your Club.

results.name: Special Argentine Tango Workshop.

results.description:
George Keeley is a popular craft beer bar on the upper west side.  It gets packed after work and most people don't like going uptown during the weekday so I thought the weekend would be best for this venue.

We will get there at 12 noon when they open and claim our spot.  Besides having 20+ tap lines of craft beer they also have food!

Depending on how we feel afterwards we might do a little crawl on Amsterdam Avenue.  If there's room for us we'll check out Jacob's Pickle, Joe's, and Amsterdam Ale House.

Come and join us!

Whether you’re new to fitness or have been working out for years, NYC In Your 20s is offering New Yorkers of all shapes, sizes and abilities FREE workout motivation every Saturday at 12:30 PM for six weeks, starting April 16, 2016.

NYC In Your 20s is helping New Yorkers get beach body ready by hosting their first annual fitness classes.  Over the course of six weeks, certified fitness trainer and nutritionist Oscar Flores and fitness instructor Bakari Taylor guide students through a warm-up before blasting through a series of fun, high-low impact choreographed workouts.  Suitable for people of all levels and free for everyone.  Sense of humor and flexible workout clothing required!

results.description:
Our last 'Brooklyn Museum' Scavenger Hunt Meetup was a big hit so we're doing it again! 

This is an INDOOR hunt and includes admission to the Brooklyn Museum. We will put together groups and you will receive a series of clues and perform mental and physical (nothing too strenuous) challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. You can sign up as a team or an individual and we will put you with a team. Each member of the winning team receives a gift package.

*PREPAY HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_1230PM

*Prepay Only Event. No tickets sold at door. 

What to expect: 


• Admission to the Brooklyn Museum

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  

*Tickets - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_1230PM

$35-$40 depending upon how early you purchase .

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 


What should I wear? Dress comfortable – Most teams wear sneakers.


What should I bring? A fun attitude, a smart phone if you have (fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. You can download that before you come.

What if it rains/snows? No problem, the scavenger hunt is all indoors.

How many people are attending? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be up to 40 members attending.


Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay here to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so please get your tickets ASAP.

PREPAY HERE-  https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_1230PM
results.name: The Amazing Brooklyn Museum Scavenger Hunt (includes entry to Museum)PREPAY ONLY

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. You can sign up as a team or an individual and we will put you with a team. Each member of the winning team receives a gift package.

*PREPAY HERE -https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_1230PM

*Prepay Only Event. No tickets sold at door. 

What to expect:  

• Admission to the Brooklyn Museum

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

results.description:
Roosevelt Island is holding their annual Cherry Blossom Festival on April 30. If the blossoms are blooming, it's quite a sight to behold. The trees ring almost the entire island and some parts in between. More details below . . .

We will meet outside the F train station at 12:45pm. We will wait a few min and then head over to the Tram at 12:55. After we gather everyone, we will continue on our way. Contact info will be emailed.

From their Facebook page:

Fifth Annual Cherry Blossom Festival / Concert - 

The Art of Japanese Shakuhachi Flute by Gerald Starlight

Composer/performer Gerald Starlight presents a program of new music for shakuhachi at Gallery RIVAA (Roosevelt Island Visual Arts Association) in the Fifth Annual Cherry Blossom Festival on Roosevelt Island, NY.

There will also be performances of traditional and contemporary music for koto ensemble, shamisen quartet and taiko drumming plus dance, martial arts, origami, ink painting, calligraphy, tea ceremony. The festival is from 1pm to 6pm. All events are free.

Date: Saturday, April 30, 2016, 5:00 PM 
Performer(s): Gerald Starlight, shakuhachi 
Venue Gallery RIVAA, 527 Main Street, Roosevelt Island, NYC 
Website: http://rivaa.com/event/cherry-blossom-festival
results.how_to_find_us: Outside the F train station. Contact info will be emailed
results.name: Roosevelt Island  Cherry Blossom Festival

venue.address_1: corner of Clark Street and Henry Street
venue.name: Hotel Saint George

results.description:
We're back for the 2016 season with one of our great crowd pleasers, Beautiful Brooklyn Heights NORTH!

Brooklyn Heights was the first-ever NYC neighborhood designated a Historic District, and a large part of that history is rooted in 19th-century abolitionism and events leading up to the Civil War. Yet there's even more than that. Hear about Brooklyn Heights' role in the Underground Railroad and about the larger-than-life minister Henry Ward Beecher, as well as why Abraham Lincoln turned down an exclusive luncheon invitation from one of the richest Republicans; who the tot once held by Marquis de Lafayette grew up to be; what happened to two lovers on the Titanic; where Washington Roebling spied out on the building of his Brooklyn Bridge; and how feminist and one-time Presidential candidate Victoria Woodhull exposed a red-hot sex scandal, all in the confines of this seemingly demure sets of streets.

Where to meet: Meet in front of the Hotel Saint George, on the corner of Clark Street and Henry Street.

When to meet: 12:45 pm for a  1pm start. I will be holding a sign that reads, "Brooklyn Heights NORTH".

Train: Take the 2,3 to "Clark Street" and you're right inside the Hotel Saint George's subway station. Come outside and find us on the corner.

Fee: $20, $15 for seniors 65 + with proof of age. Cash only, exact change appreciated! Please bring bills, not coins.  Sorry, please do not bring dogs or minor children age 17 or below on the tours.

The tour will be approximately 2.5 hours long. For sunny days, be sure to bring a hat and a bottle of water. Check the weather reports on the day of the tour; if there is a chance of rain, please bring your own umbrella.  While Friendly Native tours walk usually do take place on the date and at the time they are scheduled, on occasion they will be postponed in cases of high temperatures or high probability of rain,  and an email sent out to that effect to all who have registered for the event.

The nearest restrooms to this location are inside the restaurant across the street from our meeting place. Make a small purchase (like a danish) and use the facilities as a customer. Please be sure to "take care of things" before the start of the tour!
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a sign reading BROOKLYN HEIGHTS NORTH
results.name: 2016 Season Opener: Brooklyn Heights NORTH!

results.description:
Parking cost $8 per vehicle or free with an Empire Pass this time of year at Belmont State Lake Park.

Host: Mitch

If you’re available you’re welcome to join us. This will be about a 3 mile slow walk through the woods and around the lake. We'll meet in the first parking lot as you enter the park off of exit 38 of the Southern State Pkwy. I'll be there at 12:45pm to greet attending members. The walk will begin promptly at 1pm. Those who are late can catch up with the group by taking the path just east of the parking lot. After the walk, I will lead the group in a Greater Illumination Meditation Greater Illumination Video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bgo5BjTDZFQ&index=3&list=PLr4tp245pXRsHA870EdMw6DNYRNtAT77U

The Meditation of Greater Illumination: An Introduction

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kqAiFvX-aIw

The event is free other than parking.

I suggest people bring a bottle of water and a lite snack. Event is in 3 parts: Part 1 (12:45 - 1:00pm)

We meet in the parking lot entrance next to the ticket office. Part 2 (1pm - 2 pm)

Walk for one hour at a comfortable pace. The finish line will be the public restroom area. (Next to the playground)

Part 3 (2pm - 3pm)

I will lead the group in a Greater Illumination Meditation. See video as a reference. The park has plenty of picnic table/benches for part 3, so people can sit and rest as needed.

Statement of Risk

Certain risks are inherent in any walking or hiking event. By joining this meetup group event. I acknowledge and accept personal responsibility for the safety of myself and any guests that accompany me to this event. I further will not hold responsible the leadership team of Greater Illumination Meditation Practice Group" for injuries or damages that may occur during any and all walking or non walking "Greater Illumination Meditation Practice Group" events.
results.name: Walk in the Park & Meditation after...

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: Soccer Saturday -@west 134th Street Field - 12:45pm

results.description:
Join Genevieve (on her birthday!) and our friends at Synergy Hot Yoga for a Rocky Point Hiking, Yoga, Meditation Tour
Saturday, April 30, 1:00-4:00 pm FREE
(Optional donation to Monmouth County Park System)
Take a short hike to a spectacular secret lawn hideaway overlooking the Navesink River and Sea Bright for a special live music vinyasa class, then another short hike to a sloping lawn/dock for a short nature-themed guided meditation.
Complete the tour back to your car.
Join us after at Off the Hook for a free drink, refreshments and prizes. (Rain Date: May 7)
PLUS- a chance to win a FREE ticket to Wanderlust Stratton ($465 value!-June 16-19- world class yoga practice, incredible live music, guided adventures, local and sustainable food)
Meet at Rocky Point Entrance Parking Lot at 12:45 (GPS: 1402 Portland Rd, Highlands)
results.how_to_find_us: ****Rocky Point Parking Area**** at the end of Highland's Portland Road

If you do not RSVP and we're full before 1 pm, you will not be included in the game. It is important that we have an accurate attendance as team size and other people showing up are dependent upon RSVPs. Any questions please private message me.

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in Studio #505
results.name: Saturday - Live Figure Drawing - Flatiron District

results.description:
April 30, 1-4:30pm
THOMAS GRUBB’s POULENC & The Surrealist Master Class
Thomas Grubb, the author of Singing in French: A Singer’s Manual of French Diction & French Vocal Repertoire will focus this performance master class on the Surrealist poets and composers like Francis Poulenc who set these poems to music.
Thomas Grubb is the author of SINGING IN FRENCH, A MANUAL OF FRENCH DICTION AND FRENCH VOCAL REPERTOIRE (Schirmer Books, 1979, with a Foreword by Pierre Bernac, now distributed by Thomson Learning). Since 1986 Mr. Grubb has been a member of the coaching staff of New York City Opera where he assists in the preparation of all the French productions. In the past, he has been a member of the coaching staffs of Houston Grand Opera and the Opera Society of Washington, D.C. Since 1985 Mr.Grubb has been a member of the faculty at The Juilliard School where he conducts classes in French Vocal Repertoire and Diction. From 1984 until May of 2007 he taught Advanced Vocal Performance and French Diction at the Peabody Conservatory of Music in Baltimore. Previously he served on the faculties of Manhattan School of Music [masked]), The Curtis Institute of Music [masked]) and the Academy of Vocal Arts [masked]), both in Philadelphia, as well as at New York University in the early 1970s.

From 1970 until 1977, Thomas Grubb assisted the renowned maitre of French song, Pierre Bernac, in his master classes throughout the United States, Canada and France as both pianist and coach. Mr. Bernac eventually became his primary mentor and the inspiration for his specialization in French Vocal Repertoire. In addition, Pierre Bernac generously monitered the writing and editing of Mr. Grubb’s above-mentioned book Among his most influential piano teachers were Magda Tagliaferro, with whom he studied in Paris for three years, as well as Dora Zaslavsky and Artur Balsam with whom he studied at the Manhattan School of Music where he earned his Master of Music degree in Applied Piano in 1966. In 1962, Mr. Grubb received a Master of Arts degree in French Literature from Yale University Graduate School and in 1960 his Bachelor of Arts in French and Piano from the University of Rochester and the Eastman School of Music.

As a performing pianist, Thomas Grubb has appeared in recital with Elly Ameling, Benita Valente, Eleanor Steber, Elizabeth Mannion and Dawn Upshaw, plus numerous others. He also made two North American concert tours with the French trumpet-player, Maurice Andre, as both pianist and translator. Mr. Grubb has recorded for both the Orion and the Lyrachord labels with Carol Kimball, mezzo-soprano, and Gerald Tarack, violinist. Thomas Grubb has given master classes throughout the United States, in France, Germany, Lithuania, Korea and annually in Taiwan from 1991 until 2006. In the coming year he will be giving a series of classes in Auckland, New Zealand. Mr. Grubb has participated as adjudicator for the Metropolitan Opera Council Auditions, the International Voice Competition of Paris, the Fulbright Commission Auditions, the Rockefeller American Music Competition of Carnegie Hall, various NATS competitions and those of the Oratorio Society of New York.

In May, 2002, Mr. Grubb was decorated as Chevalier dans l’ordre des Arts et des Lettres by the French Ministry
of Culture in Paris for his advancement of French culture throughout the world. Presently, Thomas Grubb is working on a second edition of his Singing in French as well as a companion book to Pierre Bernac’s Interpretation of French Song. Mr. Grubb is on the Advisory Board of the Art Song Preservation Society of New York (ASPSY), and he maintains a private studio on the Upper West Side of Manhattan not far from Lincoln Center where he has resided since 1974. Thomas Grubb was born in Bridgehampton, New York and is an American citizen.​

results.description:
The Museum of Movement & Rhythm, Incorporated in partnership with the African American Museum of Nassau County, will be presenting "Cartier Williams Dance Theatre" in an Urban Tale of Peter & The Wolf, at the museum, on Saturday, April 30, 2016 at 1:00 pm & 4:00 pm. Cartier Williams Dance Theatre will present a new adaption of Prokofiev's Peter and The Wolf. This reimagined story follows Peter as he tries to court Brenda Bird and fight off The Big Bad Wolf, Gangsta. Featuring a modern twist on other famous fairy tale characters as well, including Mac Cool Cat and Doris Duck, the hip opera performance draws the audience into an updated version of the classic Russian children’s story. Williams’ choreography and his company of tap, ballet, hip-hop and modern dancers will bring the famous cast of characters into a 21st-century urban setting.   This presentation is truly an educational experience.  It is appropriate for older children and adults.  Overall, it is a rich theatrical experience.  Admission is $10 in advance & $12.50 at the door.  Thank you in advance for your support of our educational endeavors. 


Kind regards,   


Melvin Erroll Taylor


Director of Development &


Planning African American Museum of


Nassau County in Hempstead

results.description:
At the Guggenheim, we will create, update, and improve Wikipedia articles covering the lives and works of Middle Eastern and North African artists and architects, countering geocultural systemic bias on Wikipedia. The event will launch MENA (Middle East and North Africa) Artists Month, an online campaign dedicated to augmenting MENA artist content on Wikipedia throughout the month of May.  


On Saturday April 30, the Guggenheim will host its fourth Wikipedia edit-a-thon — or, #guggathon — with the theme 'Wikipedia Edit-a-thon at the Guggenheim: Contemporary Art of the Middle East and North Africa'.


The Guggenheim aims to further the goals of the Guggenheim UBS MAP Global Art Initiative, and build on the model of campaigns like the Wikipedia Edit-a-thon at the Guggenheim: Women in Architecture, Wikipedia Asian Month, and Art+Feminism.

New and experienced editors are welcome. The event will begin with a panel discussion at 1pm that examines art practice in the modern Middle East and North Africa, followed by a training session for participants who are new to Wikipedia. Wikipedia specialists will be on hand to provide basic instruction and editing support.


1 pm - 2:30pm, Peter B. Lewis Theater: The Built, Unbuilt, and Unbuildable, panel discussion with Guggenheim curators, Sara Raza, Guggenheim UBS MAP, Middle East and North Africa, and Troy Conrad Therrien, Architecture and Digital Media, and current exhibition artists Ala Younis and Ahmed Mater

2:30 pm - 6:00 pm, Wikipedia editing


Event at  Guggenheim:

</a>http://www.guggenheim.org/new-york/calendar-and-events/2016/04/30/the-built-unbuilt-and-unbuildable/21644


Global Campaign:

<a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/MENA_Artists_Month">https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/MENA_Artists_Month


Page on Wikipedia:


</a><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/WikiArte/MoMA_2015"><a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/NYC/Women_in_Architecture"></a>https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Meetup/NYC/MENA

This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.

Happy spring, everyone! At this meetup, I'd like to give people the stage so we can all learn from each other's experiences. If you have a tiny house or are building one, or have lived in a tiny space in the past, please prepare a 5 minute talk about how you've gotten to where you are now, troubles you've faced, etc. A photo album on an iPad would work well too!

Since I sold my tiny house, I started building a micro house. It's 35 sq ft and has a sleeping area, toilet, little kitchen area, and storage. I plan to hit the road with it this summer. I might bring it to this meeting!

The Bohemian Beer Hall in Astoria is huge with lots of outdoor picnic tables. It is 2 blocks from the Astoria Blvd or Ditmars Blvd stop on the N, Q.

http://www.meetup.com/Bronies-NYC/events/230676269/

As per usual we'll be starting with Rick and Morty and will be moving on to the pony episodes after that. We'll screen the dragon episode from two weeks ago then we'll be moving on to the new one. results.description:
This Hike is a Sierra Club Event. 

Hike @ Massapequa Preserve

6+ Miles Flat Terrain around 3 hours

Directions:

EASILY ACCESSIBLE VIA LIRR

Take LIRR from Penn Stn or Atlantic Terminal to Massapequa Train Station!

(Not Massapequa Park Train station)

Sunrise Hwy to Broadway, Massapequa (a traffic light and a diner are on the corner). Go NORTH under the RR trestle. At the light, turn immediately right. Look for CVS.

Park @ LIRR Station!

HIKE around a Beautiful Preserve!

Warmer Weather ==> Awesome Hiking Time!

PLUS ... a Healthy - Positive - Afternoon

Talk, Network, Mingle! 
Feel positive, Feel Free and good about yourself! 
Enjoy the breeze, the calmness!

Multi-Meetup Combined Event

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT ... IMPORTANT ... IMPORTANT !!!

1. Bring water, Bananas or nuts or Granola Bars, Bug Repellent & Sunblock.

2. ALWAYS check meetup page before departing ANY event for any last minute updates. 

3. Never wear NEW shoes on a Hike. Always break them in!

4. No GUESTS: Everyone is welcome to attend, they just need to signup individually. We need to ensure everyone reads the ENTIRE description PRIOR to attending so they are aware of the type of event they are signing up for. 

5. Kids are welcome. Hikes are a healthy and a family bonding experience.

6. Please refrain from posting weather related comments on the meetup site. No one logs on to meetup to check weather.

7. Please read meetup description IN ITS ENTIRETY before posting a COMMENT. Meetup Comments must ONLY be used for important questions AFFECTING EVERYONE.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is an event organized for our friends to get together and socialize. We are not professional hikers or professional organizers. You are welcome to join us but before you attend you must familiarize yourself with the risks associated with this type of activity.

Liability Waiver

Hiking or outdoor activities have inherent risks. Your participation in our hikes or other events could be dangerous and can result in serious injury, medical emergency, even death. It is your responsibility to learn the trails and to follow the group so you do not get detached from the group. Make yourself aware of your surroundings and trail conditions at all times. You agree to participate in these events completely at your own risk and to take full responsibility for your own safety and well being, including those of your guests. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Co-Organizer, Assistant Organizers, Event Organizer, Event Hosts, Hike Leader or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance at the event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.

results.description:
Note: This is the weekend version of our Thursday, 4/28 meeting. It's the same as the weekday meetup, just scheduled in addition so that those of us who can't make it during the week can still take part.

For our second book, we had an overwhelming request for something modern, possibly a newer bestseller or critically acclaimed book. So let's try Thirteen Ways of Looking by Colum McCann. It's a collection of short stories which may or may not be a good choice for discussion -- We'll find out when we meet! It was published last year and received great reviews. Plus, it's only about 250 pages. Unfortunately it's not available as a movie adaptation but you can purchase it on Kindle or Audible. 

It might be nice to mix up the classics and modern fiction/nonfiction, so start thinking of some ideas for our third book and feel free to submit them here: 

http://goo.gl/forms/qwklcsCL5r
  And, as always, if you don't make it through the book in time for our meetup, don't let that stop you from attending!
results.name: Second meetup weekend edition: Thirteen Ways of Looking by Colum McCann

results.description:
This Event: 

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where Python developers and learners can come and ask questions or give help. 

Individuals of all programming skill levels are welcome. 

It is suggested that you bring your own laptop. If you don't have access to a laptop and want to attend, please let Paul Logston know and he will see about getting you a laptop for the day.

This event is free. 

This event is not a tutorial. Tutorials hosted by Learn Python NYC are labeled as tutorials.

Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.
results.how_to_find_us: Show ID at front desk, come up to 11th floor, we are in the Deerbrook conference room!

results.description:
This Hike is a Sierra Club Event. 

Hike @ Massapequa Preserve

6+ Miles Flat Terrain around 3 hours

Directions:

EASILY ACCESSIBLE VIA LIRR

Take LIRR from Penn Stn or Atlantic Terminal to Massapequa Train Station!

(Not Massapequa Park Train station)

Sunrise Hwy to Broadway, Massapequa (a traffic light and a diner are on the corner). Go NORTH under the RR trestle. At the light, turn immediately right. Look for CVS.

Park @ LIRR Station!

HIKE around a Beautiful Preserve!

Warmer Weather ==> Awesome Hiking Time!

PLUS ... a Healthy - Positive - Afternoon

Talk, Network, Mingle! 
Feel positive, Feel Free and good about yourself! 
Enjoy the breeze, the calmness!

Multi-Meetup Combined Event

Please Don't Forget the Positive MOOD

AND YOUR CAMERA

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IMPORTANT ... IMPORTANT ... IMPORTANT !!!

1. Bring water, Bananas or nuts or Granola Bars, Bug Repellent & Sunblock.

2. ALWAYS check meetup page before departing ANY event for any last minute updates. 

3. Never wear NEW shoes on a Hike. Always break them in!

4. No GUESTS: Everyone is welcome to attend, they just need to signup individually. We need to ensure everyone reads the ENTIRE description PRIOR to attending so they are aware of the type of event they are signing up for. 

5. Kids are welcome. Hikes are a healthy and a family bonding experience.

6. Please refrain from posting weather related comments on the meetup site. No one logs on to meetup to check weather.

7. Please read meetup description IN ITS ENTIRETY before posting a COMMENT. Meetup Comments must ONLY be used for important questions AFFECTING EVERYONE.

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: 226 Rome Street, Newark, NJ  Map: http://g.co/maps/ueppk
results.name: Hammerheads Underwater Rugby practice - Saturdays

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
Pitch Night at Adelphi University

If you've watched Shark Tank and want to be involved, NOW IS YOUR CHANCE!

Join us with the family Saturday afternoon 4/30/16 for Pitch Night where Long Island-based startups and early-stage companies will 'Pitch" some of Long Island's leading angel investors at Adelphi Unversity Performing Arts Center.

If you would like to join us in the audience, please register now as there is limited seating for this event.


You MUST register to attend this event!
NOTE - Kids under 16 yrs old can attend for FREE


Pitch Night is sponsored by Adelphi University, Technology Island, Nassau County, LaunchPad, Angel Dough Ventures & LISTnet

PS - there is a plenty of FREE parking on campus at Adelphi University

results.description:
Host:  Yen and volunteers.

Purpose:  Meet real life examples of your personality type...this maybe how you come across to others! :D 

Meet others personality types and find out what they like or dislike about your "personality type's" patterns! :( 

Members from "Manhattan Lectures & Conversations" and "Conversations New York" will be joining us, http://www.meetup.com/Manhattan-Lectures-Conversations/events/229573424/ 

http://www.meetup.com/Conversations-New-York/events/229573550/

Proposed Agenda

2:30 pm - Find Yen when you arrive to get a name-tag to write down your name and type. 

Grab a chair and help me form a large circle with these chairs.  Mingle within the large circle before formal start.

2:45 - Formal introductions

3:00 - Form small groups (6-8 people) for discussions. (This conversation is unstructured.)

3:45 - Feel free to switch tables to meet some new folks!

4:30 - Soft end.  Feel free to continue the conversation with the new friends you made.

Typically, a group of hardcore MBTI enthusiasts hangout to talk and later go out to dinner and drinks led by Chloe.


Dinner and Drinks hosted by Chloe, Chief Party Officer:

6pm - La Bonne Soupe, 55th/6th, $$, 48 W 55th St, New York, NY 10019, (212)[masked], $15 burgers, $10 cocktails, https://goo.gl/maps/jDxzs4PebEz, separate checks are available if everyone promises to pay cash - hit the ATM first

9pm - The House of Brews, 51st/8th, 302 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019, $11 cocktails, 100 beers, (212)[masked], https://goo.gl/maps/m9dqZdrvaaD2


Prerequisite: Take the online test and read your personality description. How well does your personality type description fit you? 

http://www.humanmetrics.com/cgi-win/JTypes2.asp

results.description:
Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paint-drink-event-tickets-24963180545

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 15 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

* WE DO DIFFERENT PAINTINGS AT EACH EVENT SO IF YOU'VE BEEN TO ONE OF OUR EVENTS BEFORE... HAVE NO FEAR... YOU'LL BE PAINTING SOMETHING NEW!

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is mostly for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. All ages are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend. The RSVP list on this page is only a small portion of actual attendees.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Get tickets at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/paint-drink-event-tickets-24963180545

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must Pre-Pay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 15 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle a bit and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

* WE DO DIFFERENT PAINTINGS AT EACH EVENT SO IF YOU'VE BEEN TO ONE OF OUR EVENTS BEFORE... HAVE NO FEAR... YOU'LL BE PAINTING SOMETHING NEW!

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is mostly for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. All ages are welcome to attend.
