results.description:
Please join me for 3 hours to fine tune your intuition and your eye in Grand Central Terminal! This class is open to all photography levels, and is more of a creative rather than technical class. If you're interested in learning more about the technical aspects, please attend our digital photography: intro for beginners class.

We will conduct exercises to tune you into your intuition, and learn how to take photographs by following it. In addition, we will focus on the differences between looking, observing and seeing. I will also review and give feedback on how to better the composition of your photographs. You will notice that by the end of the class you will not only be looking at the world with an eye of a photographer, but will have better photographs to prove it!

Please bring only your camera and one lens - no tripods or other equipment/lenses needed.

Let's meet to the right of the Info Clock when facing the departure signs. I will be carrying an orange bag for you to recognize me.

Looking forward to seeing you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Let's meet to the right of the Info Booth when facing the departure signs. I will be carrying an orange bag for you to recognize me.
results.name: Intuitive Photography - Grand Central Terminal

results.description:
Join "The NYC Myers-Briggs Type Indicator Meetup Group" in a fun conversation about personality types. 

Host: Yen and volunteers.

Purpose:  Meet real life examples of your personality type...this maybe how you come across to others! :D 

Meet others personality types and find out what they like or dislike about your "personality type's" patterns! :( 

Proposed Agenda

2:30 pm - Find Yen when you arrive to get a name-tag to write down your name and type. 

Grab a chair and help me form a large circle with these chairs.  Mingle within the large circle before the formal start. 

2:45 - Formal introductions

3:00 - Form small groups (6-8 people) for discussions.  (This conversation is unstructured.)

3:45 - Feel free to switch tables to meet some new folks!

4:30 - Soft end.  Feel free to continue the conversation with the new friends you made.

Typically, a group of hardcore MBTI enthusiasts hangout to talk and later go out to dinner and drinks.

Dinner and Drinks hosted by Chloe, Chief Party Officer:


6pm - Tony's di Napoli, 43rd/Broadway, $$, 147 W 43rd St, New York, NY 10036, (212)[masked], family style, https://goo.gl/maps/41rHn7aDjyJ2

9pm - Haven, 47th/6th, $$, 132 W 47th St, New York, NY 10036, (212)[masked], $14 cocktails, https://goo.gl/maps/1f99p4RyB2v 


Prerequisite: Take the online test and read your personality description. How well does your personality type description fit you? 

http://www.humanmetrics.com/cgi-win/JTypes2.asp 

ISTJ - Duty Fulfillers http://www.celebritytypes.com/istj.php 
ESTJ - Guardians        http://www.celebritytypes.com/estj.php 
ISFJ - Nurturers          http://www.celebritytypes.com/isfj.php 
ESFJ - Caregivers        http://www.celebritytypes.com/esfj.php 
ISTP - Mechanics http://www.celebritytypes.com/istp.php 
ESTP - Doers http://www.celebritytypes.com/estp.php 

ESFP - Performers http://www.celebritytypes.com/esfp.php 
ISFP - Artists http://www.celebritytypes.com/isfp.php 
ENTJ - Executives http://www.celebritytypes.com/entj.php 
INTJ - Scientists http://www.celebritytypes.com/intj.php 
ENTP - Visionaries http://www.celebritytypes.com/entp.php 
INTP - Thinkers http://www.celebritytypes.com/intp.php 
ENFJ - Givers  http://www.celebritytypes.com/enfj.php

ENFP - Inspirers          http://www.celebritytypes.com/enfp.php 
INFP - Idealists            http://www.celebritytypes.com/infp.php

Data source: "MBTI Manual" published by CPP

About the Host:  Yen is a parent, manager, and former educator & examiner.  He is a Chinese personality type.

About the Founder of Conversations New York:  Ron Gross is the founder of "Conversations New York (CNY)." He's been organizing exciting, important CONVERSATIONS for 20 years, and currently holds them regularly on the Columbia University campus and elsewhere through the city. He's the author of 23 books on LIFELONG LEARNING. He was recently honored for lifetime achievement in the field by the International Society for Self-Directed Learning. The late Buckminster Fuller said of Ron's work: “If humanity is to pass safely through its present crisis on earth, it will be because a majority of individuals are now doing their own thinking. Ronald Gross’ work has pioneered in improving the climate for such thinking in the United States.”
results.how_to_find_us: Find Yen at the opposite end of the atrium from the food bar (see photo of atrium layout). (See Yen's profile photo. He looks reasonably like his photo.)

results.description:
You are invited to join the next meetup.Our meditation meetups are conducted by Dhammakaya meditation instructors, and practitioners who have committed their lives by ordaining to teach meditation and Dhamma(reality of life). They are eager to teach their technique and wisdom on meditation methods, benefits and knowledge gained from meditation, and our true purpose. Every session will be inspiring and will help encourage one to meditate. Though many of us are aware that meditation can help with stress, there is still so much more to learn from the benefits of meditating. We constantly need to be reminded and encouraged to meditate, otherwise it is easy to forget how meditating can be beneficial to our overall well being.

Class Schedule

3:10 Relaxation Exercise

3:30 Guided Meditation / Q&A / Group Discussion

4:30 End of the session

We hope to see you
results.name: Weekly Meditation

results.description:
Note: This Is the St. Barts Location.

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 3pm. ST BART'S SWIMMING POOL

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315
results.name: St. Barts. #2 I won't drown Swim Challenge. SOLDOUT

group.name: ! Black People Who Love The Outdoors and Adventure NY

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

As spring approaches, we will have more events on the calendar.


I am shooting for 2 or 3 per month.


Please join us for a bit of culture. As  many of you  know Chelsea is known for it's vast number of Art Galleries.


Our Starting Point will be The Agora Gallery, a sprawling gallery space known for it's beautiful Sculptures, Paintings and more.
<a>www.agora-gallery.com..</a> then we will peruse various galleries located on this block..Many of the Galleries close at 6pm.


We can spend as much or as little time in each gallery . We will explore and discover them together.

Afterwards, some of us will want to get a bite to eat in Chelsea,

If anyone knows of a nice spot that can accommodate 10-15 women without making reservations let me know.

This will be a laid back, event.. you can RSVP just so I get a head count.

Have a great April, see you on the 30th.

xxx

Carly

Cell:[masked]
results.name: Chelsea Contemporary Gallery Hop

results.description:
We get together every other weekend and play jazz.

If you plan to join the group, the most important thing you can tell us is what instrument you play.

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition). Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a song that's not in the book, bring lead sheets for everyone.

We'll be in one of the rooms at Music Makers, on the third floor. The address and directions are above.


I'll usually let everyone know by Wednesday which room we'll be in on Saturday.

The rooms cost $70 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.
results.how_to_find_us: It's between 7th and 8th avenues. Near the 1,2,3, A,C,E, B, and other trains. It's on the third floor.
results.name: Play Jazz!

results.description:
Lets get together for Dinner and a movie!

Only a 10 minute subway ride from Midtown and easily accessible from Long Island, Connecticut, Westchester, Brooklyn and the Bronx, Studio Square NYC is an event and entertainment destination unrivalled in the NYC area.


Encompassing nearly 30,000 square feet, Studio Square is also one of the largest venues of it's kind in the country.

Aside from being a really cool place to chill with 2,000+ of your closest friends, Studio Square has hosted major events in food, fashion and entertainment.

Right around the corner is Kaufman Astoria Movie Theatre. For those who wish to stay out we will be enjoying a movie together. For further details please contact the organizer Josh @ (914) 562-8735.
results.name: EX-JW Meetup, Dinner and a movie @ Studio Square NYC

results.description:
Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=PY3XEYTCNS28C

=============================================

Midtown Manhattan started to become a center for art around the turn of the 20th century, when the rich began building palatial mansions in Midtown East, the Upper East Side, and along Central Park. A number of galleries were soon established nearby, and some of the ornate homes eventually became institutions housing vast private collections.

Amazingly, the Crown Building at 730 Fifth Avenue was the original site of MoMA, which was founded in 1929 as a pop-up show in a borrowed apartment.

Today, the neighborhood still has some great galleries. On this tour, we will visit several of them and hear from dealers who showcase works that span a broad range of traditional and contemporary art.

Here is a video from the Kapoor Gallery, which will open especially for us.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jj9DtMHSpfc

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy. In addition, she hosts "State of the Arts NYC", a weekly radio program airing Fridays on WBAI, 99.5 FM.

IMPORTANT:

- Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=PY3XEYTCNS28C 

- If you tried to use the above link but had trouble with Paypal, an alternate payment link on Brown Paper Tickets will be emailed upon request. This will require an extra $1 charge to help cover the higher fees with this processor.

- On April 29 (one day before), the price will go up to $25 if the event has not sold out. Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

- RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

- Online payment deadline is 10:30am on the day of the tour.

- If space is available, payment can be made on-site ($25, cash only).

- Sorry, refunds and exchanges are not available (unless the event is cancelled). However, if you are unable to attend, you can send someone in your place. At check-in, simply have him or her mention the name under which you paid.

- If you are late or having trouble finding the group, send "old-fashioned" text only to (917) 680-0656. This is not a smartphone and has no Internet access, so emailing, posting comments on this page, or sending messages through the Meetup site (or app) will NOT work. Also, no voice calls please, as they can be extremely disruptive.

- Please remember to bring photo ID in case it is requested by security at some of the galleries.

- Feel free to bring your camera.  Taking pictures is allowed. And if you wish, download the free Snapchat app to your iPhone or Android and share your photos with family and friends.

- The tour will last approximately one and a half hours. Afterward, we will go somewhere nearby for food and socializing if there is interest.

- Gratuities are appreciated.

- Art novices are welcome, as are people with extensive art backgrounds.

- This event is exclusively for members of my meetup groups and their guests, plus special invitees.

- Please note that the "+ xx" next to my name on the attendance list to the right is a count of total attendees from outside this group, manually updated every 12-48 hours.  It is NOT an arbitrary number. However, also remember that "no-shows" can never be accurately predicted.


See you there!

Milton & Savona
results.how_to_find_us: Meet by the Capital One bank.
results.name: Midtown Guided Art Gallery Tour (with Savona) - $16 Thru 4/28, $25 After

results.description:
We get together every other weekend and play jazz.

If you plan to join the group, the most important thing you can tell us is what instrument you play. 

Please check the RSVP list for any jam session before you sign up. If we already have several guitarists and keyboardists, as well as a bassist and drummer, then we don't need any more of those players. Sign up for the next one. 

These jams aren't for beginners. You should have some proficiency with your instrument, although you may be relatively new to jazz. We try to provide a place where musicians can come together and develop their skills as jazz players and play to the best of their ability. Toward that end, we will not tolerate anyone who criticizes another's playing.

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition) to the sessions. Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a song that's not in the book, you must bring lead sheets for everyone.

We'll be in one of the rooms at Music Makers, on the third floor. The address and directions are above. I'll usually let everyone know by Thursday which room we'll be in on Saturday. The rooms cost $72 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.
results.how_to_find_us: It's between 7th and 8th avenues. Near the 1,2,3, A,C,E, B, and other trains. It's on the third floor.
results.name: Play Jazz!

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

We'll be holding our monthly discussion one day earlier to coincide with National Independent Bookstore Day. After our discussion we'll take a short walk to *Greenlight Bookstore for some fun, bookish activities, and an after party. This RSVP is for the discussion only. 

The venue, Graziella's, is an Italian restaurant in Fort Greene, Brooklyn between Willoughby Ave & Dekalb Ave. We'll split a few of their authentic wood-burning pizzas (as featured in Food Network's Best Thing I Ever Ate). Budget about $20 (cash is strongly preferred).

Directions: G train to Clinton-Washington Aves | A or C to Lafayette Ave  

April read: Me Before You by Jojo Moyes; The New York Times bestseller, soon to be a major motion picture (yup, I'm totally setting us up for a movie night!).

Hope to see you all there.


Xo,

Noëlle

They had nothing in common until love gave them everything to lose . . .


Louisa Clark is an ordinary girl living an exceedingly ordinary life—steady boyfriend, close family—who has barely been farther afield than their tiny village. She takes a badly needed job working for ex–Master of the Universe Will Traynor, who is wheelchair bound after an accident. Will has always lived a huge life—big deals, extreme sports, worldwide travel—and now he’s pretty sure he cannot live the way he is.

Will is acerbic, moody, bossy—but Lou refuses to treat him with kid gloves, and soon his happiness means more to her than she expected. When she learns that Will has shocking plans of his own, she sets out to show him that life is still worth living.

A Love Story for this generation and perfect for fans of John Green’s The Fault in Our Stars, Me Before You brings to life two people who couldn’t have less in common—a heartbreakingly romantic novel that asks, What do you do when making the person you love happy also means breaking your own heart?
results.name: Part I: Discussion of our April Read: Me Before You

results.description:
If you are interested in learning more about our network, please drop by. No technical knowledge is needed and we are happy to answer any questions.  Our DBA meetings are very informal social gatherings. 

A member of Freifunk Duesseldorf will be at the meetup to exchange mesh ideas. Freifunk have successfully created a large mesh network in Germany.

You may also optionally participate in a documentary that is being made about alternate networks. Message us if you would like to take part.

We have a FAQ that helps to explain our network. If you are ready to buy and install a router you can fill in our form. We support two models of routers that you can buy online and flash with our software.

We had an article in Vice Motherboard recently that went into some detail about our plans.
results.how_to_find_us: out the back in the garden
results.name: Drinks at dba

results.description:
The Zero Judgment Cardio Dance Party is all about combining fitness and dance in a way that is genuinely creative and fun (think Zumba but with a lot more freedom to move however you wanna!) At The Zero Judgement Cardio Dance Party it doesn't matter how much experience you have. All of the music played will be at a tempo that is easy to run in place to, so you can always fall back on running in place and then being creative with the rest of your body (or not). There will also be some tips/discussion on HOW one dances to get their heart rate up into the cardio range. All of which might sound a bit silly, but think about it: if you can master the skill of making exercise entertaining for yourself, you won't only not dread exercise... you will actually LOOK FORWARD to it!

Hoping to see you there! 

-Josh K.

**Event being advertised/RSVP'd to in a bunch of ways other than this event page!**

results.name: Zero Judgement Cardio Dance Party #3

The street action will begin around 3:00pm and end close to 630pm. This week's action will be followed by an important business meeting and/or continued action at locations TBD.

group.name: New York Art for Social Change Meetup

results.description:
• If you can already have basic conversations, such as exchanging personal information, talking about your jobs, hobbies or life experiences, then you can join this group.  We will select a topic, read a short article together and then discuss it.  This week the topic will be things Chinese people will talk about

Because of the lack of cultural awareness, some times Chinese people will ask you questions that makes you embarrassed or you may consider it violates your privacy. Or it is the other way around, some people will ask questions that make Chinese people a little bit  uncomfortable. 

We will discuss:

•  What questions you 've been asked that you consider are private?


• Do you know any questions that American people have asked that makes Chinese people feel a little bit embarrassed? 


• What questions that you hate been asked? 


• What questions that you consider violate people's privacy? 


Note: We are open about the suggestion of the topic, if there is any topic you would like to talk about feel free to leave the comment below. 


Bring your iPad, tablets, or traditional notebooks to take notes, lots of notes. 

I will send you the material before the lesson begin. 

Enjoy!
results.name: Mandarin Conversation - Intermediate

results.description:
A fun afternoon of Journaling our hearts away.

I can host up to 6 people at the Crafty Game Cave nice and cozy. With streaming Youtube videos all night long to get the creative juices flowing.

*** Bring your mixed media goodies and let's build some journal pages.

* I will have some beverages on hand! (Water, Soda, Juice we can make coffee or tea) You are more than welcome to bring snacks if you please. I have a microwave and a fridge at your disposal. We are also local to many take out/delivery restaurants for food if you feel like ordering I have some menus for your options.

Great, well cannot wait for some Inspirational Creative Company :)
results.name: MIXED MEDIA in The CAVE * BONUS EDITION

results.description:
This meeting is for both fiction and non-fiction writers.

Bring a piece to read and discuss, up to 1500 words, or simply bring yourself. If you bring a piece, please make copies for the others. How many copies? Check here the last day and you will find the answer.

All formats welcome: poems, short stories, flash fiction, novellas, novels, articles, blog entries, essays, children books, screen and theatrical plays, etc.

Please review the tab at the very top under the banner of Hudson Writer's Group  titled "PAGES" This provides the guidelines on how we share and provide feedback. etc.

See you soon!

results.description:
Hey all - Sorry for the delay since our last meetup (I've been swamped with work).  So let's make up for it with a full day of games, food and drinks.  

We can meet up at The Roof area at Whole Foods (lots of open space, big tables, with food and drinks, alcoholic and non, available)  http://www.wholefoodsmarket.com/service/roof-taproom-dining-brooklyn


I'll bring a variety of games, including Telestrations, Wits & Wagers, Taboo, and others, but please feel free to bring others that you might want to play.

See you there!

Michael

results.description:
This is an open house and introduction to Teaneck Meditation. This introduction gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth. At Teaneck Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection. Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom! If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only! 

We are located at 475 Cedar Lane Teaneck, NJ 07666. Our meditation center is located next to Veggie Heaven. Metered parking is in the front, and additional free parking is located in the back of the shopping strip. This introduction will last about an hour to an hour and a half. If you have many plans for the day please say this before the meetup starts so we can accomodate you properly. 

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Teaneck Meditation you can call our center to have a personal introduction today! Teaneck Meditation is a non-profit organization and is tax deductible. A $10 donation is appreciated for the introduction. 

* 


475 Cedar Lane Teaneck, NJ 07666 
[masked] 
newjerseymeditation.org

To live this life better, we sometimes think differently this world from the one  you think. Changing view from this earthly view to the spiritual view breaks your common sense then brings the new life for you. The four perverted views are the view that very typical views that you think very differently that you think now as it is true, but not.

5. Good-by

results.description:
Once again, it's ON! This adult event will be open and free to everyone - members and their guests - just be sure to add your 'pluses' when you RSVP so that we have an idea how many we should expect. When you arrive, please ask for Daniel, who'll introduce you to other members of the group. From there, you can order some food/drink or you can simply get started on playing your favorite board & card games.

As for the room layout, there will be a number of different "Board Game" stations which are tables with different board games already set up - all you will have to do is pick a station and wait for some more players, or simply join a game already in progress! 

Decks of cards for Spades, Tonk, etc. • Uno • Taboo • Cards Against Humanity • Dominoes • Battle of the Sexes • Chess / Checkers • Connect Four • Cranium • Guesstures • Jenga • Scrabble & more

There will also be some open tables for people who would like to bring their own games - feel free to bring your favorite.

Drink specials will include house red, white, or rose for $5. Again, this event is free and you are not required to buy food or drinks, but let's help support Manhattan Brew & Vine as they are supporting us for use of their space.


The event starts at 3pm and is officially over at 8pm, but may run a little longer, depending on energy/turnout/interest.


If you have any questions, feel free to post them below in the comments section or call/text Daniel @ 774.275.3646.

Directions to Manhattan Brew & Vine - 998 Columbus Avenue

Take the B or C subway trains to 110th Street, walk 2 avenues west to Columbus Avenue then down one block to 109th street. The venue is on the corner of 109th street & Columbus Avenue.

results.description:
Join the members of The NYC Political Forum for a discussion of the three most compelling stories and events unfolding from around the world.

• Brexit -- should the U.K. stay or should it go?

• Brazil -- the massive corruption scandal and the subsequent state of disarray of its national government -- compounded by the breakout of the Zika virus.

• The "Panama Papers" -- the leak, the "known knowns," and the "unknown unknowns"

***PLUS, if time permits, we'll discuss other international current events that unfold during the week of the meetup.
results.name: April Monthly Meetup -- bye-bye primaries, hello international affairs!

group.name: Foreign Policy & International Relations Discussion Group

results.description:
As the Month of April comes to a close, New Yorkers finally awaken from an "Electoral Hangover" -- a phenomena fueled by the media frenzy for the New York Primaries.


During the past several weeks, in a run up to the Primaries, we debated, discussed, and collectively watched the primary contests -- we even had a shindig in that vein!

So . . . . .


Are you "Primary-ied-Out"?

Do you suffer from an "Irritable Primary Syndrome"?

Do the indelible "Super Delegate" numbers keep you up at night?


Well, look no further because we're going to take a break from the "horse-race" aspect of this election cycle. Instead, we'll devote this entire discussion to foreign policy and international affairs.

As usual, we'll discuss the three most compelling stories and events unfolding -- this time, those selected from around the world.

• Brexit -- "Hey Chaps, time for an exit stage left from ye olde bloody experiment known as the 'European Union' -- should we stay or should we go, mate?"

• Brazil -- a revelation of a massive corruption scandal and the subsequent breakdown of the government -- unfolding at a very unfortunate moment -- compounded by the breakout of the Zika virus.  How will both issues be viewed around the world, in a run up to the Summer Games?


• The "Panama Papers" -- are you **SHOCKED** ? -- the leak, the "known knowns," and the "unknown unknowns"

***PLUS, if time permits, we'll discuss other international current events that unfold during the week of the meetup.
results.name: April Monthly Meetup -- bye-bye primaries, hello international affairs!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 15 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.name: Saturday Pick-up Parade grounds 3:30 PM

results.description:
“You’re More Than Enough vs Salomé"

Hello Futurists Musicians. In this first session workshop we’re gonna work on two song titles (and hopefully three from another songwriter volunteer). For those who've attended the previous Meetup, make sure to bring the piece of work “You Are More Than Enough” by Frank Coppola. And like said the other day, I’ll make sure everyone has a copy of “Salomé” written by me (Emmanuel Kingue). So for the third one, anyone’d like to share his work?

Ps: For instrumentalists such as keyboardists, Pianists, guitarists etc... we are going to discuss about it this Saturday. I am going to email each of you who attended the last Meetup a copy of “Salomé”And for those who didn’t, but are coming this Saturday, please make sure to RSVP asap so I can email you copies as well. 

I will keep you posted about the location on Tuesday. Enjoy your week!!

Celebrate with Grailwood as we dance around the maypole, the staff of Life, and be prepared to toast the eternal couple. (Children accompanied by adults are welcome as well as all those who love the land.)

Guests will convene at the benches just inside the 81st Street and Central Park West entrance at three thirty in the afternoon on Saturday the Thirtieth of April. (May Eve) Bring five yards of ribbon to weave around the Maypole. A May Queen and King will be chosen.

Silkie Lyrazel

If possible bring food or libations to add to the feasting.

A contribution of $ 10 is asked to help defray costs

results.description: As-Salam Alikum everyone. I am happy to announce that our tour of the Islamic Art at The Met museum will take place on April 30th at 4pm inshAllah. It will be a one hour guided tour followed by more time to browse the venue on our own. Because of the cost of the tour, the tickets will be $25 per person. However if anyone is unable to pay this amount, please let me know privately and you can still attend. I wouldn't want anyone to miss out because of affordability. Despite $25 per person, I will still have some extra costs so if anyone would like to contribute extra to help with the remainder of the tour cost, it would be highly appreciated. But that is optional. Space is available for the first 15 people who RSVP and if there are more people interested I will have to speak to them about additions. Let's take this opportunity to increase our Iman by looking at 'Islam through the Ages'. Hope to see you all there!

results.description:
We're booked at ASW - Room C, 4-7 PM.

In this Meetup Group we're trying to extend things beyond the straight blues genre, doing some RnB, rock and fusion pieces with strong blues roots and feel. We book 3 hours of studio time so there is time to relax a little.

• We are very fortunate that our newest member, FrankE, a kickass blues/RnB vocalist, has agreed to join us for this session, so let's make this thing happen.

Here are some suggestions for material. More musical details to follow if required: 


Booker T and the MGs - "Groovin'" - '67 - instrumental cover of the Rascals' Smash Hit:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=euWA4j0PPpo


Groovin' - The Young Rascals:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=falI0baGhBQ

Bobby Bland - I Wouldn't Treat A Dog - a trip around the G minor pentatonic scale, with a short bridge:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fl1zUNVOmeg

ONE MORE HEARTACHE - Butterfield Blues Band - great uptempo groove in D,  blues form that goes #V,IV and a little optional bridge towards the end:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HHMryjUnu58

Steely Dan - Bodhisattva - this is a 50's boogie in G Major, very well disguised...

Learn To Play: Riffs in the Key of Steely Dan - including Bodhisattva:

https://reverb.com/news/learn-to-play-riffs-in-the-key-of-steely-dan

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LGdyVnW86SY

Bob Dylan, Temporary Like Achilles: You may not care for the vocals and harmonica on this recording, but this is one beautiful RnB song executed by one of the best sounding bands ever recorded, so give it a listen:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jd0MhOLrrWU

The Great Luther Allison / Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is. It's in D minor, with a few different parts, all simple - would be great to try this piece:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0GTWzRTHqlE

Samba Strangle



Original piece, recorded with a new short scale bass that is slightly out of tune here and I was playing it for the first time. A guitarist friend from the west coast and I were hanging out and we recorded this one afternoon a couple of months ago - just one take to get it down. (I myself have to go back and remember how it works...)
results.how_to_find_us: ASW - Room C

results.description:
General rules of the game:

No called balls/strikes.  You get three swings to put the ball into play.

No taking leads.

Sliding is allowed but be careful.  Be mindful of who is covering the base if you choose to slide.

Game is capped at 24 to ensure those that sign up will get a lot of playing time and at-bats.

Unless someone wants to play C the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

Unless someone wants to pitch the entire game, the position will be rotated amongst all team members equally.

If 24 people sign up, the defense will be rotated so that each team member plays 4 innings in the field for each 1 they sit.

Fee structure:

First game free.

$5 per person per game

$25 for the season.

I'll email/post in the event of inclement weather potentially impacting the game.  Alternatively you can call the hotline at[masked] x111

results.description:
"Take life as easily as possible. But people don't understand me. I say to them, "Life is a mystery. It is not to be solved but to be lived." And somebody has asked me, "Osho, when you said that, I heard, "Life is a MISERY, not to be solved but to be lived."

That is up to you. To me it is a mystery, not to be solved but to be lived, but you can hear it as "misery."

Don't make unnecessary problems for yourself, so that your whole energy can become focused on the essential problem. And the essential problem is only one: Know thyself."  -  Osho

Schedule for the evening:


• 4:00 PM – 4:30 PM Osho gibberish meditation
• 4:30 PM – 5.30 PM Osho Kundalini Meditation

• 5:30 – 5:45 Break

•  6:00 PM - 7:15 PM Evening Satsang
•  7:15 - 7:30 PM Osho Discourse audio or video


** Schedule is tentative and may be adjusted according to need.
------------------------------------------------------------------
When to arrive?

Please arrive 10-15 minutes earlier for getting necessary instructions on meditations.

Location / Walking directions of the Meditation Center:
N or Q train from 42nd Street, Times Square, directed to Ditmars Boulevard (get off the train on the last stop) Walk north-east on 31st street towards Ditmars Blvd. Turn left at Ditmars Blvd. Walk from 31st street straight to 19th street in Ditmars Blvd. Turn right at 19th street towards 21st Drive. Turn left at 19th street and 21st drive to get to 18-52 block. When you reach to the house, take the stairs down on the left side and enter through the second door.

Please text Arun @[masked] if any questions.
results.name: Osho Meditations - Take Life as Easily as Possible

results.description:
What a great turnout last week! Thanks to everyone who came out! Hope to see you all again and more! 


This is a very casual meetup where we meet experienced and native Mandarin speakers and chat about anything. There is only one rule: no English, only Chinese. 


Some types of people who attend: 

- Native Chinese speakers

- Westerners who lived in China previously and want to maintain their level of Chinese and meet Chinese speakers. 

- Westerners who want to go to China and need to brush up on their Mandarin

What some of our members say: 

"非常好！ 👍🏼 很高兴能认识那么多的新朋友，大家都很兴趣多讲华语。Excellent group! Very happy to meet so many people all eager to practice Mandarin." - Nick


"好玩" - Sebastian


"Fun Chinese conversation meetup" -  Martin

"第一次参加很开心，很高兴认识大家，谢谢" - Ming

"非常好！下次见啊" - Sam

"太好玩儿了！" - Mark

Hope to see you there! 

Message me to join our 100+ growing wechat group and learn Chinese with us.

Best,

Shili 李诗丽

results.description:
http://melovino.checkfront.com/reserve/

"It all starts with an entertaining and informative experience learning about mead, its history, and how Melovino Meadery came to be the first meadery of New Jersey.


You then follow us into our production area for a quick tour of where all of our mead is fermented, bottled and packaged, as well as an overview on the mead making process and an ask the mead maker Q&A.

Last but certainly not least, a tasting of up to six of our handcrafted meads in our tasting room with full mead maker's notes and food pairing suggestions."

This is a tiny meadery with some amazing drinks! Gavin and I have done it once before and are ready to replace our stock- they have dry meades, fruity options and even spicy. If you've never tried it, you have to give it a shot!

Tickets are $10 per person. Please purchase at http://melovino.checkfront.com/reserve/ for Saturday, April 30th, 5:00pm
results.how_to_find_us: Meet inside the entrance to the meadery
results.name: Melovino Meadery- Tour and Tasting

results.description:
Join us for one hour in this weekly beginner's hip hop dance class!

Every week we learn a new routine that layers in the basics of hip hop, while teaching you an entire dance. Jump into any class without worrying about having to catch up. 

And it's beginner! No prior dance experience required. We just have a lot of fun. Plus you get some good cardio! Trust us, ucanduit.

Want to pay at the door?

Sign up on ucanduit.eventbrite.com and select the "Pay at the door" option to reserve your spot on the class.
results.how_to_find_us: Rooms will vary every week, so upon arrival, look for "ucanduit" on the board.
results.name: ucanduit Beginner Hip Hop Dance Class

group.name: Beginner Hip Hop Dance Classes NYC

results.description:
Calling all women ballers that are looking to play some basketball with their fellow ladies.

12 spots will be available for women and half the gym will be used strictly for women's only games.  The other half of the court will be used for a co-ed game.  If you're looking to play only with women, RSVP to this meetup event.  If you're a woman and would prefer to play the with both genders, please RSVP to the other meetup event on this same day.

Other than that, the idea will be basically the same:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2016 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.
results.name: Women's Only Half-Court Indoor Hoops

group.name: [New York Co-Ed]  Basketball for the Vertically Challenged

results.description:
The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.
results.name: Samba for Beginners

group.name: The New York Brazilian Portuguese Meetup Group

results.description:
For our last meet-up before Boozy Board Games goes on hiatus for warmer weather, and outdoor activities we will end with a celebration of International Tabletop Day. This will be a unique edition of our monthly meetup--a special all day/night celebration of dice, cardboard and unique shared experiences with good people!

This event will be co-coordinated with Bill. He will have a fun myriad of games. He will be getting there a bit earlier than me to kick things off. If you love board games, and prefer the bar a bit quieter when you play, Bill will be at the bar at 12 pm - but don't feel obliged to get there that early. (PS He's a much better board games host than me. Bill actually explains how to play).

For this meet-up in addition to Bill's fun games I will bring the more typical party games such as Uno, Banagrams, and Scattergories. Skylark also has several games available such trivia, monopoly, jenga. And as always, if you have a particular favorite, feel free to bring it.

So grab a drink, pull up a chair and get your game on!
results.name: Boozy Board Games - Let's Celebrate International Tabletop Day

results.description:
Dear Yogis & Yoginis:


Greetings! ^_^

Welcome to my FREE beginner yoga class coming up this Saturday! 

Last Sunday we worked on our neck and shoulders and felt loose as a goose. ;) This Saturday let's wisely stretch our hamstring and gluteal muscles (especially beneficial to people who walk, run, and bike a lot), and activate abdominal muscles! 

This coming class will be a little different than the last one in that it is not "gentle" any more. The class will be conducted in a more dynamic and flow fashion this time. 

The focus will be forward bends, which tend to have a calming effect and reduce one's anxiety and tension within. So on this beautiful Saturday, let's fold into our inner calm together. 

As usual, the class this week is open to yoga lovers, in particular, beginners. It emphasizes the fundamentals of yoga through informative instructions. As intermediate to advanced yogis may find it too simple, it is always good to go back to the basics to refine our alignments of asanas (steady and easeful yoga postures). With that being said, you are all warmly welcomed!

The address of the studio is:

CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)

123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th St, above "Think Coffee")

Tel: <a>[masked]</a>

Please press the button "CRS" and the secretary will buzz you in. After you enter the building, head directly to the 2rd Floor, where the studio is located.

Please kindly bring a yoga mat with you. Yoga mats (not enough supply at times) and props are free of charge. Restrooms are available for use. No locker or changing room so feel free to bring your valuable items with you into the studio room. There is filtered water and cups in the kitchen area.



Important Notes: 


1) The class will start at 17:00 SHARP so please arrive at least 5 minutes earlier for sign-in and the setting up of your mats and props. Warming up is essential in avoiding injuries in doing yoga so you don't want to miss that. ;)

2) If you decide not to come after you RSVPed "yes", please have the curtesy to change it to "no" to leave spots for others.

3) Please take off your shoes and socks (unless they are nonslip yoga socks) before you enter the room on the 3rd floor.

4) Please put your phone in silent or airplane mode if you decide to take it with you into the studio.

5) Please return all the props and mats properly to the conditions they were in upon leaving. Your cooperation is much appreciated!

P.S. To those who are only available during weekdays, please message me your availability and specifically what you are looking for in a particular yoga class so that I can arrange some weekday classes with the content that benefits you. Thanks!

Love and light.

Namaste, 

Shuai
results.how_to_find_us: CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)  123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th St, above "Think Coffee") Tel: 212-677-8621
results.name: FREE Beginner Yoga Class: Loosening Tight Hamstrings With Wisdom

Saturday's sessions are a little slower paced and a good opportunity to work on basic techniques (rolling, ball handling, etc.) and just have fun. The pace may pick up, depending on the group, but new players will be incorporated into the play. (If you don't have experience kayaking w/ a skirt--rolling or doing a wet exit--please attend one of our Intro Sessions first.)

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo).

results.description:
If you haven't been to Forbidden Planet before let me say this: it is a geek's treasure trove. It has comics. It has board games. It has figurines. Cards. Plushies. Knickknacks. You get the picture. I always see something new when I am there and it is always fun to browse. 


So we will meet up at Forbidden planet, explore and enjoy the store (there is always something to see!). Then we we will go a few blocks and explore a few other stores such as Gothic Renaissance, Halloween Adventure, New York Adventures, Barnes and Noble to name a few. And of course enjoy Union Square Park. 


After we have done a little browsing (and maybe a little buying) we can enjoy a nice sit down dinner at the Brazen Fox.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet outside the Forbidden Planet store entrance
results.name: Let's go explore Forbidden Planet (plus a few other NYC stores) and have dinner!

results.description:
Looking to transition soon from meetup so follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/ 

Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will be drawing our own massive monsters from a fantasy environment of any kind ranging from forests, volcanic mountains, tundras, deserts, jungles, to even water . In light of the theme of Big Game Hunting this monster is going to the biggest, baddest, or most ferocious beast  of that land, worthy of being hunted down by the top hunters! If monsters aren't really you thing you can also design one of these top hunters of whichever environment capable of taking down a giant beast. Or you can even draw both monster and hunter if you can handle it!

The meetup will be split into three parts: First a half hour of warm-up drawings followed by a break of conceptual discussion, then after an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others fully developed drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: Fantasy Big Game Hunting

results.description:
Kindly reflect on the above question leading up to Saturday's meet. Looking forward to having a rich and far-reaching discussion with all of you!

Note: this is not a support group for those sad or depressed as there are other domains set up for that purpose. Please do not attend if you feel or rationalize that others somehow have the responsibility of cheering you up, directly or indirectly.

A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George, Priyo, & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

Look for our red Meetup Sign.

The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

<a href="http://internal.psychology.illinois.edu/%7Eediener/Documents/Kesebir-Diener_2008.pdf">In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: Discussion: Is Happiness Born Out of Our Willingness to be Vulnerable?

results.description: The heroes ventured deeper into the Underdark and encountered a trading outpost run by an Illithid. After a near fatal meeting with a cranium rat swarm guarding the outpost, the party learned a group of 50 constructs led by polymorphed wizards had passed through in the direction of Citadel Sundahar. It was evident that the power of the construct raiding party was far too powerful for any one organization to muster, but rather a complex conspiracy possibly with one or more of the Kraken Society, Cultists of the Dragon or Zhentarim involved. An offhand comment by a Nothic during the encounter referred to the party as Demon Slayers. The party has now christened themselves the "Demonsbane" party which speaks volumes of their bravery. Such a name is likely to attract unwelcome attention in Faerun to test their mettle. Upon their return to Silverymoon, the party accepted Mirabel's quest to find her lost son Farlien who disappeared in the Savage Frontier region. He last spoke of the Evermoors and Trackless Sea in his last communication. The party earned 425XP for the last adventure, the good favor of the Sundahar leadership and is waiting on craftsmen to add silver to their bladed weapons. This campaign has reserved seating for the 8 core players.
results.name: D&D 5e Silvery Moon

group.name: The NYC Dungeons & Dragons Meetup Group

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty-five years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in courts throughout the country, with his office in Long Island, and his concentration in securities and derivative litigation.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).

results.description:
NEW FLYER WITH DETAILS ON SOME AWESOME BONUSES FOR ATTENDEES!:

A haunted mansion, the oldest on Manhattan, ghost stories, and an evening of entertainment showcasing the talents of several of our members.

Leanna Renee Hieber is an actress, playwright, author, and TGTSNBN member, whose gothic fantasy novel Strangely Beautiful is being rereleased by a new publisher with expanded content, and a wonderful new cover.

Celebrate the reissue at Manhattan's most beautiful (and haunted) historic mansion!


Leanna's theatrical reading from this iconic, ghostly tale will be accompanied by a Fashion Presentation of a Strangely Beautiful inspired line, courtesy of

Wormwood & Gall

The event also features a Costume Contest (come dressed in your best Gothic, Neo-Victorian and/or Steampunk finery!) and the evening will wrap up with a discussion and Q and A with Leanna and MJM staff about the delightful process of using real live ghost stories in fiction and as a part of historic preservation (learn all about the Morris-Jumel Mansion's haunts!).


Tickets are $15 at the door, all proceeds going to help keep this amazing, historic property standing for centuries to come! Refreshments and food provided, and books will be available for sale and signing, as well as some of Leanna's acclaimed Steampunk / Gothic jewelry. See you there for an incredible night of storytelling, ghosts, fashion and glorious regalia!

Facebook Event:

https://www.facebook.com/events/488263084690103/?active_tab=highlights

More info about Leanna, the reissue and her other books:

http://www.leannareneehieber.com/

results.description:
Note: YorkShire Towers Location

Session #1 Sold Out & was a big Success so we've added Session #2.

At a family BBQ In 2010, 6 Teens from 2 separate families drowned to death in Louisiana's Red river. There were numerous people standing just feet away, not a single one could swim. The family's comment "None of us could swim, they were yelling, 'Help me, help me. Somebody please help me.' It was nothing I could do but watch them drown, one by one."

That same summer in NYC 7 people drowned to death 4 Adults, 3 children, all of minority descent and all too young.

• 70 Percent of African American Kids & Teens can't swim. (CDC 12')

• If a parent can't swim, there is only a 13% chance that a child in the household will swim. 

• Men are 4 times more likely to drown than women.

• The biggest reason black people give for not learning was hydrophobia "A fear of drowning". I'll let the irrationality of that one sink in.

 Be the change, be the example. Let's burn the Black people don't swim banner!

Argue with the facts all you want it doesn't change them! "I personally hate being a statistic and don't give 2 shits why people including myself can't do something. Just do it I tell myself everything else will fall into place" How about we end the cycle #NotaStatistic #BlackPeopleSwim

Black People Love Outdoors & Adventure aka me has been haggling for months and I've secured us all an amazing deal. Here's the scoop! 

5 Package of sessions @ $22 per (1 hr) lesson = $110


(Beginner Class & Intermediate Class) - (Pay using Venmo or Chase QuikPay to [masked] very easy!)

Saturdays @ 5pm. YORKSHIRE TOWERS (UES)

• 4/30/16; 5/7/16 ; 5/14/16; 5/21/16; 5/28/16(No Lesson); 6/4/16

• Sign up now limited spots!

• Great private instructors, Nice & Heated 84 deg pool, changing rooms, close to trains. 

Come June we have a Surfing Challenge; Kayaking; White water rafting; Swimming/ Beaching, Paddle boarding; Water skiing and an Open water survival techniques class, heck we'll be finding Nemo too. So Get your life!

Spot not confirmed until payment is received.

Note: As an amazing courtesy to our group you will have the chance to make up missed classes. (Max 2. Please do not abuse this!) 

Let's get wet ;-) ~ Sorry couldn't help myself..blame the Race & Sex comedy show last week.

Recap NYC swim lesson prices: 1. JCC $296 members (~9 Classes), $376 Non-members

2. Nyc Pools Membership cost $75 for 6 months/ $150/ yr. Learn to swim is a lottery System currently session already started and has a very long wait-list.

3. Flushing Meadows Pool Qns - Lottery wait list is 6-8 months long.

4. Vanderbilt YMCA Manh- $140 members (1X/wk for 8 wks), $230 Non-members (1X/wk for 8 wks) Or $235 members (2X/wk for 8 wks), $405 Non-members (2X/wk for 8 wks). Other YMCS's may have different pricing but this gives you an idea. 

5. 92St Y Manh- Lessons ~$315

results.description:
Tensegrity Practice
Saturday, April 30th, 6:00-7:30pm

We will be learning and exploring the Tensegrity Practices developed by Carlos Castaneda. The practice is mainly focused on the Magical Passes – modernized forms of body movements which open us to our energetic core, giving us vitality and physical prowess, concentration and purpose, overall wellbeing of body, mind, emotions and spirit, and enhanced awareness.

“Malicious acts are performed by people for personal gain … Sorcerers, though, have an ulterior purpose for their acts, which has nothing to do with personal gain. The fact that they enjoy their acts does not count as gain. Rather, it is a condition of their character. The average man acts only if there is a chance for profit. Warriors say they act not for profit but for the spirit.” 
- Carlos Castaneda


Practitioners of all levels are invited to join.  Please wear comfortable clothing and bring water. No street shoes are allowed in the studio.

Contribution: $10.00

Location: 252 West 30th Street ‪#4B‬, Keystone Dance Studio (between 7th & 8th Avenues)

Eliana & Nat

We've all played TRUTH OR DARE at some point.  Some of us like to play it safe - while others enjoy a little challenge.

So, join us as we mix, mingle, and create a 100% pressure-freevibe that allows for fun connections, every single time.

+++ Great dialogue - beautiful women - tons of laughs - and prizes! +++

This time, we'll again be at the ultra-sexy 49 Grove (in the West Village) - and it'll be all ours!

It's the perfect setting for a laid-back evening of fun, casual, and stimulating conversation with eligible women - and certainly a refreshing alternative to a typical Saturday evening in the lesbian scene!

We’ve structured brand new activities/discussions/fun challenges to help facilitate the night.  We'll practically hand-hold you through the process of meeting new women.  In other words, no need to be shy.  We’ll be there to help.

So, come party with a beautiful, mature, fun-loving crowd.  Have a drink, meet someone new, and embrace new experiences... LEZ Factor style!

results.description:
Greenlight joins bookstores across the city and across the nation in celebrating the second annual Independent Bookstore Day. With special items for sale, activities throughout the day, and a party to cap things off, the bookstore is where you’ll want to be! This meet-up is completely free and takes place right after our discussion of Me Before You (separate RSVP).This RSVP is for the bookstore turn-up only.

The venue, Greenlight Bookstore, is located in Fort Greene Brooklyn between b/t S Elliot Pl & S Portland Ave.  

Directions: Short walk from our discussion venue. If you won't be attending the preceding meet-up: A or C train to Lafayette Ave. | B or Q train to Atlantic Ave | G train to Fulton St.

Schedule of Activities:


• ARTIST/ILLUSTRATOR DRAWING TABLE:

In the spirit of Draw Me!, one of the exclusive merchandise items available for Bookstore Day, Greenlight has invited talented artists, illustrators, and cartoonists to offer mini-workshops and sketching sessions! Try your hand at drawing, with all materials provided.


6:00-7:00 pm: Kate Gavino (Last Night's Reading)

• WINE RECEPTION

At 7:00 pm, the drawing table becomes the wine table as we send off Independent Bookstore Day in style!

• LITERARY CELEBRITY PHOTO BOOTH

Get your photo taken with awesome authors in a festive photo booth! Strike a pose, get crazy with props, or get your favorite book in the picture.

6:00-7:00 pm: Ashley Ford (journalist, writer, and critic)


7:00-8:00 pm: Eileen Myles (I Must be Living Twice)

8:00-10:00 pm: Open Photo Booth 

• ON THE 1'S AND 2'S:

Authors with a musical bent take a turn in the DJ booth to set the party tone. 

6:00-8:00 pm: Rob Sheffield (Love is a Mix Tape)

8:00-10:00 pm: Greg Ong (Hypothertical People)

Hope to see you there.


xo,

Noëlle

results.description:
Paname
1068 2nd Avenue (56th and 57th)
Saturday, April 30th
6:15 pm optional drinks; 7:15pm Dinner
$76 3-course French, gl of wine, coffee, tax & tip After you RSVP here, please go to the website to prepay, www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/paname/ ALL of our events are prepaid and we average 25-40 people. We do not take cash at the door as the restaurants need an accurate headcount and seating is assigned via tables and demographics. With such a large group, it is just the way restaurants will accept us. We are a membership only organization, but allow meetup members to attend some of our events to meet new faces. To see more of our events and to join, please go to www.thesinglegourmet.net Thank you for understanding.

Named after the most famous and hip slang nickname for Paris, which originally came from the Panama hats worn by French men back in the early 20th century, Paname is the brainchild of French Chef/Baker Bernard Ros formerly of Le Deauville and Meli Melo and with over 45 years’ of experience as a NYC chef, Chef Ros knows his way around a kitchen. Having first started in his parent’s restaurant in Paris, Chef Ros has spent his entire life dedicated to French food. Paname is a classic, neighborhood style French bistro and has received 4 stars on yelp and 4.5 stars on Tripadvisor. The décor of Paname is French simplicity and the atmosphere is warm and inviting. The mayor of Paris once dined here and said it is like dining at a corner restaurant of Paris. Chef/Owner Ros personally shops for every menu ingredient daily and is the pastry chef for the restaurant. Our menu includes: escargots de bourgogne, crabcakes, caesar salad maison, organic chicken breast with compote d'aubergines, pine nuts and thyme blossom, scallopine de porc with mushroom giroffle and creme fraiche, sauteed Codfish à la nicoise with tomato fondant, sauteed shrimp vadouva and a chef selection of dessert.
results.name: Paname

Our favorite Medicine Movie Night is back!!


(Organized by: Oklevueha Native American Church of New York ~ onacny.org)

Come and sit with us as we learn about how Amazonian sacred plant medicine (Ayahuasca and other teacher plants) can help humanity heal and awaken. It will be a night of amazing movie experience, Q & A panel, stories sharing, and community bonding. Yummy food and refreshment will be served.

We will be showing a documentary film in our screening studio with 8 ft. x  12 ft. huge movie screen and state-of-the-art sound system!

results.description:
Check out the pics from the Walk Around Astoria we did the last time. It was awesome!!  

Starting at the end of the N/Q line in Astoria we will casually stroll down Ditmars Blvd, then saunter along Shore Blvd next to Astoria Park following this route which has amazing views of Hell Gate Bridge, Robert F. Kennedy Bridge, Randall's Island, the East River and New York City. Like really, really amazing! Meet 6:30. Walk starts at 7 PM on the dot. Do not be late or you will miss us. 

Afterwards we can pop on over to a bar/restaurant I like to bring my people to when I hold walking events in Astoria. It's a combination of indoor and outdoor seating and they have a great selection of everything: drinks, food, ambiance, and the subway is right there too. 

Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be easy-going. The total distance is a little over 3 miles. The approximated time from start to finish is 1.5 hours with photo opp stops. 

If this is your first time attending a meetup, try not to worry too much. Around 90% of attendees are first timers so you won't be alone. Most people come solo and I encourage that. In a matter of minutes you'll be engrossed in a conversation with someone and then another and another and so on. Every 10 minutes or so I make the guys switch with the girls so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. You'll meet like a trillion people! 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of McDonald's at the last stop of the N/Q line (Ditmars Blvd) and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. Alternatively, you can CALL the organizer at [masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­

* This is an online only event. Job Seeker Apply, and they'll be contacted by Recruiters if selected *

Job Seeker Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdc

Recruiter Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdr


No long lines, No handshakes, until you're drafted!


AnalyticsWeek's Hire51 is bringing world's largest data analytics hiring drive to town. By last day of every month topdata and analytics talent applicant apply to Data Analytics Talent Drive to help us bring top data opportunities to topdata professionals.


Here's the process:

When: Each month talent run starts with first day of the month. (Data Analytics Hiring Drive resume collection stops last day of the previous month)


Where: In your own preferred city.


Process:

> For Job Seeker:

1. Applicant apply as Job Seeker at: http://math.im/dtdc

2. Anonymized candidates chosen by recruiters will be contacted via email in 3 weeks

3. Upon interview, successful drafted candidate is celebrated in #DataTalentDraft communityIf you're DRAFTED(interviewed and hired), we have some awesome swags for you.


> For Recruiter:

1. Recruiters signup using the form at: http://math.im/dtdr 

2. We will share anonymized candidate info and give a week to pick shortlisted candidates

3. Once recruiter shortlist winning profile, we will ask the candidate and send introduction

Here are some things to know about Data Analytics Hiring Drive:


• It is a continuously rolling event on monthly basis

• Candidates will be contacted once their profile is shortlisted by a recruiter

• The candidate profile is kept in database for 3 months

• Candidate with 3 months and older profile are requested to refresh the profile to activate it back again

• Hire51's Data Talent Draft works tirelessly to connect top talent with top recruiting companies

• We are designing an AI bot to scan your profile and go on a hunt to find the right job that suits your profile

• Every passing day we are getting smarter and connecting more profiles to right jobs

• You don't need to go anywhere to participate, just apply on the link given above & below and complete the process so our engine will start working to find right opportunity for you.

In case you missed the links above:

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Job-Seeker Signup @ http://math.im/dtdc

results.description:
Let's meet up to play some party games! We'll choose from games including Hollywood Game Night, Say Anything, 5 Second Rule, Telestrations & Cards Against Humanity.  If you'd like to, bring a favorite game of your own. 

Light snacks will be provided; please feel free to bring something to share with the group:) 

In case you need to call or text, I'll post my cell # as we get closer to the date.

I look forward to seeing you on the 30th! 

P.S. This apartment is home to cats, so if you're an allergy sufferer, don't forget the Claritin.

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 20 members will be attending! 

Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor.  

Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0700PM

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance), that will teach you how to dance at a club/party (Top 40, Hip Hop, etc). We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best dance music!

This lesson also includes admission to our after party immediately following, where you will be able to practice the moves you just learned! 

1st 20 tickets available for $20 ($25 after online, $30 at door) 

Prepay Here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0700PM

This is a Multi-Meetup event. Expect 20-30 members to attend. It is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced.
