results.description: Zero Otto Nove is a restaurant that serves Southern Italian specialties in the Flatiron area in NYC. Noted also for their fabulous brick style pizzas and homeade pastas. They do have a wide selection of food in their menu, so you won't be disappointed. The decor of the place is set to look like your in the heart of an Italian village. An average entree here is about $26 & an average pizza is about $16. Each couple is responsible for the cost of their own food. A nice looking bar for early arrivals. Street parking available but their are 2 public parking lots next door for those who perfer. Come join us in this end of April dining experience.
results.name: Zero Otto Nove

venue.name: Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

If you love wine and socializing then let us be your host for this great night out where the focus is on introducing you to some great wines and other fun people!  We have teamed up with several social networking groups to bring you a fantastic wine tasting event for people who love wine and those who know nothing about it!  It is a fun way to spend a Saturday evening in a classy yet casual atmosphere. The wine will be free flowing and you can fill your glass as many times as you would like if you love a particular one!!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door) - https://www.eventbrite.com/e/wine-tasting-party-for-lovers-of-socializing-wine-tickets-24219633576

The night will feature:

-A dozen top notch  wines selected by Lexington's/Madison & Vine Wine Bar wine experts for you to sample with descriptions of each.

-Delicious hot and cold appetizers.

-NYSN staff to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

-The bar will remain open for invited guests and wine tasting participants until 1am with a Live DJ

What to wear: business casual, lounge

What to expect: 40-50 people. Most come on their own

Tickets are non refundable unless the event is canceled.

Once again, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com. There will be other people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Wine Tasting Party: Free Flowing Samples-Great Wines!

results.description:
The 3rd Annual AnkhLave Juried Art Show is one of our most Premier showcases highlighting what AnkhLave is all about. It is more then an art exhibit. It is geared specifically for the showcase for People of African Decent as well as artists beyond the demographic who appreciate or are inspired by African Diaspora cultures. 

It is no secret that it is very difficult for artists of African Decent to have their work shown in premier spaces in NYC; We have broken this barrier with our African Diaspora themed Shows for the 3rd year in a row.

The event will open with food and wine, and will feature Artist Talks, Some live Performances and great community building as well as professional networking.

This event will not only display exhibited work, with our #AnkhLaveArtists being the sole beneficiaries as Creative Entrepreneurs; building the cesspool of income among the demographic. We will also introduce our #AnkhLavers (YOU) to our #AnkhLaveArtists from all over the world with the release of AnkhLave Magazine: 2D Fine Art Edition. 

AnkhLave Magazine is an a Bi Annual Release featuring 100 pages of artist profiles, portfolios, resumes, artist statements, bios and in depth interviews to get to the heart of the artist's philosophies, motivations and how it is connected or gives back to African Diaspora. AnkhLave Magazine will officially release at that night!


If you are an Artist interested in becoming an #AnkhLaveArtist, feel free to fill out the form at this link and we will reply within 24 hours: 

http://www.ankhlave.com/artist-registration.html

results.description:
Shot on location in Manhattan during the mid-'60s, Who Killed Teddy Bear? is a startling piece of dramatic filmmaking. Juliet Prowse portrays Nora, a deejay and hostess at a sleazy midtown discothèque who starts to receive obscene phone calls. Nora dismisses them, until she crosses paths with Bill Madden (Jan Murray), a grim, obsessive police lieutenant specializing in sex crimes (his obsession, as he later reveals, derives from the fact that his own wife was assaulted and murdered while out alone one night); he manages both to offend and frighten Nora with his depth of knowledge and suspicions about the kinds of people who commit those crimes. They develop a close but wary relationship even as the caller, whoever he is, proves to know not only a great deal about her personal life, but also about events transpiring right inside her apartment. She goes about her life as best she can, attending auditions and making the rounds of theaters, and socializing with her co-workers at the club, including the bus boy, Larry (Sal Mineo), who seems lonely and has a very sweet younger sister who is mildly retarded, and the club manager (Elaine Stritch).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C2M8JKrAniE

The wine will be free flowing and you can fill your glass as many times as you would like if you love a particular one!!

results.description:
Website: http://www.hrpac.org/directions_LHpark.htm

Let's capture the sunset (approx. 7:52pm) and night sky with a different view of New York City... from Weehawken!! 

Weather permitting, we will meet in front of Houlihan's.  If you plan to drive, there is free parking nearby:

http://www.hrpac.org/directions_LHpark.htm

If not, you can either take the NY Waterway Ferry at West 39th Street to Lincoln Harbor for $9.00 one way, or take the NJ Transit's bus route 158 from the Port Authority Bus Terminal to the first stop, Lincoln Harbor for $3.50 one way.  Buying tickets in advance is recommended:

http://www.nywaterway.com/Home.aspx

http://www.njtransit.com/ti/ti_servlet.srv?hdnPageAction=BusTicketsTo

* We will be moving around the harbor to 2-3 different locations, so there's no planned route.

* Make sure you are on time.  We will not answer calls or messages once the event begins.

* Dress appropriately for the weather!

* Bring your DSLR camera, or camera with a mode dial to shoot in manual mode. Review your camera's manual to review the settings. Charge your batteries and bring your empty memory cards. .

* Tripods are recommended for long exposures.  Remote is optional.

* Pack snacks and a drink.

* Bathrooms are available at Houlihan's.   Other than that, you're gonna have to hold it.

* Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

If you have any questions, text me before the day of the event. Please make sure you identify yourself in your messages so I know who you are.


~ Sally 347.878.NYCP (6927)

********************

Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.

Meetup charges organizers a semi-annual fee to maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at https://www.paypal.me/nycphotographers.  (You will see my name.) This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet outside of Houlihan's (see photo)
results.name: Cityscape Sunset from Lincoln Harbor

results.description:
Join us for this very popular upscale singles Meetup party at one of NYC's most exclusive penthouse lounges.  We will have several similar Meetup groups co-organizing and we expect 30+ members to attend the dance class and 200+ to attend the party! Plus we'll have 2 For 1 Drinks, Comp Apps, DJ, Giveaways & More!


Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor. 

https://vimeo.com/157975729


Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available): https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0700PM

Cost: $35, includes dance class 7-8pm and cover at the door for the party (21+)

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance), that will teach you how to dance at a club/party (Top 40, Hip Hop, etc). We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best dance music!

This lesson also includes admission to our after party immediately following, where you will be able to practice the moves you just learned. That's over 3 hours of dancing!

What to expect:

•  Complimentary Appetizers (8-9pm)

 • 2 For 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

•  DJ & Dancing

•  Ice Breakers

•  Prizes & Giveaways

•  200+ singles (Mostly 20s, 30s, 40s)

Prepay Here - https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0700PM

Let's party! :)

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is this event private? It will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

How many will attend? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on prey-payments, we expect 200+ members attending.
results.name: Learn How To Dance @ 230 Fifth (Includes entry to 'Spring Fling' After Party)

results.description:
Join us again in April for an awesome night of music!


Welcome to all our new members! You add another dimension to our music! An outstanding blend of instruments and vocals all contributed to the awesome sound of some of the best music we've played! We'll be at Classic Quiche in Teaneck again, where the seats are comfortable & the music is hot!

Come early @ 6:00 PM and have dinner! For the full menu, go to www.classicquiche.com.  Experience has shown that all goes smoothly, if only the voices and bass plug in and the rest is acoustic. Do bring mics if you have them.  By all means, if you're playing a solo or finger-picking, temporary amplification is fine! 
We are a friendly, inviting and inclusive group--so join us! 
Download our latest BCAM Songbook by clicking on MORE then FILES section of the Meetup site.

**NOTES 
The restaurant doesn't have a liquor license, so BYOB!

A $5 cover charge will be collected from musicians, 100% of which goes to the venue. 

FOR ALL OTHERS, A $10 MINIMUM FOOD/BEVERAGE CHARGE WILL APPLY**
results.how_to_find_us: www.classicquiche.com/
results.name: Get Together For The Joy Of Music!

results.description:
Hi All, 

I'm getting folks together for a comedy show and hang at the Grisly Pear in the West Village and we're giving everyone free pizza! If you came out to the last Saturday night show, you know you're in for a great time. We've got a great lineup of comics, who've been featured on late night shows, MTV and Comedy Central.

Tickets are $15.00, with a 2 drink minimum (normally $20, but $5 off when you mention "meetup" & drinks are cheap) and they always take good care of us with choice tables in the performance space. Be sure to mention "meetup" to the host and they'll bring you back to the right place. You can also grab advance tix HERE, if you just wanna cruise on in.


7:15: Pizza, Drinks and music from DJ Brunchy Brunch in the back area
8:00 pm: Showtime

AGE 21+

Khalid

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Montclair Film Festival is going to start in a few weeks. The event is really a great one especially those that enjoy film. Tickets are on sale already and being that this is a Saturday night, I would get my ticket ASAP as these events sell out. We will meet about 20 minutes before the film in the front so that we can cluster seats together. I might attend other films earlier in the day and if you are interested let me know.  If anyone wants to get a late bite to eat after the film or drink to discuss we can look into arranging that as well. 

Click on the site below for tickets: 

http://montclairfilmfest.org/


Movie Description: 

Iranian newcomer, Babak Anvari’s UNDER THE SHADOW, is brilliantly layered story of psychological terror and political turmoil. In war torn Tehran, married couple Shideh (the scene stealing Narges Rashidi), and Iraj (Bobby Naderi) are forced to separate when he is assigned to medical work on the front lines. Alone in the apartment with their sick young daughter Dorsa, Shideh is nursing her own pride after being repeatedly rejected from medical school as punishment for her activism. As the war escalates, evil spirits are unleashed, haunting Dorsa and Shideh. 

Genre: FictionDramaWar & ConflictThrillerHorrorForeign Language  

Section:Narrative Feature CompetitionNarrative FeatureRelease Year:2016

Runtime:84

Production Country: United Kingdom,Jordan ,Qatar
results.name: Montclair Film Festival- Under The Shadow

Female ages: 35-49 


Cost: $35.75 - $40.75 

Part 1-

Informal mingle to meet others attending and make some new friends as our host introduces you to others during this group aspect of the event . 

Part 2- Up to 15 connections in one night, each lasting 4-6 minutes long.  After each round, you will circle yes or no on your scorecard as to whether or not you would be interested in corresponding with that person further.

Part 3- Everyone is welcomed to stay and mingle get to know each other more.  Besides meeting potential people for romance potential, many attendees have made some terrific new friends and business potentials. 

At the end of the evening you will turn in your scorecard for us to tally.  The next morning you will receive an email letting you know who you matched with.  The email will provide you with the person's first name and email address and they will get your first name and email address.  We even let you know the one way matches (they picked you, but you didn't pick them), just in case you change your mind.


Prepay required HERE 

Phone: [masked] 
Entered by: Jay Rosensweig

The wine will be free flowing and you can fill your glass as many times as you would like if you love a particular one!!

http://nysnvday2015.eventbrite.com

-A dozen top notch  wines selected by wine experts for you to sample with descriptions of each.

-Delicious hot and cold appetizers.

-NYSN staff to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

-The bar will remain open for invited guests and wine tasting participants until midnight

Tickets are non refundable unless the event is canceled.

results.name: [Currently Free] email danielb1035@gmail.com

results.description:
Hi everyone, it's been a while. I cannot believe that we have already approached the end of April. Crazy, right?

If you would like to have a different kind of low key yet high quality experience for this last Saturday night of April, please come join me at the Jazz Gallery at 7:30pm (http://www.jazzgallery.org.).

Founded in 1995 by renowned jazz trumpeter Roy Hargrove, who envisioned a hub and home for the jazz musicians and composers from around the world who come to New York to take part and enhance the city's vibrant cultural scene, the Jazz Gallery is a non-profit that has been actively encouraging new jazz and young jazz musicians for two decades. It's a no-frills environment and the programming shows a great deal of thought, including many culture- and place-oriented series, mentoring programs (where an old jazz hand team up with an up-and-comer for a few sets) and premieres of new works. 


Here are the musicians who are performing this Saturday at 7:30pm:

Saxophone: Dayna Stephens https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dayna_Stephens

Trumpet: Phillip Dizack http://www.philipdizack.com

Trombone: Nick Vayenas http://www.nickvayenas.com

Piano: Gadi Lehavi from Tel Aviv (prodigy)  http://www.gadilehavi.com

Bass: Rick Rosato from Montreal http://musicians.allaboutjazz.com/rickrosato

Drums: Jonathan Pinson http://jonathanpinson.weebly.com

Cost:

$22.00. Please purchase your ticket here--->

TICKET

** Wine is available at the venue ($5.00 donation requested) but no minimum drinks requested**


How to get to the Jazz Gallery:

One block away from 28th station (N,R Line) ---> MAP

Hope to see you soon,

Angie.

results.description:
Dear Dharma Drink Friends,

Come join us to chill at a relaxing bar and listen to some blues/jazz.  We've been a couple of times and we all had a great time.  If you are free, we're headed to Session 73 to listen to Djangobilly band play blues/jazz.  The vocalist/bass guitar, Scott, is a Dharma Drinker!   

Note that the band plans to shoot a music video at the show, so if you are camera shy you can hang toward the back.  But if you don't mind being included in part of the video, step up and have a festive time.

There is no cover and the venue has a very relaxed atmosphere so you can come and go anytime.   

Eddie

Playmusician Presents:

PM is excited to host our first Jersey City NETWORK/ NIGHT BAZAAR on April 30th 2016 from 7:30 pm onwards at Transmission Jersey City featuring:-

No Cover (Lounge & Club Room)
-NETWORK / NIGHT BAZAAR (7:30-11pm) 

No Cover ( Lounge) *Drink Specials All Night Long !
-VENDOR BUSINESS MEET & GREET (11pm-midnight) 

$5 Cover (Club Room)
and a Rockin' DJ after party starting at midnight with DJ Sumie !

Come meet local aspiring artists, small & upcoming businesses, under one roof promoting & selling their products / services including clothing, accessories, art work, jewelry, desserts, and many other exciting products !


---------------------------------------------------------

DJ Sumie will be spinning at the AFTER PARTY.   "By throwing dance parties in her college dorm room, DJ Sumie quickly realized her knack for getting the crowd on the dance floor.   She deejayed her way through school and now she is an attorney by day and DJ by night.   She spins Bollywood, Bhangra, Euro Pop, Old School Hip Hop and everything in between. Catch her on the dance floor and on the internet @djsumie."

Get your tickets for the DJ AFTER PARTY here: http://playmusician.eventbrite.com/


--------------------------------------------------------------------------

CALL TO VENDORS - Spots / Tables Still Available !
We are currently inviting local businesses to participate as vendors for our event - it's a great opportunity to reach out to the diverse population in Jersey City, Hoboken, Exchange place and Hudson county. If you and your business are excited to become a vendor at the Night Bazaar please email us at [masked] or call us at[masked] .

Table Pricing is very reasonably priced and and is an excellent opportunity to network/showcase and sell your products or services -All in One Night .

Banner Spots are available, and a Business Card Exchange Station will be made available for all Vendors.

An exciting Nightime Indoor Bazaar Vibe + Network & Party !
Brought to you by your friendly neighbourhood Playsters :)
More Info to be posted .. Stay Tuned. Stay Fresh. 

-------------------------

Venue:  Transmission, 150 Bay Street, Jersey City . NJ 07302

RSVP & More info here:  

https://www.facebook.com/events/1726733394205736/

Arts . Community . Events

results.description:
Arriving in New York from the Netherlands in 1992 with just his bass and a suitcase, Joris took lessons with Ron Carter, quickly met many musicians, and started to work as a jazz musician. A year later he recorded his first CD, with a band co-led by Don Braden and featuring Cyrus Chestnut, Carl Allen and Tom Harrell. He has been working with the “who-is-who in Jazz”, including Benny Golson, Sonny Fortune, Rashied Ali, Billy Hart, and Randy Brecker. Established as a composer, record producer (many different labels and artists), educator (director of Jazz Studies at the Hanze University, Bass Professor at Queens College, NY) and bandleader, Joris Teepe comes to the Puffin to perform his Jazz Trio.

Suggested Donation $10

results.description:
Join us for this very popular upscale singles Meetup party at one of NYC's most exclusive penthouse lounges.  

We will have several similar Meetup groups co-organizing and we expect 200+ to attend! Plus we'll have 2 For 1 Drinks, Comp Apps, DJ, Giveaways & More! 

*Get Tickets Here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/springfling15/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0800PM

*1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout . 

What to expect:

•  Complimentary Appetizers (8-9pm)

 • 2 For 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

•  DJ & Dancing

•  Ice Breakers

•  Prizes & Giveaways

•  200+ singles (Mostly 20s, 30s, 40s) 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/springfling15/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0800PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door 

Is this event private? It will be 100% private for our Meetup party. Members can invite guests to join us. 

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non-ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s. 

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

How many will attend? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on prey-payments, we expect 200+ members attending. 

Pre-Pay Here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/springfling15/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0800PM

results.description:
Join 300+ professional singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline. 

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers

• 2 for 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

Price: $20 with RSVP, or $30 at door without RSVP if space allows.

Note, this is not an Asian-only event, but we have a LARGE Asian following, so you can expect to see lots of Asian singles in attendance!


What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non age/ethnic specific. All are welcome, 21+.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending.

*Get Tickets Here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/springfling15/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0800PM

*1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout .

What to expect:

•  Complimentary Appetizers (8-9pm)

 • 2 For 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

•  DJ & Dancing

•  Ice Breakers

•  Prizes & Giveaways

•  200+ singles (Mostly 20s, 30s, 40s) 

1st 15 tickets are just $15 with discount code "15" at checkout - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/springfling15/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0800PM

$20 after that online w/ RSVP, $30 at the door 

Is this event private? It will be 100% private for our Meetup party. Members can invite guests to join us. 

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non-ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s. 

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

How many will attend? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on prey-payments, we expect 200+ members attending. 

Pre-Pay Here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/springfling15/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0800PM

results.description:
* This is an online only event. Job Seeker Apply, and they'll be contacted by Recruiters if selected *

Job Seeker Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdc

Recruiter Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdr


No long lines, No handshakes, until you're drafted!


AnalyticsWeek's Hire51 is bringing world's largest data analytics hiring drive to town. By last day of every month topdata and analytics talent applicant apply to Data Analytics Talent Drive to help us bring top data opportunities to topdata professionals.


Here's the process:

When: Each month talent run starts with first day of the month. (Data Analytics Hiring Drive resume collection stops last day of the previous month)


Where: In your own preferred city.


Process:

> For Job Seeker:

1. Applicant apply as Job Seeker at: http://math.im/dtdc

2. Anonymized candidates chosen by recruiters will be contacted via email in 3 weeks

3. Upon interview, successful drafted candidate is celebrated in #DataTalentDraft communityIf you're DRAFTED(interviewed and hired), we have some awesome swags for you.


> For Recruiter:

1. Recruiters signup using the form at: http://math.im/dtdr 

2. We will share anonymized candidate info and give a week to pick shortlisted candidates

3. Once recruiter shortlist winning profile, we will ask the candidate and send introduction

Here are some things to know about Data Analytics Hiring Drive:


• It is a continuously rolling event on monthly basis

• Candidates will be contacted once their profile is shortlisted by a recruiter

• The candidate profile is kept in database for 3 months

• Candidate with 3 months and older profile are requested to refresh the profile to activate it back again

• Hire51's Data Talent Draft works tirelessly to connect top talent with top recruiting companies

• We are designing an AI bot to scan your profile and go on a hunt to find the right job that suits your profile

• Every passing day we are getting smarter and connecting more profiles to right jobs

• You don't need to go anywhere to participate, just apply on the link given above & below and complete the process so our engine will start working to find right opportunity for you.

In case you missed the links above:

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Job-Seeker Signup @ http://math.im/dtdc

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Recruiter Signup @ http://math.im/dtdr

</a>

<a href="https://talentdraft.eventbrite.com/?access=dtd">

</a>

<a href="https://talentdraft.eventbrite.com/?access=dtd">
results.name: #GetHired through Hire51's Data Analytics Hiring Drive (Virtual Event)

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open on the WEDNESDAY before the Meetup at 8:00pm. (NEW POLICY) 


RSVP's close at 6:00pm the night of the game

Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
Join 300+ professional singles at Manhattan's largest and most spectacular penthouse lounge, 230 Fifth, which is surrounded by floor to ceiling windows with breathtaking panoramic views of the NYC skyline. 

What to expect: 

• Free Light Appetizers

• 2 for 1 Drinks (8-9pm)

• Ice Breakers

• DJ & Dancing

• Giveaways

• 300+ singles 

Price: Only $20 with RSVP, or $30 at door without RSVP.

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur

Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non age/ethnic specific. All are welcome, 21+.

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 300+ members attending.

What's the venue like? 230 Fifth was voted #1 by Citysearch for Best New Bars/Lounges in New York City Voted ,#2 Best New Bar/Lounge in the United States by Citysearch, and voted #1 "To Do" in New York by Spur.

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. It's non-ethnic specific. General age range 20s-40s. 

Can I come alone? Most come on their own. If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet others. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

How many will attend? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. Based on prey-payments, we expect 200+ members attending. 

Pre-Pay Here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/springfling15/dates/Apr-30-2016_at_0800PM

venue.name: Let My People Go @ Seven Bar Grill (by Penn Sta)

results.description:
Prepay required HERE


Men: 35-49
Wom: 32-45


Weekenddating has teamed up with http://www.letmypeoplego.com to bring you this special Jewish event.  Up to 15 connections in one night.


Part 1-

Informal mingle to meet others attending and make some new friends as our host introduces you to others during this group aspect of the event . 

Part 2- Up to 15 connections in one night, each lasting 4-6 minutes long.  After each round, you will circle yes or no on your scorecard as to whether or not you would be interested in corresponding with that person further.

Part 3- Everyone is welcomed to stay and mingle get to know each other more.  Besides meeting potential people for romance potential, many attendees have made some terrific new friends and business potentials. 

At the end of the evening you will turn in your scorecard for us to tally.  The next morning you will receive an email letting you know who you matched with.  The email will provide you with the person's first name and email address and they will get your first name and email address.  We even let you know the one way matches (they picked you, but you didn't pick them), just in case you change your mind.

Prepay required HERE

<a href="http://www.weekenddating.com"></a>

results.description:
We're going to Governor's Comedy Club in Levittown this Saturday to see headliner Dan Levy.

We want to meet there at 8:45. The show starts at 9:30. It's better if you reserve your tickets in advance by visiting the Governor's site.

We'd like to get an idea of who's coming, so please get back to me as soon as you can.

It should be a fun night.

-Ross
results.name: Comedy Meet-up

results.description:
Enjoy some of the hottest standup comedians in NYC. 


Doors Open: 8:30pm
Show Starts: 9ish (though you can arrive late, no problemo)
Show Ends: 10:30pmish (then time to shmooze and make new friends and commiserate about our favorite comedians. You love Louis CK too? No way! )

NO COVER IF YOU RSVP NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
$10 cover at the door without an early bird RSVP.


Bring a date. Brings friends. Or come alone and see if you can score a date there. It's happened before. Actually quite often! Regardless, you'll definitely have a great time and see some really great comics! Don't believe me?... Checkout these reviews from recent meetup attendees:

"Went by myself but had a great time meeting new ppl..would come back anytime:)"


"Last night was a great first experience. Good comedy... and some wonderful conversation. Looking forward to the next time :)"

"Good time... Looking forward to more comedy shows from ya'all!!!"

"I had a great time! Everyone was friendly so going by yourself is okay- you will meet people!"

"It was pretty cool. Would totally go again"

Here's highlights from recent New York Comedy Fans meetups:

http://vimeo.com/114251313

https://vimeo.com/102021699

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Join us for fun and competition... RSVP NOW! Limited spots available.

We are going INDOORS in Brooklyn for SATURDAY NIGHTS

9:00 PM- 10:00 PM (1 hour Group Drill for BEGINNER/INTERMEDIATE) COST $25 p.p.; 10:00 PM - 11:00 PM (followed by 1 hour match play) $15:  Total Cost $40

(HIGH INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED) Cost:  $30 p.p. includes two hours of indoor tennis with same level players, balls, water & light food.

(BEGinner, INTermediate, ADVanced players are grouped in their designated categories)

Please note there is very limited space available...   

MUST RSVP NOW and specify Group drill & match play OR Match Play Only.

PLEASE ARRIVE AT 8:55 PM.

Please note that NY Social Tennis is here to provide fun & competition, please feel free to contact us with your thoughts, concerns, or preference. 

What to Expect... (Warm-up, hitting/drill before placement into levels to play; please feel free to specify if you have a preference... (singles, doubles, mixed).  We will do our best to accommodate!

Look forward to meeting and playing tennis... LET'S HAVE SOME FUN & COMPETITION!

Thanks,

Lily :)

RSVP...

http://www.meetup.com/nystennismb/events/230604974/

results.description:
We have a full field permit at 9:00 pm at Pier 40 through June 18, 2016. We are looking to grow and develop the sport, so we need players, and bring friends! If we can build this to a sustaining level we'll extend it into the summer and fall. Show off your skills or learn some new ones, and have a great run!!


We are planning a full field game so we need at least enough people to field two teams.  D-poles are welcome and if you know any goalies bring them along. Try to arrive 15 minutes early so we can go live at 9:00 PM!!!  See you Saturday!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
